Rafalea es la presidenta del banco comunal, vive en el barrio Juana A., en la casa D. su cuñada, cuenta con una tienda D. barrio la cual es la pricipal fuente D. sus ingresos, su esposo es el Sr. Estanislao  se dedica a la actividad D. zapateria. el prestamo actual solcitado es para aumentar su capital D. trabajo en su tiendita e iniciar el negocio D. venta D. comidas.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Neydi, es la tesorera del banco D. empredimiento, es una persona muy trabajadora la cual vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa D. anticretico. ella juntamente con su esposo el Sr. Felix trabajan con el negocio D. cerrajeria. la cual entrega pedidos y tambien lleva sus trabajos a la feria D. la zona del plan 3000. el credito actual solicitado es para la compra D. hierro ya que actualmente cuentan con bastante pedido.                                                                                                                                    Beatriz, es una D. las jefas D. grupo es la tercera vez que trabaja con nuestra institucion, la sra. vive en el barrio Juana A. con su esposo el Sr. Alfredo  y sus dos hijos. ella se dedica  a la venta D. ropa no tiene puesto fijo es ambulante su esposo se dedica a la actividad D. albañileria, su objetivo es llegar a tener su puesto fijo para poder vender ropa. el credito actual solicitado es para la compra D. mas mercaderia para surtir la venta D. ropas poruque fuera D. ropa tambien quiere vender calzados.
texts.en:
The 6th Cycle of Enterprise Bank was founded on January 25th, 2008. Rafalea is the president of the community bank and lives in the Juana A. neighborhood in her sister-in-law's house. She has a neighborhood store which is her principal source of income. Her husband is a shoemaker. The loan that she is requesting is to increase resources in her little shop and begin selling food. Neydi is the treasurer of the Enterprise Bank and a hardworking person. She lives with her husband and two children in a rented house. Together with her husband Felix she works with the locksmith's shop completing orders and taking their work to the flea markets in the 3000 neighborhood. The loan they are requesting is purchase iron as they currently have many orders to complete. Beatriz is one of the bosses of of the group and it is the third time that she has worked with our organization. She lives in the Juana A. neighborhood with her husband Alfredo and their two children. She sells clothing for a living but does not have a permanent stand (she travels). Her husband is a bricklayer and her goal is to have a permanent stand from which to sell her clothes. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of more merchandise to supply the sale of clothes because asiD. from selling clothes she also wants to sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel French, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Work Resources

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is thirty-six years old. She is married with three children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling soft drinks in her neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says the selling of soft drinks is very lucrative and therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Juan Amilcar

texts.es: Juan Amílcar G. E. de 43 años de edad, reside en Apopa, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos. Juan posee una venta de trapeadores, los cuales el también los elabora con la ayuda de su esposa. Así mismo cultiva maíz junto a su hijo mayor, producto el cual lo vende por mayor a sus clientes. Juan es un hombre muy responsable el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, y así mismo ha sabido enseñarles a sus hijos el valor del trabajo. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de los trapeadores, ya que es este el negocio más rentable para Juan debido a que sus ganancias son diarias y los puede vender durante todo el año, a diferencia del maíz el cual debe esperar a que este listo para vender. Juan desea poder mejorar la economía de su hogar y de esta manera brindarles todo lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Amílcar G. E. is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in Apopa, San Salvador. Juan makes and sells mops with his wife’s help. He also grows corn with his oldest son and sells it at wholesale. Juan is very responsible and cares about his family’s well being. He has taught his sons the value of work. He is requesting a loan to buy materials to make mops. This is the most profitable business for Juan since it provides daily income and can be sold year round. Corn on the other hand, has a waiting time until it’s ready for sale. Juan hopes to improve his family’s income and to be able to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make mops.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo N. C., tiene la edad de 48 años, está  casado, y tiene dos hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Uno tiene 17 y el otro 12 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Bernardo tiene 8 hectáreas de pasto brisanta, gamalote, toledo y otros, todos para el desarrollo y engorde del ganado.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Bernardo N. C. is 48 years old, he is married and has two children who are his greatest priority. One is 17 and the other is 12. He wants the credit to buy cattle. His idea is to have cattle for a double purpose (meat and milk). He wants to keep the cattle adequately so he can obtain the highest possible earnings when it's sold. This is not the first time he asks for a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the conditions they've given him. Mr. Bernardo has 8 hectares of pasture of different kinds (brisanta, gamalote, toledo and others), all good for breeding and fattening cattle. In the future he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more financial stability, as well as being able to grow both as a person and as a cattle breeder. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase  oil, beans, tomatoes, and onions in bulk

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida L. K. is 55 years old and married to a farmer. They have six children who are between the ages 25 and six years old. Her business is located at Khayega, a busy market in Kakamega, where for the last five years she has made a living selling tomatoes, onions and other vegetables as well as maize and beans. She says that this business is profitable, with the major challenge being that there are many people who offer similar products for sale. But she works very hard to keep her business doing well, and has applied for a loan of Kes 30,000 to buy more tomatoes, onions and vegetables to sell. She hopes to buy her own farm some day because she is a very hardworking and visionary lady.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sreimoa

texts.en: Mrs. Sreimoa K. is a 33-year-old married woman who lives in Chek village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Theng Sorn, are farmers who own a one-hectare field to cultivate rice. Right now, their soil is infertile and they do not have enough money to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Sreimoa K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her crops. Mrs. Sreimoa K. is a mother of four children, one of whom is a farm laborer and the other three are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Byambaahuu

texts.en: Byambaahuu is 65 years old and lives with his wife in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, Tomortulga, works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Byambaahuu operates a grocery store in his town with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1998 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD), and since then, he and his wife have built a stable operation. Today, his working capital exceeds 4,000,000 tugrugs (~ 2815 USD). They have been planning to expand their grocery store with their earnings in the future. Byambaahuu is a very hard working person who has good communication skills. He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase a variety of products from Narantuul trading center, the biggest market in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Cinthya Lissette

texts.es:
La joven Cinthya R. tiene la edad de 21 años, es casada y sin hijos, es estudiante de la carrera de Contaduría Publica Y Finanzas en la Universidad de Ciencias Comerciales en la ciudad de León, donde cursa el tercer año, al mismo tiempo trabaja como contador para la empresa que se dedica a la exportación de camarones (CAMANICA) desde hace dos años, su esposo es profesional y trabaja en una empresa familiar que se dedica al sector transporte urbano.
Cinthya es el primer crédito que Ceprodel le facilita, ya que ella quiere pagar los gastos de la universidad (matricula y otros).
texts.en:
La joven Cinthya R. tiene la edad de 21 años, es casada y sin hijos, es estudiante de la carrera de Contaduría Publica Y Finanzas en la Universidad de Ciencias Comerciales en la ciudad de León, donde cursa el tercer año, al mismo tiempo trabaja como contador para la empresa que se dedica a la exportación de camarones (CAMANICA) desde hace dos años, su esposo es profesional y trabaja en una empresa familiar que se dedica al sector transporte urbano. Cinthya es el primer crédito que Ceprodel le facilita, ya que ella quiere pagar los gastos de la universidad (matricula y otros).

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos de Universidad

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking man who owns a barber shop.  He has been in this business for three years.  He is 32 years old and married.  Peter works hard in his business because he is the breadwinner in his family.  He is a member of Amani group in Faulu Kenya and saves his money weekly with the group.  This has made him invest in his business.  

Peter has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy more shaving machines.  He believes that if he adds more machines he would provide his services efficiently.  He dreams of having a well established business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shaving machines

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is married with two daughters. She is a small-scale market entrepreneur from Vasilyevka. Elvira sells men's outerwear, like shirts, sweaters, etc., in one of the local marketplaces. Her merchandise is trendy and of good quality, which helps her attract new customers and keep a loyal clientele base. Elvira has been in this business for six years. Presently, her gross income amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Elvira is seeking a 4,800 Grivnya loan to increase her stock, and her sales as a result. She has a big family as her elder daughter and her grandson are living with her. Elvira works hard to provide for her family's needs. She knows the market and likes working with this type of inventory. She is hoping to continue developing her trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 36 and married with three small children. She provides a manicure and pedicure service in the local community and has been engaged in her business for over 16 years earning approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Vivian joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Vivian from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson G. M. is thirty years old, married, and has two sons aged nine years old and four years old. His business is located in Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for its production of pineapples. He has been selling fruit such as bananas, water melon, oranges, apples, mangoes, avocados, paw paws and pineapples for the last three years to the local people. He also supplies fruits to other fruit vendors in the area. 

Benson says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business as his and so customers are not very loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more fruits to expand his business. He hopes to expand his business to wholesale, open up a food processing plant and become the manager. He describes himself as charismatic, hard-working and focused.

loans.use: buying more fruit for resale

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy tiene 47 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 20 años se dedica en la elaboración D. bordados artesanales, en prendas típicas D. vestir D. su zona. DesD. la comodidad D. su casa, trabaja repartiendo su tiempo entre los labores domesticas y esta actividad artesanal. En temporadas festivas, entre el mes D. junio y julio, es donD. aumentan sus rentas así como la demanda D. estos bordados. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, para ella es una distracción, combinándola con la habilidad utilizar bien los colores en sus  bordados. Por tanto no dejará D. trabajar con el fin D. progresar casa vez más. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. materiales, como: hilos y telas para seguir bordando.
texts.en:
Yudy is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For more than twenty years, she has been producing artisan embroideries and items of clothing typical to the area. From the comfort of her own home, she splits her time between carrying out the domestic tasks and spending time on this artisan craft. During the festive seasons, between June and July, the demand for these embroideries increases, along with her income. She enjoys her work very much; for her it is a hobby and allows her to demonstrate her ability to make good use of colours in her embroideries. She therefore does not intend to stop working and wants to progress further and further with her business. This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a means of financial support as she has always proved to be responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal group because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. She will invest the loan requested in the purchase of materials such as threads and fabrics to continue her embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz joined ASHI in 2005; aiming to get out of the spiral of poverty, and consistently acquire working capital for her "sari-sari" (variety) store and food vending ventures. She has been engaged in these businesses for more than 6 years now. Luz will use this Kiva loan, amounting to PHP 38,000, to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari (variety) store and supply the maintenance of her food vending ventures.

Luz is grateful to ASHI-Kiva for the good heart it shows to the poor, like her family, and really helping them to reach her dreams. That is why Luz has grown to love the institution very much and all the lenders who are sponsoring this loan.

She hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall in the market place for her food vending business, instead of just in her house, and wishes to be able to make enough money to pay for the needs of her family. She also dreams of the best of life for her family that live together.

Luz is seen as older, but she is strong woman of courage who will battle challenges in order to achieve her goals in life. Luz is a caring mother of one daughter.  Luz enjoys considering that the loan from ASHI and Kiva partner will change their lives, provide for her family's needs, and continue to the expansion of her businesses.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her sari-sari (variety) store and maintain her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani lives in a three-room brick house in a small city of south Punjab, Pakistan, called Chichawatni, which is famous for its agriculture. Rani is 20 years of age, born in Chichawatni and grew up here. She got married at an early age to M. A. who has manufactured furniture for the last ten years.
She has two children, 2 year old Akram and 4 month old Rizwan. She is a housewife who takes care of her family by staying at home.
  
Rani’s husband is in need of money because he wants to buy wood in bulk to fill a large order. Therefore, Rani has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband in this regard. She is hopeful that by investing money in her husband’s business, he will be able to make good profits as a result of fulfilling larger orders. She also hopes that an increase in income will make it possible for her family to enjoy a better standard of living and that she will be able to educate her children once they become older. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and she is expecting that it will be a good experience for her.

loans.use: Purchase wood for furniture-making business

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude N. lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (three relatives).   Gertrude has a business selling fish.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 1 day out of every week. Gertrude sells her products at the market at wholesale prices.   Gertrude has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish.   She also generates additional income by selling water and passion fruit juice from her refrigerator. The main business challenge(s) for Gertrude are thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are enhancing the development of her life style.   Gertrude lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, mediation and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Daisy Antonio's Group

texts.en: Daisy A. is from the village of Buena Suerte, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Daisy is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Daisy is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Daisy operates a motorcycle transport business. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia P. is from the village of Francfort, Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Herminia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products, and also retailing rice per kilogram in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Herminia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Herminia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 7th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una madre de familia de 57 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo en el sector La Pradera del distrito de Pimentel, una zona urbano – marginal que se encuentra situada a diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes. Ella cría a estos animales en un ambiente de su vivienda alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Los vende al publico en general y a los criadores particulares. Estos animales tienen bastante acogida en el mercado debido a que su carne es muy estimada y consumida en los hogares de todo el país. Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Bertha desea mejorar los corrales que posee con la compra de javas y mallas. Asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado, todo esto con la finalidad de mejorar la crianza de sus animales y percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

Bertha es una mujer responsable y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y de ese modo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha is the mother of a family, she is 57 years old and she lives together with her husband in the community of La Pradera of the Pimentel district. It is a suburban region located about 10 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells guinea pigs. She raises them from a customized cage in her home feeding them grains and natural grasses. She sells them to the general public and to private owners.  These animals are in great demand in the market because their meat is well liked and consumed in home in the entire country. With this business she is able to contribute with her husband, an agriculturist, toward the family's finances. 

Bertha wishes to improve the cages with the purchase of wire meshes. She also wants to purchase balanced feed in order to ensure the animals are raised in optimal conditions and be able to see an improvement in earnings. She has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles in order to achieve her goal. 

Bertha is a responsible woman who enjoys her work. Her goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To upgrade cages.

loans.name: Raquel Francico

texts.pt:
Raquel Francisco Macave M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhas de 18 e 20 anos de idade e todos vão a Escola. Fez 6ª classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e sustenta a mãe e sobrinha que vivem com ela.

Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, tem um negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 4 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum através de xitique diário (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, óleo, peixe, caldos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu produto.

 Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo e pedir outro credito, para construir uma banca no quintal da sua casa.
texts.en:
Raquel Francisco Macave M. was born in the city of Maputo, province of the same name, south of Mozambique, she is a single mother with 2 daughters who are 18 and 20 years old and they go to school. Raquel studied until the 6th grade because of lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her children and supports her mom and a nice who live with her.

She never left the city of Maputo, she has a grocery store for the last 4 years, she doesn't have any employees and is able to profit close to 3,000mt a month which she applies to household expenses and is able to save some money thru a traditional saving system.

She never had a loan with other banks, and learned about Hluvuku thru a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for 8,000mt which she expects to use to buy products (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others) to increase the quantity of her products.

She is confident she will pay on time and will request another loan to build a store in a section of her house.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, flour, oil, fish, soups, among others)

loans.name: Kelly

texts.en: Kelly sells bedsheets for a living and is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase bedsheets to sell. She is 42 years old and married with three children. She hopes to be financially independent in the future with a big business. This is her first loan and it is guaranteed by Nairobi Hair Beauty Forum SHG. She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old single man from Bint Jbeil, working in construction since 2004 on his own account with 9 years of experience. He specializes in cement. Ali is requesting a loan for the first time from A. Majmoua in order to buy a cement mixer necessary for his business.  This blender/mixer eases his work a lot and makes more work in less time. 

Ali is recommended by his neighbors and friends, they believe he’s a hard worker. Ali is committed to his clients and is true to his word.  He hopes to open a construction company that can help him in making a small happy family.

loans.use: To buy a cement mixer

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El señor Juan vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado tiene 2 hijos, la actividad que realiza es la de transporte publico todos los días, generando de esta manera sus ingresos diarios, la esposa trabaja en una limpieza de ropa donde percibe un salario con el cual ayuda a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una radio de comunicación porque está ingresando a trabajar a una empresa de radio taxis y le piden que tenga una radio de comunicaciones propia. 

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por el carácter social califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives in his parents' house in the Alto Sopocachi district of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children.  His business activity is providing public transport every day.  This is how he makes his daily income.  His wife works cleaning clothes and she makes a salary which helps the family.

Juan's loan will be used to buy a two-way radio because he is starting work with a radio taxi company and they have asked him to supply his own two-way radio.

Juan is an existing client of Impro and he makes his repayments very well.  His social profile qualifies him to receive a loan.

loans.use: To buy a two-way radio to work for a radio taxi company

loans.name: Em's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Em S. O. is 41 years old.  He is the leader of this group loan, having been selected by the other members. They are located in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mr. Em S. O. is a farmer who owns a plot of land which he uses to grow mango for a living.  To support this farming, he would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. His wife, Mrs. Chhay S. O., is 42 years old.  She earns income by knitting clothes.  

This couple has six children: one is employed in a company while the others are attending the local schoO..

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for mango farm

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 45 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta de ropa que ella misma confecciona como vestidos, pantalones para damas y ropa para niños, la socia trabaja desde su casa a pedido, esta es una actividad que siempre le gusto y se siente feliz ya que está trabajando en algo que le gusta y a la vez le llena de satisfacciones una de ella es económica el cual le sirve para pagar sus deudas pendientes y comprar cosas q necesita.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como hilos, telas, reglas de costura entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Mujeres Unidas ["United Women"] communal bank. The bank is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Sonia. She is 45, lives with her partner, and has 2 children. She sells clothing that she makes herself, such as dresses and skirts for women and clothing for children. She works from home, filling orders. This is a job that she has always enjoyed and she is happy to be working in something that she likes. It fills her with satisfaction and provides her with an income to pay off her debt and purchase things that she needs.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for her business such as threads, fabric and sewing rulers, among other items.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for her business such as threads, fabric, and sewing rulers among other items.

loans.name: Darwin Jose

texts.es: Darwin tiene 25 años, es soltero tiene 1 hijo. El señor se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, entre lo que se destaca cuajada, crema, queso, leche y leche agria. El dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 10 años, el empezó trabajando con sus papa, que anteriormente se hacía cargo del negocio, de allí que el quedo comercializando estos productos. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima, ya que actualmente es lo que está generando mayor ganancia. El distribuye sus productos a las pulperías y ciertas personas que llegan a comprar sus productos. El sueña siempre establecer un negocio en el mercado de Managua, que sea mayorista de los productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Darwin is 25 years old, single, and has one child.  His business is selling dairy products, including 'cuajada' (a cheese-like dairy product), cheese, milk and 'leche agria' (a fermented milk product).  He started 10 years ago, working with his parents who used to be in charge of the business.  He took over selling these products.

Darwin will invest this loan in buying raw materials since this is what currently makes most profit.  He distributes his products to grocery stores and some people come to buy his products directly from him.  He dreams of setting up a business in Managua market, becoming a dairy product wholesaler.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 41 year old married man living in Tayouneh with his wife and two kids. Ali works as a tailor. In addition to his work, and because of the expensive financial situation everyone is passing through these days, Ali opened a small grocery store in his shop where he sells milk, coffee, chips, candies, rice, oil and water. He opened this shop in 2007, and work is going fine. Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new textiles and tailoring tools necessary to improve his business. This is Ali's third time dealing with Al Majmoua. All his loans were for improving the business, and had a good impact. he hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy new textiles and tailoring tools

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, es una mujer trabajadora de 37 años. Junto con su esposo  Wilder, velan por sus 5 hijos a los que educan con mucho amor, en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica está increíble mujer es la agricultura, hace 5 años que viene sembrando café, naranja y tangello. Su esmero y dedicación constante en sus terrenos agrícolas le proporcionan buenos ingresos económicos, tanto así que los mismos compradores vienen a su misma chacra a negociar sus frutos. Del mismo modo coparte su tiempo ayudando a otros agricultores a cuidar de sus cultivos, de esta manera obtiene un dinero extra. Ahora comenzará la temporada de “rebusca” de su cosecha de café (extracción de los primeros granos maduros), donde piensa obtener una buena ganancia. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “flor de almendra”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una mujer responsable y espera obtener buenas resultados con el trabajo de su asociación. Teresa, tiene 4 almácigos de café (plantaciones a base de bolsas negras con tierra fértil), que trasplantará a sus terrenos agrícolas en estos días, por ello con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono, herramientas, y el pago de los peones que le ayudarán en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking 37 year-old woman.  Together with her husband, Wilder, they take care of their 5 children, who they educate with much love in their own home which is located in the indigenous community of Kivinaki in the central Peruvian forest.  This incredible woman is a farmer.  For 5 years she has planted coffee, oranges and tangelos.  Her contant care and dedication to her farm land creates good income for them, so much so that the same buyers come back to her to negotiate prices for her fruit.  She also splits her time helping other farmers to take care of their crops, and this way earns extra money.  The "foraging" season is now beginning for her coffee crop (when they take off the first mature beans), and she hopes to obtain good income from it.  

She belongs to the village bank "Flor de Almendra" and this is her first loan with MFP, where she is known as a responsible woman and hopes for good results from the work with this association.  Teresa has four seedbeds of coffee (plantings in black bags with fertile soil) that she will transplant to her farmland during this season.  With the loan that she requests, she will invest in buying compost, tools, and paying workers to help her with the farming.

loans.use: Buy sacks of compost, tools and hire someone to help her with the crops

loans.name: Cesar Mateo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Cesar Mateo; el tiene 68 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como cuyes, el socio lleva años en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que es una actividad que le gusta mucho, el socio lleva a estos animalitos a las ferias sabatinas que se realizan en la plaza de Túpac Amaru del Cusco ahí el socio vende a sus animalitos a las persona que le solicitan a la vez el socio vende a los restaurantes, picanterías y a todos sus clientes.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de alimentos para sus cuyes como pasto, maíz, comida mejorada para sus animalitos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
This is Cesar Mateo.  He is a member of the communal bank, Comuzone III, which is located in the District of Cusco, pertaining to the Province and Department of Cusco.

He is 68 years old, married, and has 4 children.  For many years, he has been raising livestock, a job that he feels happy about and that he likes very much.  He takes his animals to fairs which occur in the Plaza of Tupac Amaru del Cusco, and sells them to individuals, to restaurants, to butcher shops, and to whomever else wants to buy them.

He is seeking a credit to purchase feed for his livestock, such as corn and other improved food for his animals. 

He is very happy about the loan and promises to fulfill all of his payments.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his livestock, such as corn and better food for his animals.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 37 years old, married and has 2 young children. She lives in her own house in the district of La Matanza in the province of Morropon, more than 4 hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over 2 years, Doris has earned a living by preparing and selling chicha, a typical Peruvian drink made from corn and flour. She makes the drink in her own home and sells it to restaurants, bars and the general public in her community. She is very well-known in her market and has a loyal customer base. She would like to increase her production by buying more ingredients to make her product. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. She hopes to increase her sales and income so that she can continue supporting her husband with their household and family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the production of her refreshments

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima works hard to support five children. She is married and has an aqua-farming business in the Philippines.

Fatima requested a PHP 1,500 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to avoid future lung diseases resulting from continued toxic smoke inhalation.

Fatima is also aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Bujubuli Agriculture Farmers Group

texts.en: Nathan wants a loan to buy banana stems for planting on his plantation. He is a Ugandan man, age 35, and father to seven children between the ages of 8 and 18 years old. He owns a semipermanent house and dreams of educating his children. He is a farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for six years. He is still reaping tangible benefits. He is a member of Bujubuli Agriculture Farmers Organisation, whose members guarantee each other.

loans.use: to buy banana suckers for planting.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni de 20 años de edad, vive en su casa propia de sus padres, la cual cuenta con el servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito Catacaos que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que desarrolla la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y artesana (alfarería y metalurgia).

Marleni se dedica a la comercialización de chicha de jora (bebida realizada a base de maíz molido que lo dejan fermentar y luego le colocan otros insumos y está lista para consumirla) y de harina de maíz, lo prepara en su mismo domicilio, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años  y lo ofrece a sus clientes que la conocen, de esta manera ella ayuda económicamente a sus padres, para poder solventar los gastos.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para seguir elaborando la chicha de jora que vende y la harina de maíz, los pedidos  que le hacen le permite tener mayores ganancias, ya que su clientela se ha incrementado considerablemente,  para poder pagar su cuota mensual y de paso mejorar la calidad de vida de su casa.  Marleni a pesar de su juventud y de la competencia desea que su negocio crezca, ya que su meta es que con los ingresos  que obtenga pueda  tener estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Marleni is 20 years old and lives in her parents' home which they own.  Their home has piped water and electricity, and is located in Catacaos district, in Piura department.  People in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts (pottery and metal working).

Marleni sells 'chicha de jora' (a drink made from fermented, ground corn which has other ingredients added to it and is then ready to drink).  She also sells corn flour.  She prepares these products in her home and has been doing this for four years.  She offers her products to customers who know her.  In this way, she helps her parents to financially cover their expenses.

Marleni has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy supplies so that she can continue making 'chicha de jora' and corn flour.  The orders that people place with her allow her to make more profits since her customer base has increased considerably.  She will be able to make her monthly loan repayments and also improve her family's quality of life.  In spite of her youth and the competition that she faces, Marleni would like her business to grow since her goal is to use the profits that she makes to pay for her own higher education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making 'chicha de jora' and corn flour

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es: Pedro Eduardo tiene su actividad que es la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene más de 7 años en su negocio, Pedro tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Inicio este medio de vida con la necesidad de sufragar ingresos diariamente a su hogar, es una persona muy inteligente siempre busca la forma de pagar sus cuotas. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de leche, cuajada, crema, leche agria y queso. Siempre busca la forma de mejorar cada día los ingresos de su hogar y es con la ayuda de los financiamientos que ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Pedro Eduardo sells dairy products.  He’s been in business for over 7 years.  Pedro has three children who work independently.  He started this way of life needing to meet household daily expenses.  He is a very intelligent person who always finds ways to pay his installments.  


The loan he’s requesting is to buy milk, cheese, cottage cheese, buttermilk.  He always looks for a way to improve his household’s income every day and he’s been able to get ahead thanks to help from the loans.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Iem

texts.en: Iem is 41 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. To earn a daily income, he provides photo services for his neighbors and other villagers who need him to take a picture for their party or other ceremony. He has a life partner in his wife, who sells many products, such as merchandise, plastic products, fruits, cooking ingredients and soft drinks at home (Iem is pictured inside his house). They are blessed with four single children.  Iem will be using his loan to buy a new motorbike for riding to clients’ houses in order to provide his photo service.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for riding to clients’ houses in order to provide his photo service.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She has been operating this business for many years. Her talent has become a source of earning to live a sustainable life. She does this work at her home.  

Her clientele base is her community ladies and also boutique owners. Her work has found good acknowledgement among her clients. She completes each dress in 3 to 4 days' time period. She crafts beautiful designs on cloth which attracts many clients to her and she receives regular orders. 

With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and cloth in bulk to be able to complete orders on time and earn maximum profits. She is hopeful that through the loan investment her business will grow further and also improve the financial condition of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bushra.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.es:
Sharon es una persona amable, estudiosa y responsable que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal “Chaska” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Sharon nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad del Cusco de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú), ella tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera. Actualmente, Sharon vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades. 

Sharon está estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas en la Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco y está cursando el primer semestre. Ella en sus horas libres ayuda a su hermana en la tienda multiservicios. Ella requiere el préstamo para pagar sus matriculas de la Universidad y para ahorrar. El sueño de Sharon es trabajar en una empresa prestigiosa de desarrollo de software.
texts.en:
Sharon is a kind, studious and responsible person who, owing to these personal qualities, was invited by her friends to join Asociación Arariwa's 'Chaska' community bank.

Sharon tells us that she was born in the city of Cusco, in Cusco province and department, in Peru.  She is 19 years old and single.  Sharon currently lives in the city in which she was born and this is where she carries out her work.

Sharon is studying for a degree in Systems Engineering at the Universidad Particular Andina, in Cusco.  She is in her first semester.  In her free time, Sharon helps her sister in her general store.  She needs this loan to pay for her university registration fees and to save.  Sharon's dream is to work for a prestigious software development company.

loans.use: to pay for her university registration fees

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is paraffin. 

For the past year, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition from other tailors in the area. She dreams of establishing a dressing school in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase cloth material for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora  Irma   tiene  treinta y cinco años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración  de tortillas echas a mano   desde hace ocho años atrás .
Es una señora  muy trabajadora  a parte de vender  tortillas echas a manos se dedica a la venta de  tacos de guisados en la mañana sale a vender sus tacos  a los locales a los puestos a los bancos.
Tiene la cantidad de cuatro hijos  dos mujeres  Adriana de diez años de edad , Lorena de quince años de edad y dos varones Luis de dieciocho años y Roberto de veintiún años de edad.
Esta  muy contenta por  que su negocio va creciendo  hasta horita  tiene el doble de clientes  del año anterior  sus tacos de guisados y sus  tortillas  le han dejado buenas ganancias y a podido ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su casa y a sus hijos en los gastos de la escuela .
Pidió el presta para comprar mas maíz para la elaboración de tortillas ya que  luego se le terminan  ya que sus clientes  le piden muchas ya que están muy sabrosas.
Sus hijas  Adriana y Lorena , le ayudan a hacer las tortillas  y los tacos de guisados y la  acompañan  a vender a los puestos y a los bancos cuenta con  pedidos a domicilio.
Uno de sus sueños  es   crecer su negocio y ver el fruto de sus ganancias  para seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que terminen una licenciatura .
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado , para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños  que tenia para el futuro  y gracias a su apoyo  los esta haciendo realidad
texts.en:
Irma, 35, has been making hand-made tortillas for the last 8 years.  She is a very hardworking woman.  Aside from selling hand-made tortillas she also sells stewed meat filled tacos.  She goes out every morning to sell her tacos to stores, stands and banks.

She has four children: two girls, Adriana, 10, and Lorena, 15, and two boys, Luis, 18 and Roberto, 21.

She is very happy because her business has been growing.  To date, she has twice as many customers as last year.  Her tacos and her tortillas have produced good profits and she’s been able to help her husband with household expenses and her children with their school expenses.

She asked for the loan to buy more corn to make tortillas because she runs out of them quickly because her customers ask for quite a few of them because they are quite delicious.

Her daughters, Adriana and Lorena, help her make the tortillas and the tacos and accompany her to sell them to the stands and to the banks; she also home delivers orders.

One of her dreams is to see her business grow with the fruit of her profits to continue supporting her children so that they will complete their Bachelor Degrees.

She thanks the foundation for the support its given her to get ahead and help the dreams she has for the future come true; thanks to its support they are becoming reality.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.en:
The business activity from which Muminjon makes a living is the breeding of livestock. He started this business 7 years ago with a small number of livestock. But as his business has developed, he has acquired greater quantities of animals for their eventual sale and gain from their derivatives. According to Muminjon, he works very hard so that he can support his children. For that reason, he is always looking for a way to improve the living of his family. Currently Muminjon needs a loan of 2,300 USD in order to purchase more cattle and later resell after breeding them. This will allow him to fully meet the needs of his family and educate all of his children.    
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 42-year-old married mother of four children. She runs a retail shop in Ntungamo which she established three years ago.

This hard working lady says her business generates her 400,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) profit per month. She sells rice, beans, basins, sugar and groundnuts. Stella also earns some additional income from a small phone charging business.

Her dream is to expand this retail shop and to put her children through higher education. She intends to buy more goods like maize flour, sugar, rice, salt and beans for her shop if given a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice, salt and beans to resell.

loans.name: Safrokhon

texts.ru: Сафрохон жительница города Исфара. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Сафрохон занимается шитьем, она изготавливает мешки для продажи. Торговлей мешков занимается ее муж. Сафрохон в этой области уже 15 лет. Она берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки и материала.
texts.en: Safrokhon lives in the town of Isfara.  She is 43 years old, married and has two children.  Safrokhon is involved in sewing; she makes sacks for sale.  Her husband sells the sacks.  Safrokhon has been in this business for 15 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a sewing machine and materials.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в России. Сама Санавбар работает в ателье. Она в основном шьет мужские брюки и женские национальные платья. Кроме того она у себя дома занимается шитьем занавесок и штор для торговли. Этим видом деятельности занимается 27 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Sanavbar lives in the Javan region. She is 43 years old and married. She has two children. Her husband is at work in Russia. Sanavbar herself works in a tailor shop. She sews men's trousers and women's national dresses. Besides this she sews curtains and blinds at home for trade. She has been in this kind of work for 27 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fabric.

loans.use: Purchase fabric.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Victoria has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She's been in business for 5 years.  

Victoria requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  She is a new member of HSPFI.  

In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 43-year-old married man, father of two beautiful children, and they represent his whole life. Imad is a hard-working man: he works in construction, and he is a good builder. Most of his customers are nearby villagers, in addition to contractors and builders who highly recommend him. 

Imad is a man with a very good reputation. In addition to taking care of his own family, Imad works hard to help his other family members in improving their living especially his brothers. That’s why he requested a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, to help his brother with his wedding in addition to buying new improved tools necessary for his own business.

Imad is very proud of himself. He describes himself as "the friend indeed", since he replies to others' requests as much as he can, because he hates to know that someone needs help and he can do nothing. 

He hopes that one day he can help a big part of his community through opening a big construction company and providing a lot of business for them.

loans.use: To buy new improved extra tools for his business and to help his brother with his wedding

loans.name: Fabiola Rocio

texts.es:
Fabiola Roció tiene 49 años de edad es casada tiene un hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 17 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC MONTE DE LOS OLIVOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina conformada por 14 socios y socias. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao.

Fabiola se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, naranja y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es que la hija sea profesional.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  salir de paseo con el esposo y con la hija.
texts.en:
Fabiola Roció is 49 years old and married.  She has a daughter. She lives with her husband and 17-year-old daughter in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Monte de los Olivos” communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from this office.  It has 14 members, men and women.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, orange and cocoa bean farming.

Fabiola is a corn, orange and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Chillanes Canton.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life.  The challenges she faces are frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is that her daughter becomes a professional.  In her free time she likes going out on family excursions with her husband and daughter.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
His humility, self confidence and placid nature aside, 28-year-old John is an assiduous farmer whose philosophy over the last 12 years has been making the best out of bad bargains and always hoping for the best and preparing for the worst. He has made unprecedented strides following the above mentioned precepts.

John, a happily married father of 10, grows and sells mostly bananas, beans and coffee. Bananas are a staple food in most parts of Uganda, principally Kampala and Mbarara. Food businessmen from Kampala and Mbarara are his biggest clients. On the side, he also relies on income from his modest cattle and goats sales trade. Thus far, John says this business generates him sales income to the total of about Ugandan shillings 350,000 a month.

John says he intends to use his loan to purchase more cattle and goats to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and goats to resell.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Nanzati Ndanga-Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Melkion is a 30-year-old married man with two children and one attending primary education. He has worked in agriculture, especially the production of coffee, maize and beans for over 10 years while earning a low income.

He wants to increase his income by asking for financial help to buy fertilizers, insecticides and hoes. Melkion believes that in five years to come, he will improve his farming activities from 10 acres to 15 acres, be able to buy a transport vehicle e.g. a motorbike and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides and hoes

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
Santiaga, vive con sus hijos de 18, 16, 8 años de edad, el mayor de ellos trabaja, ella por su parte se dedica a la venta de tortillas y administra un comedor, desde muy temprano inicia los preparativos para el negocio, sus dificultades son el alto costo de algunos productos como el gas que es tan necesario para el cocimiento de los productos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz y gas, ya que necesita comprar estos productos para continuar elaborando la comida y las tortillas, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener la mercadería que es vital para la venta.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y prosperar con la ayuda de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Santiaga lives with her children who are 18, 16, and 8 years old. The oldest works. For her part, Santiaga sells tortillas and runs an eatery. She begins the preparations for the business very early. Her difficulties are the high cost of certain products like gas which is very necessary for cooking products. 

She is asking for a loan to buy corn and gas since she needs to buy those products to continue making food and tortillas. This investment will help her maintain the merchandise which is vital for sales. 

Her dream is to grow the business, improve living conditions for her children, and prosper with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy corn and gas.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза проживает в Яванском районе. Ей 21 год. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Наргиза уже год как занимается торговлей у себя дома. Она в основном продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Nargiza lives in the Yavan region. She's twenty-one years old, divorced and has one child. 
One year ago, Nargiza began a culinary business; she sells various foods from her home. 
She's asking for a loan so she can increase the variety of the products she sells.

loans.use: to increase her product range.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 27-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged two and five. She describes herself as hardworking, patient and tolerant. 

Sandra operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located in a very busy and competitive area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy two bales of clothes. Her business goal is to be the best supplier of clothes and run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: To buy two bales of clothes.

loans.name: Giang

texts.en:
Ms Giang is a 43-year-old mother of one daughter who is a worker. As a farmer, Giang has focused on growing cherry blossoms and bonsai trees for 10 years, earning sufficient income to help her to manage family life.

A participant in our credit program since 2004, she has used loans effectively in expanding her business. Giang is now requesting a loan of 9,374,000 Vietnam dong to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Honorine Lucie

texts.fr: Honorine est une femme de 42 anscélibataire mère de 5 enfants. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un pick up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: acheter un pick up de régimes de plantains

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: TERESITA, 47 YEAR OLD, MARRIED AND HAS 2 CHILDREN. SHE BORROWED A LOAN TO FOR ADDITIONAL PIG IN HER PIGGERY BUSINESS. THROUGH THIS BUSINESS SHE WAS ABLE TO PROVIDE THE NEEDS OF HER FAMILY AS A MOTHER. SHE WAS ABLE TO HELP HER HUSBAND, WHO IS A FARMER, WITH THEIR FINANCIAL NEEDS. AS A MOTHER SHE WANT TO GIVE HER CHILDREN AS WELL AS HER FAMILY A BETTER LIVES. HER DESIRE IS TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS AND ABLE TO SELL FOR MORE PIGS THAT WILL HELP THEM BIG.

loans.use: TO BUY FOR ADDITIONAL PIG IN HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Fine and beautiful African prints are what Madam Comfort sells. The demand for her fabrics is very high but she lacks capital to buy more in wholesale and in turn sell it retail to her customers. It is also her desire to own a shop whereby she can include other items such as footwear, ladies and gents underwear etc. She is in dire need of a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her make this productive idea into a reality. She will not disappoint Kiva in terms of repayment. She has had training on loan management and simple accounting from KSF.

loans.use: working capital to expand her fabric sales

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en:
Martiza owns a store and bazaar. She sells groceries and school supplies. Her husband, who had worked at a market, helped her start the business. They began with $300 in capital, which they invested in adapting her house for the business and purchasing some stock. Maritza will use the loan to buy groceries and school supplies at wholesale prices. Her business is located close to her district’s schools, which makes for good daily sales. Maritza is 25 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is her right hand in the business and is in charge of making purchases in the market. She is confident that her sales will increase and will improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Maritza tiene una tienda y bazar. Se dedica a la venta de viveres y utiles escolares. Ella empezo su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien anteriormente habia trabajado en un mercado. Comenzaron con un capital de $300 dolares que invirtieron en la adecuacion de su hogar y un poco de mercaderia. Maritza usara el prestamo para comprar viveres a precio de mayorista y papeleria. Su negocio esta muy bien ubicado cerca de escuelas del sector ayudando esto para que sus ventas diarias sean buenas. Maritza tiene 25 años esta unida tiene 2 hijos su esposo es su mano derecha en el negocio el se encarga de las compras en el mercado. Ella esta segura que sus ventas se incrementaran y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchasing her products at wholesale prices

loans.name: Qizbest

texts.en: Qizbest M. sells women's clothing at the local bazaar in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Qizbest is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and quality of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom D. is 42 years old and lives in Phnom Penh. She works selling groceries, and earns $5/day, while her husband (pictured here with one of their children)  works as a tuk-tuk driver.  The couple is able to support their 3 children and send them to school everyday.  This loan will be used to purchase more grocery items for selling.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta M. y M., 39 years old, makes and sells hand woven mats. These traditional mats are used as beds or as a place to sit. Berta learned this age-old tradition from her mom. and believes it is important to pass on the art to her children. She dedicates her time to creating the mats and can produce up to a few dozen per week if that's all she's working on. Her children help with the weaving, and Berta is pleased to have money and not be dependent on her husband's meager earnings.

Berta is married and lives with her husband, who works in the fields. She explains that as a campesino he does not make a lot of money so her income is very important as it helps support them and their 10 children. The children ages range from 4 to 22. Her goal is to teach her children the art of making mats and provide each one with an educational opportunity. She glows as she explains how pleased she is that her oldest child has successfully completed her high school degree.

Interviewed by Lucia Tunay Ixcol
Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase materials for weaving mats

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: S. Shahnosa is young businesswoman who is married and has one child. She runs her own food shop in the center of a large market in Ovchikalacha, in the district of Khujand. Her husband is her business partner and he is responsible for supplying food products to her shop every day. He buys products from local confectioneries and meat workshops, and gets other products such as candies and drinks from Panjshanbe market in Khujand. S.'s shop is located in a busy neighbourhood and she sees a lot of customers each day. She is requesting a loan so that she can afford to buy more products for her store.

loans.use: To expand the range of food products sold in her store

loans.name: Aperila

texts.en: Aperila is 36 years of age. She is married with three children. She is strong and doing well.  She started her business by selling brooms and coconuts and has expanded her range of goods to handicrafts and clothes.  Aperila earns $250 WST ($100 USD) in profit after all expenses a week. Apart from her income, her husband is working and earns extra money for their family needs.  Aperila is now on her 6th loan. She would like to use this loan to expand her business and renovate her family's house.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C., age 36, and her husband have been married since 1991. They have five children, four sons and one daughter. Four of their children are studying in a local school, and the youngest one stays at home. Sopheap and her family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been in the business of weaving cotton scarves since 1985. It’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband is a teacher.

Sopheap is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to expand her scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: To expand her business weaving cotton scarves

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira (her husband is pictured) is a mother of one child. She is 30 years old and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. In Azerbaijan, she settled in the Fizuli region, living in the Bala Bahmanli village. She has been in this business for five years. Now, she and her family need a loan of $600 to buy a calf.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng L., 58, is a widow with 5 children that stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for the famiL. members. She also owns a plot of farmland and grows a variety of vegetables and makes, on average, about $1.5 a day of profit. Her son, the oldest brother in the famiL., works as a construction worker. On average, he earns $15 a day. Her other four children are employed in the garment sector and each earn a salary of $70 to $80 a month. She requests this loan to make a well (deep well), grow grass (cow food) to sell and to purchase construction tools for her son to use at work.

loans.use: To dig a well, grow the grass and purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty-three years old and a mother of three children. Her two sons are in the senior high school. Beatrice operates a hair salon and also sells hair and body creams, artificial hair, soft drinks, etc. She wants to use her loan to buy more products to expand her operations.

She is a member of the group called “Ayeyi” (meaning Adoration). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Eva Nansikombi`s Group

texts.en:
Eva is a leader of a group of 5 members that has stayed together since they joined MCD. She appears in squatting posture in the photograph. She is aged 32 and married with 4 children. They are aged 16, 11, 3 and 1 years. Three are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She buys rolls of material and designs garments to display to clients. She has had to move from the original working place because of high rental fees and transport costs to a place nearer to her residence. The challenges she is facing now include the low prices that fellow residents expect to acquire her services at, credit sales, and the limited work due to funds.

She has managed to buy 2 new sewing machines and is adequately contributing to the family income. Her plan is to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell soft drinks.

Eva is successfully paying her fifth loan.

loans.use: Her plan is to buy a refrigerator so that she can sell soft drinks.

loans.name: Ines Veronica

texts.es:
Señora Ines M. is a native of the city of Managua. She sells food in the outskirts of the Israel Lewites market. Her location doesn't offer good conditions since she sells in the open air and needs to improve her place of business.

She is the mother of three school-aged children, and she needs to take care of them and provide them with everything necessary for their development. Today she has turned to Ceprodel to request a credit, with which she will be able to purchase supplies to make her food and to continue her business of selling food.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ines M. es originaria de la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua y se dedica al negocio de venta de comida en las afueras del Mercado Israel Lewites. Su ubicación no presta las condiciones necesarias debido a que ella vente a la intemperie requiriendo mejorar su localidad.

Es madre de tres hijos en edades escolares con la obligación de mantenerlos y brindarles todas las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Hoy en dia ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito con el cual lograr comprar su materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y continuar en su negocio de venta de comida en su localidad.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make her food.

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es:
Antonia R. works selling all kinds of shoes, including formal shoes, sandals and women's thong sandals. She started the business 4 years ago and over the years has acquired the experience she needs to manage her business successfully. She is now able to recognize which models of shoes will sell well and which will not.

Because she wants to increase her sales volume she will use the loan to buy new shoe designs, models she believes will sell well, in order to offer new products to her clients. Antonia is married with an 11 year old son; her husband is a bricklayer. They hope to be able to complete the construction of their home soon.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia R. se dedica a la venta de calzados, entre los cuales se encuentran zapatos, sandalias y chinelas. Empezó esta actividad hace 4 años y en este tiempo ha adquirido experiencia para poder administrar el negocio, ahora sabe distinguir los modelos que podrían venderse y los que no.

Desea incrementar el volumen de ventas y con el crédito comprará nuevos diseños de zapatos para tener una nueva oferta para sus clientes. Antonia es casada su esposo es albañil tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad y espera poder terminar de construir su humilde hogar.

loans.use: To buy a new model of sandals to sell

loans.name: Juana Marianela

texts.es:
