She has done this work for two years and a month, and she says it is going very well since she is earning an income from home.  She started this business because she wanted to give the best to her children, so she had to do work that would earn an income.  She and her husband work and they can have a better quality of life.

Her greatest wish is that with this loan and her business, she can have her savings to work and continue supporting her children so they can study and in time have a profession if that is what they want.

The group is made up of three women.  The other two are Miriam, who bakes bread and is asking for a loan to purchase ingredients, and María de Jesús, who will purchase animal feed to raise pigs and later sell them.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Rosalía le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Doña Rosalía y su esposo el señor Hector desean la seguridad de sus dos pequeños hijos ya que pasan el mayor tiempo en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con la pensión que recibe la señora Rosalía, Don Hector se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosalía’s house is lacking a wall around its perimeter.  This is why she’s asking for a loan.  She wants to be able to buy materials like concrete blocks and cement and to pay the person who will do the improvement.

Rosalía and her husband, Héctor, want security for their two small children who spend most of their time at home.

She plans to repay the loan with a stipend Rosalía gets; Héctor will see to family expenses with the income he gets from his work.

loans.use: to erect a wall around her house.

loans.name: Willa

texts.en:
Willa, a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato, primarily grows corn crops to sell. She also raises pigs in her backyard which she sells at the market. A widow who works hard to feed her children and send them to school, Willa plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers, pig feed, and vitamins.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman in order to ensure that her children have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pig feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the purchase of and insurance for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa comenzó a trabajar independiente, vendiendo telas, zapatos y bolsos, pues  a ella siempre le ha gustado ser independiente y manejar su propio dinero; su clientela la constituyen sus vecinas del barrio y las amistades más allegadas quienes gradualmente le recomiendan muchas otras, con las que ha logrado un ligero incremento de nuevos compradores. Los activos de su negocio están representados más que todo  en cuentas por cobrar que rotan cada 14 días y en sus inventarios; aunque  maneja una buena rentabilidad  sobre los  activos,  no tiene un suficiente capital de trabajo para responder a los pedidos de su clientela, este es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una vitrina, suéteres para damas, jeans, camisas de hombre, bolsos, cremas, estuches de aretes, collares y vestidos, encargados por los clientes.
Rosa vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 15 a 30 años.  Aunque desde hace 23 años inició su negocio, ella suspendió su actividad con sus últimos embarazos, regresando a ella cuando sus hijos crecieron; ahora su clientela es referida por ellos mismos y está en un notable crecimiento. Su principal meta es el fortalecimiento de su negocio, por eso necesita tener una vitrina exhibidora, para mantenerlo más ordenado y poder mostrar de manera precisa los productos que vende;  su actual desafío es el insuficiente capital de trabajo, para abastecer a su clientela y tenerla siempre satisfecha y lograr su fidelidad.
texts.en:
Rosa started working independently selling fabric, shoes and bags as she has always liked working independently and managing her own money.  Her customers were her neighbors and her closest friends who have gradually recommended her to a lot more people.  As a result, she has managed to achieve a slight increase in new customers.  Her business assets are represented more than anything in her accounts receivable which have a turnover period of 14 days, and in her inventory.  Although she has a good profit margin, she doesn't have enough working capital to respond to her customers' orders.  This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan which is her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy a display cabinet, ladies' sweaters, jeans, men's shirts, bags, creams, earring cases, necklaces and dresses which her customer have ordered.

Rosa lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband.  They have five children aged between 15 and 30.  Although she started her business when she was 23 years old, Rosa put her business on hold during her most recent pregnancies and returned to work when her children had grown.  Now her existing customers refer new customers to her and her customer base is growing notably. 

Rosa's main goal is to strengthen her business.  For this reason, she needs to have a display cabinet so that she can keep her merchandise more ordered and be able to better display the products that she sells.  Her current challenge is a lack of working capital that she needs to supply her customers, to keep them happy and to keep their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet, ladies' sweaters, jeans, men's shirts, bags, creams, earring cases, necklaces and dresses that her customers have ordered

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Amos has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business; his potential customers are town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

Amos plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to start a retail shop and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a retail shop and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora  Julia  tiene treinta y cinco años  de edad , se  dedica  a la venta de ropas desde hace tres años atrás .
Es una  señora  muy trabajadora  le gusta  mucho  lavar ajeno para tener un dinero extra para  imprevistos.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos  una mujer Estefania   de trece años de edad  y Irvin de  diesi ocho años de edad los dos estudian.
Esta  muy contenta por que su negocio cada día va creciendo mas  , sus hijos la ayudan  en la tienda cuando salen  de la escuela .
Pidió el préstamo  para la compra de mas  ropa ya que  en ocasiones tiene demasiados pedidos y  no le alcanza el dinero para  enviar las tallas para que le puedan mandar su mercancía. 
Uno de  sus sueños es  tener  una tienda de ropa y una farmacia  ya que en ocasiones  va donde su hermana   Fabiola  quien tiene  una farmacia  y vende muy bien  y por donde ella vive no hay una farmacia  cerca y seria un buen negocio.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado , para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños  que tenia para el futuro  y gracias a su apoyo  los esta haciendo  realidad.
texts.en:
Julia is thirty-eight years old and she has been selling clothing for the past three years. She is a very hardworking woman who very much enjoys offering laundry services to have an extra source of income for unforeseen expenses. She has two children: a girl named Estefania who is thirteen years old, and 18-year old Irvin. They both attend school. She is very happy because her business grows more each day and her children help her with the store when they are out of school.

She requested a loan to purchase more clothing because at time she has too many orders placed and she doesn't have the funds to cover the initial expense, which must be done prior to them sending her merchandise.

One of her dreams is to have a clothing store and pharmacy. At times she goes to her sister Fabiola's pharmacy and she sees that it does well, and where she lives there are no other nearby pharmacies and it would be a good business.

She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they have given her, helping her to move forward and to attain her dreams for the future. It is thanks to their support that this is becoming a reality.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Richard Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Richard es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, su señora es comerciante, se dedica a hacer productos chacinados, embutidos caseros, etc. Tiene casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familiar, posee móvil de transporte propio.
Richard se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos, en lo cual cuenta con una antigüedad de más de 10 años.
Comenta que trabaja mucho para darle a su familia todo lo mejor, ya que ellos son su razón de ser. Uno de sus sueños es poder ampliar el horno donde cuece los ladrillos.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de los materiales indispensables para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Está muy agradecido a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Señor Richard is married, he lives in the city of Pilar.  His wife has a business; she works making sausage products, home-made sausages, etc.  He has his own home with comforts for the well-being of his family, and he has his own mode of transport.

Richard works making bricks, which he has been doing for more than 10 years.  He comments that he works hard to give his family the best life possible, as they are his reason for being. One of his dreams is to be able to expand the kiln where he bakes his bricks.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of indispensable materials for making bricks.  He is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it is giving him.

loans.use: to buy materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastasia  vive en una localidad en  la que las personas trabajan desde muy pequeñas, ella vive en unión libre con el señor Fabían y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella  solicito  por segunda vez un préstamo y piensa invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, ya que en este negocio lleva  muy poco tiempo y comenta que el va bien ya que con ello a tiene un buen ingreso en su actividad.

     Lo que la motivo a ello fue su esposo, ya que así los dos trabajan y así pueden tener  una mejor economía, para darles lo necesario a sus hijos que están creciendo.

      Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda seguir  trabajando para que con el  tiempo  mejore su calidad de vida y también tener un lugar en donde pueda cosser las mantas, actividad que tambien practica.
texts.en:
Señora Anastasia lives in a town where people work from a very early age. She is in a common-law marriage with Señor Fabían and with whom she has 3 children, all minors. She is asking for a second loan and is thinking of using it to buy fruit and vegetables. As she has been in this business for only a short time, she says that it is going well as it gives her a good income. The reason for her starting the business was her husband as with the two of them working it meant more income. This means they can give their growing children what they need.

What she wants most of all is to continue to work in this small business so that with time their quality of life can improve and to have a place where she can sew blankets, another activity she practices.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana lives in the village of Nasaguri, East Georgia. She lives with her family: her husband, Valerian; two daughters (35 and 28 years old); a son (34 years old) and her 83-year-old mother-in-law. Svetlana’s son and younger daughter work in a local store as salespersons. Her elder daughter works as a barber. Svetlana and Valerian are running the family's dairy farm. They have four milk cows and four calves. Svetlana sells milk in Tbilisi. 

With the requested credit, Svetlana plans to expand the cattle shed. In the near future, she plans to increase their cows, but the existing cattle shed won't allow her to keep more cows. With more cows, Svetlana will be able to sell more milk and increase the income of the family. She hopes to purchase new household goods and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle shed expansion.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 45-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Edna raises pigs for a living. She has a backyard piggery, which she hopes to expand in the future. Edna also helps her husband keep their farm free of weeds and pests. Edna has requested this loan to purchase pig feeds and fertilizers. Edna hopes to start another income-generating project in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.en:
Pascual is a 57-year-old from Trinidad, Bohol. He has an 18-year-old child.

Pascual is a farmer. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Pascual also runs a small sari-sari store business and sells fish to the people in his community. Pascual does all these to improve his family's living conditions. He requested this loan to purchase fertilizer, fish to sell and more items to sell at his store. Pascual hopes to sustain his child's education, improve his businesses, and renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, fish to sell and more items to sell at his store

loans.name: Rowell

texts.en:
Rowell is 28 years old and still single. He is a helpful son whose priority in life is to have a stable source of income in order to help his parents.  Rowell is engaged in a hog raising business.  He has been in this type of business for four years.

Rowell wanted to expand his business by buying additional piglets to raise.  Since he has insufficient funds, Rowell is asking for financial support amounting PHP 15,000 to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for maintenance.

In the future, Rowell will have his own family but he will first develop his business. His profit from the business will serve as the financial support in forming his own future family.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina sigue participando en unos de los bancos comunales de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Josefina sigue dedicándose teniendo la agencia de viajes y le está yendo muy bien. 

Josefina con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Josefina requiere el préstamo para invertir en el capital de la agencia de viajes ósea desea comprar boletos turísticos y comprar útiles de escritorio.  
 
Josefina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Josefina continues to participate in one of the communal banks in the microfinance unit of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. Josefina still has her travel agency and things are going very well.

With her previous loan things went very well for Josefina and she was able to attain good benefits. For this reason she wants another loan as it helps her a lot.

Josefina needs the loan to invest in the capital of her travel agency; that is, she wants to buy tourist tickets and desk supplies.
 
Josefina is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through this means, and she is committed to making the repayments according to the timeline.

loans.use:
to buy tourist tickets and desk supplies.
.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam is 53 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong Bac Ninh. She has 4 children. They are married. Mrs Nam has a restaurant. She sells rice and noodles, instant noodles. She works there with her husband's help. She has this job for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about 7.000.000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and always pays loans punctually. This is 5th time she borrows a loan from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to repair her restaurant.

loans.use: to repair her restaurant.

loans.name: Jack Kamau

texts.en:
Jack used his previous loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for use during the planting season. He was able to plant and it was very profitable.

He paid the loan amount and all the previous loan amounts well and in good time. He plans to use the new loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings as well as to buy spray chemicals for use in his farm during this planting season.

In the future, Jack hopes to start zero grazing and venture into milk production, hence becoming one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a mother of four young children. To make a living, she established a store selling home and beauty products in the village of Alcala. She sells soap, shampoo, lotions, powder, bags and shirts. She operates her store just in front of her house in order to easily do her household chores when customers are not around. She had been in her business for six years and earns about PHP3,000 each month. She usually pays PHP2,000 for a month of allowance and milk formula and diapers for her infant child.

She is now asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to buy more bags, lotions, powder and cosmetics to sell. This additional quantity of items to sell will help increase sales capacity and Joan hopes that someday she can help uplift her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more bags, lotions, powder and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gerardo Oswaldo

texts.es:
Gerardo, necesita realizar la reparación de su moto taxi, por eso solicita nuevamente un préstamo, para pagar el mecánico y comprar los repuestos necesarios, el se animo a solicitar porque tiene un buen historial créditos, además que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para hacer las reparaciones.
Él está agradecido por la oportunidad que ha tenido con estos préstamos, ya que compro llantas y otros gastos que le debía hacer a la moto taxi.
texts.en:
Gerardo needs to get his motorcycle taxi repaired. He is requesting a new loan to pay the mechanic and buy the spare parts required. He resolved to request the loan because he has a good credit history, and he does not have the money to pay for the repairs himself. 
He is grateful for the opportunities he has received with these loans. Thanks to them, he has been able to buy tires and pay for other expenses also related to the motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to pay a mechanic to repair his motorcycle taxi.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Naida

texts.en: Naida is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has been selling tea in Yambio, South Sudan, for four years. Naida is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Rosalina Patricia

texts.es:
Rosalina, se dedica a la venta de ropa, vive con su esposo, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, los dos trabajan en el hogar, y se ayudan mutuamente para cubrir los gastos y necesidades del hogar. Ella trabaja en el negocio todos los días, este negocio está ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, es un lugar donde transitan muchos clientes.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa para la temporada navideña, blusas, faldas, camisas, vestidos, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar el inventario de su negocio, con la intención de ofrecer a los clientes mejores prendas de vestir.
La aspiración de Rosalina es crecer en el comercio y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosalina works selling clothing. She lives with her husband and has a 6-year-old child. Both of them work at home, and they help each other cover the household expenses and necessities. She works in her business every day. This business is located in the city center, in a place where many customers go by. 

Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy clothing for the holiday season: blouses, skirts, shirts and suits. This investment will help her improve the inventory of her business, with the aim of offering her customers better clothing.

Rosalina's aspiration is to grow in her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts and suits.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is 29 years old and married to Janerose. They have been blessed with two children, ages four and two years respectively. He has been selling timber, for the last five years. Right now his monthly income is KES 15,000.

Isaiah is borrowing his first loan of KES 20,000, which he intends to use to purchase more timber for sale. He will use the anticipated profits to expand and ensure great improvement by supplying timber to big factories.

loans.use: to  purchase more timber for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Emma

texts.es:
Rosa se encuentra casada y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, y debido a que los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, decidió montar su propio negocio y así poder contribuir económicamente para los gastos de su hogar. Desde hace aproximadamente 12 años tiene un puesto de venta de snack, dulces, entre otros productos más, y gracias a este tiene unos ingresos que le permiten brindar en su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Debido a que sus ventas han aumentado considerablemente debido a la temporada, busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos como dulces, snack, entre otros para surtir su negocio y así responder a la gran demanda de sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá aumentar sus ingresos y así también tener en su hogar una mejor estabilidad económica. Además, podrá poco a poco ir cumpliendo su sueño de sacar su hijo adelante brindándole una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Comprar productos como dulces, snack, entre otros para surtir su negocio y así responder a la gran demanda de sus clientes.

loans.name: Ngoan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngoan is 59 years old and she is married with 3 children.
 
She has had a service to pearl rice (separate the rice from the husk) for more than 10 years.
Ngoan lives in Trieu Son district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. .
In 2014, Ngoan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Ngoan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Ngoan is a reputable person in the community. 
She is the leader of her solidarity group. 
The main hardship that Ngoan faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment to pearl rice .
With her business profit, Ngoan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to pearl rice

loans.name: Ablam

texts.en:
Ablam A., nicknamed «Pétit» (or Tiny), was born on December 31, 1982 in Ghana. He only finished grade school before entering an apprenticeship with the goal of becoming a master shoemaker. Today, he owns his own shop that he runs honestly and with discipline. Having suffered a lot due to his parents being poor, he works incessantly to struggle with life’s difficulties. His talents allow him to properly meet the expectations of his customers, and he is highly valued in his neighborhood. As a result of this encouragement, he started producing different kinds of shoes, bags and purses, belts, and other goods that he sells in the marketplaces of Tabligbo. This business, which could be very profitable for him, has had trouble developing because he does not have enough capital at his disposal. The shoes that he makes are highly appreciated in the marketplace, and he even receives orders from Lomé, the capital city. He really needs financial support to be able to bolster and develop his business.

And so he is requesting a loan of $850 as capital to buy a machine and some materials of the trade in order to produce and sell shoes, bags, belts, etc. The success of his plans will allow him to improve living conditions for him and his parents. Financing this very devoted young man will be a fine example for other young people, so that they may follow in his footsteps and advance themselves in life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Ablam dit « Petit » est né le 31 décembre 1982 au Ghana. Il n’a fait que des études primaires avant d’aller en apprentissage au bout duquel il devient maître cordonnier. Il tient aujourd’hui son propre atelier qu’il gère avec rigueur et honnêteté. Ayant beaucoup souffert à cause de la pauvreté de ses parents, il travaille sans relâche pour lutter contre les difficultés de la vie. Ses talents lui permettent de satisfaire convenablement ses clients et il est très bien apprécié dans quartier. Fort de cela, il a commencé par produire des chaussures de différentes gammes, des sacs, des ceintures et autres qu’il vend sur les marchés de Tabligbo. Cette activité qui peut lui être très rentable a du mal à se développer car M. A. n’a pas un capital consistant. Ses chaussures fabriquées sont bien appréciées sur le marché et il reçoit même les commandes depuis Lomé. Il a vivement besoin d’un appui financier pour pouvoir renforcer et accroître son activité. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’acheter une machine et de matériel de travail afin de produire et de vendre des chaussures, des sacs des ceintures etc. Le succès de ce projet permettra à M. A. d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et celles de ses parents. Financer ce jeune homme très dévoué sera un bel exemple pour d’autres jeunes à emboîter ses pas pour leur autopromotion.

loans.use: Buy a machine and material in order to produce and sell shoes

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.en:
Victor Manuel has a farm where he has raised all nine of his children over the last 40 years. He is a very hard worker as he had to rely on his lands in order to feed his family. He has made efforts to educate some of his kids, but just as his parents could not afford to send him to school past the elementary level, there were times when he could not afford to educate all nine children. He still lives with some of his sons who help him on the farm. They all work the fields together in order to cultivate rice and sell it in the city. He hopes the loan will help him be more productive.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Victor is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Gulbudag

texts.en: Gulbudag S. owns and operates a tea house/restaurant in the town of Khachmaz on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. This will be Guldubag’s third loan with Norwegian Microcredit which means that he has established a record of reliability with previous loans and is therefore at low risk of defaulting on this loan as well. He is looking for funding to purchase more equipment for his tea house/ restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his tea house/restaurant

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Mr. Pablo Mendizábal lives in his own home in the Pasankeri district on the western end of the city of La Paz with his mother and his 8 year old daughter. Pablo is a teacher and works in the school district of the City of La Paz. With his previous loans with Impro he constructed a retaining wall to help stabalize his home. The loan requested will be used to complete the construction of an additional room of brick and stone. His past history with Impro and the socio-economic analysis qualify him as a preferred customer and he is able to accept a new loan. The two previous loans with Impro have been paid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Pablo Mendizábal vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su madre y su pequeña hija de 8 años; Pablo es profesor y trabaja en el magisterio de la ciudad de La Paz. Con los créditos anteriores en Impro construyó un muro de contención para estabilizar su vivienda. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción completa de una habitación de ladrillo sobre loza de hormigón armado. Su antecedente histórico con Impro, y el análisis socio económico lo califica como cliente preferencial y puede acceder un nuevo crédito. Los dos creditos anteriores con IMPRO han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use:
Construction of an additional room

Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Shahrbonu

texts.ru:
Shahrbonu G. is 43 years old and has three children. She also has a high-school education. Her business is making piroshki (little cakes). Her daughter helps her with it. Before taking out the loan she had to borrow ingredients from the local suppliers. In 2004 she decided to get a loan in order to increase her assets. Borrowing and investing the money in her business she was able to start purchasing supplies for cash, transporting the goods herself and opened up a sales location. She employs several workers. In the future she is planing to increase the amount of goods she sells. Her daughter is shown on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva Volunteer.

Гаффорова Шахрбону – 43года, имеет троих детей, образование высшее. Занимается услугой, то есть приготовлением пирожков. В её деятельности помогает ей её дочь. До получения займа она брала сырьё в долг у местных поставщиков. В 2004году она решила получить займ и увеличить активы. После неоднократного получения займа и целевого использования она стала брать сырьё за наличные, стала привозить товар сама и открыть торговую точку. В столовую наняла рабочих. В будущем планирует увеличить товар. На фото её дочь.

loans.use: to increase assortment

loans.name: Annamaria

texts.en:
Annamaria is 32 years old. She lives with her husband, 2 farm and house attendants, and 4 orphaned children from her sister and brother. She and her husband have no children of their own. Annamaria owns a business - she started a bird farm 5 years ago, and is currently raising 60 chickens, 23 turkeys, 80 ducks, and 30 guinea foul. The poultry business - sale of meat and eggs to supermarkets - allows her to earn a profit of around US$280 a month. Annamaria uses around US$65 of this amount for the maintenance of her farm. She also opened a candy store 3 years ago, which brings in a weekly profit of US$25-40. The combined income from the two businesses is sufficient for covering home expenses, school fees, and construction of a house for the family.

From a previous loan, Annamaria was able to buy more ducks for her farm, and to continue the construction of their house. She now hopes to take out a bigger loan of US$900 to buy candy, juice, soda, cake, and cookies for her shop, and to have more repairs done on the house.

Annamaria belongs to the group Subira (Swahili for “patience”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of store inventory and repair of a house

loans.name: Rosa Ah

texts.en: Rosa is the mother of 8 children and is thirty-nine. Her husband is unemployed but does fishing  to help support their family. Rosa's business is making popcorn and ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) that she supplies to their village primary school. Rosa enjoys doing her business every day because she relies on its income to support her family. With her requested loan she plans to purchase more ingredients to increase her daily production of snack foods.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her snack-food business

loans.name: Erisa C(I) Group

texts.en:
Anne Kivumbe is 29 years old and married with two children. She makes a living renting out movies from her video library. Margret and Harriet sell charcoal. Catherine and Juliet are poultry farmers. All five women will use the loan to buy more items to offer to their customers. Anne will use the additional income made possible by the loan to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more videotapes, DVDs and VCDs and other items to offer customers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Rose K.. She is single and has two children, aged 21 and 28. She also has two other dependents who are her nieces.

In 1990, Rose established a poultry business, and she now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks, as well as feed and vitamins to help raise them. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons.

First, they require little start-up capital--clients can add to their stock or wait for them to multiply naturally. Second, they require little space. Third, while they are growing, they produce eggs, which can be either sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Muhtor

texts.ru:
Muhtor Hasanovich B. is 46 years old, married and has four children. He has been feeding and breeding cattle for the past 15 years. His children and wife Barchinoy have been helping him. Besides that he has a business of buying and selling oil and petroleum products from which he receives a steady income. Muhtor's wife works as a teacher in the Login village school. Her salary is 170 somoni (about US$50). They spend the income from the resale business and wife's salary on living expenses and save the income from the cattle business and invest it back into business expansion to increase the number of cattle.

Currently, Muhtor plans to buy fodder and three sheep for feeding and growing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Vounteer.

Бердиев Мухтор Хасанович - 46 лет. Женат имеет 4 детей. Откормом скота занимается более 15 лет. В этом ему помогают дети и жена Барчиной. Кроме этого он занимается куплей продажей горюче смазочными материалами. От этого дела он получает стабильный доход. Жена Мухтора работает учительницей в средней школе села Логин. Получает заработную плату 170 сомони. Получаемый доход от торговли и заработную плату жены они тратят на жизнь , а доход от скота он вкладывает в текущий бизнес (увеличивает количество скота).

В данный момент он планирует закупить комбикорм и три барана на откорм.

loans.use: To buy sheep and fodder

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is a twenty-seven year old operator of a cloth design business. She purchases plain cloth from Accra, Ghana’s capital, and creates designs to place on the cloth. She uses dye to imprint the designs and then resells the completed product in Kumasi. She has been operating this business for five years.

In addition to purchasing more supplies for her business, she wants to begin saving to have her own store one day.

Eugenia is a member of the "Trust God" lending group. The lending group uses a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure payment.

loans.use: To buy dye, cloth, and other chemicals for her cloth design business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is forty three years old. She is a wife and the mother of three children, who are currently in school.

Stella believes in hard work; she says it is the antidote to escaping poverty. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like futu, banku, ampesi, rice balls and tz. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains, and is taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and it is taken with any stew.

Stella wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She belongs to the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. Nkwabin is the name of the local community. In this group, members act as social collateral for each to guarantee access to loans. They also help each other to repay the loans through positive peer pressure.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is thirty five years old. She is married and given birth to a single child. Gladys is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts. The palm nut is taken through various processes to squeeze the oil out. This is a lot of drudgery using manual means. Her operation is on a limited scale due to the lack of adequate capital to buy machine for the processing. 

She wants to take advantage of the loan to buy more raw material (palm nuts) and processing equipment to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help her to make bigger income to finance her child’s education. She belongs to the community group called Daniel “Nyame” (God of Daniel) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw material (palm nuts) and processing equipment.

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia baji is the wife of K. M., and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is originally from another city in Pakistan known as Sahiwal, but she moved to Chichawatni 3 years ago. She is the mother of two sons: her oldest son is in kindergarten, while the other son is not of school-going age. Her husband has an oil change (for motor vehicles) business, whereby he collects oil from different places and then sells such oil and/or uses it to service his customers with oil changes (which he does himself). Rafia baji is hereby applying for a loan to buy more oil for her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Naziran baji, who seeks a loan for her grocery shop; (2) Hanifan baji, who requests a loan to buy a donkey cart; (3) Parveen baji, who is in need of a loan to buy electric materials such as switches and lights for her electric shop; and (4) Shamim baji, who asks for a loan for her utensils business.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their businesses (e.g., by purchasing oil, grocery products, a donkey car, electric materials, and utensils)

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
We found Luzilla, happy and diligent, making her delicious meat "anticuchos" (a kebab-like dish made with grilled meat and potatoes) for the large number of happy customers that she serves. Luzmilla begins making her delicious kebabs at 3:00 in the afternoon and continues until 7:00 in the evening. Thanks to her excellent seasoning, the good service she provides and, above all, the reasonable prices she charges at her stand located in an easily-accessible part of the city, the business is widely visited. Luzmilla is applying for this loan to renovate her stand so that she can offer her customers a more comfortable, more secure place to buy her products. After all, it's her customers who allow her to make a living and provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a Luzmila muy contenta y diligente preparando sus deliciosos anticuchos de carne (pedazos de carne y papa a la parrilla encajados en palitos de madera), que son consumidos satisfactoriamente por la gran cantidad de clientes con los que cuenta.Luzmila empieza la preparación de sus deliciosos potajes desde las tres de la tarde hasta las siete de la noche, gracias a su excelente sazón, a la buena atención que brinda y sobre todo a los precios cómodos con los que vende en su puesto ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad, es muy visitada.Solicita este préstamo para acondicionar su puesto de venta y brindarle mayor comodidad y seguridad a sus clientes, clientes que le permiten mantener sin privaciones económicas a su familia.

loans.use: Make improvements to "anticucho" (kebab) stand.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Iii Group

texts.en:
Musa (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group, called Tamaraneh III. This is a Temne word meaning: "Let's help one another." He was born in Magburaka, and he is 30 years of age. Musa is married to a business woman who sells pastes, toothbrushes, creams, and so on. Musa sells cigarettes. They have two children; one is in primary school and the other is still a baby. Musa was able to feed his children and mum, and pay school fees for his child out of the proceeds from his business. With this new loan, Musa is expecting a boom in his business because of the increase in capital the loan will provide.

The members of this group are all business people in Magburaka town, the main town in the Tonkolili District. They now request a new loan to further strengthen their businesses. This is their third loan from Kiva through SMT. They have completely and successfully repaid their previous loans.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell to expand their businesses

loans.name: Febronia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 54-year-old Febronia H. from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, ages 32 and 34. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant because his parents do not take care of him. Febronia has been running a poultry business since 2006. Raising kuku (kuku means chicken in Swahili) is popular in Tanzania, because they require little start-up capital. Poeple can start with one or two, and either buy additional ones as they have the money or they can let them multiply naturally! Also, chickens do not require much space, so sometimes they just let them run around in their garden or compound. In addition, while the chicks are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Febronia's business is doing well; she works at the business for eight hours per day, seven per week and is assisted by one employee. Febronia currently earns about $300 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $850 USD to purchase additional chicks, chicken feed, and veterinary medicines. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Febronia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, feed, and medicines

loans.name: Estefani Paz

texts.es:
Estefani es socia de Banco Comunal El Pino. Estefani es soltera , tiene 24 años, y no quiere tener hijos por el momento       
Estefani tiene su negocio de venta de ropa interior al por mayor, Estefani empezó con este negocio hace 2 años, sus tíos son comerciantes ellos confeccionan la ropa interior y Estefani la vende.
Estefani desde que recibe los prestamos se siente mas tranquila porque puede trabajar mas y tiene otro ingreso.Estefani actualmente tiene a su padre operado.
Estefani necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mercadería (medias, truzas)por campaña.
Estefani sueña con comprar una  máquina para confeccionar medias.
texts.en:
Estefani is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is single, 24, and currently does not want to have children. Her business is selling wholesale underwear. Estefani started this business 2 years ago, relatives make the underwear and she sells it. Estefani has felt more comfortable since she received her loans because she is able to work more and bring in more income. Estefani currently is in business with her father. Estefani needs a loan of $400 that will be invested in merchandise (stockings, socks) for a sales campaign. Estefani dreams of buying a machine to knit stockings.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (stockings, socks) for a sales campaign

loans.name: You

texts.en:
Mr. You K., 43, and Mrs. Las Yom, 40, live on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have six children: four sons and two daughters. Five of their children attend school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. You and his wife have been farmers for over ten years. Currently, they grow corn and tomatoes on their farmland. Besides farming, Mr. You is a mason and does fishing as well, while his wife also raises pigs. They sell their yield to a middleman who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. You is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay fees for workers for his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay fees for workers for his farming business.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin K. lives in Pursat Province which is located west of Phnom Penh City. She is 50 years old and has made a living growing rice; she has been farming since 1979 in her village. She now has eight children; four are single and attending school, and four are married. One of her sons is employed as a salesperson for a private entrepreneur.

Farming is the main source of income for the whole family: growing rice crops twice a year, both dry season and rainy season. Normally, K. rents a pump from others and now she wants to own one for herself. To improve her farming business, K. would like to apply for a loan to purchase a pump to pump the water for rice crops. With any remainder of the loan, she would purchase fertilizer. K.'s husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: to purchase a pump for her rice field

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen  es social del Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre
Carmen es casada, tiene 59 años, cinco hijos todos son mayores y están casados,  Cuando era joven  estudio cosmetología y trabajo en un salón de belleza, después puso  un salón pero no le fue bien,  tuvo que cerrar entonces iba  a las casas de sus clientas a cortar cabello y peinar, pero sufrió un accidente se rompió su brazo impidiéndole trabajar como estilista.     
Con el tiempo puso una bodega “La Única” por que por su casa no había bodega, y la gente buscaba donde comprar, también empezó a vender productos de belleza por catalogo. 
En las ventas por catalogo de producto de belleza, es vendedora estrella  ha logrado obtener la llave de plata, Carmen aprendió en Finca como vender, ha levantado su autoestima, por las charlas que ha recibido en el Bancomunal. 

Necesita un préstamo de 3200 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gas, cubrir los pagos de los productos por catalogo, comprar productos en oferta para su stock
El sueño que tiene es seguir creciendo como persona, sentirse útil, optimista trabajar hasta cuando tenga fuerzas, le gustaría conocer los Estados Unidos
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Bancomunal 24 de 0ctubre. Carmen is married and 59 years old. Her five children are all married adults. When she was young she studied cosmetology and worked in a beauty salon. Later she started her own salon, but it didn't go well and she had to shut it down. She began visiting her clients' homes to cut and style their hair, but was in an accident and broke her arm, which prevented her from working as a stylist. After a while she set up a grocery shop, La Única, because there aren't any stores near her house and people needed a place to shop. She also began selling beauty products from a catalog. She's a top saleswoman in beauty product catalog sales and has received the silver key. With Finca, Carmen learned to sell and has a higher self-esteem thanks to the talks she's had in the Bancomunal. She needs a loan of 3200 soles in order to buy beer and gas, make payments for the catalog products, and purchase sale products for her shop inventory. Her dream is to continue growing as a person, feel useful and optimistic, and work as long as she can. She would like to visit the United States.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replenish shop inventory and make payments on catalog products

loans.name: Sandra Zulianita

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Zulianita Z. R. tiene 27 años es presidenta de su Banco Comunal, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que ejerció durante 6 años la misma que decidió abandonar debido a que los sueldos no cubrían sus expectativas y se animo a abrir su negocio, a la vez que salio embarazada, tiene 01 hijo pequeño que depende enteramente de ella.
Sandra tiene un Internet en sociedad con su padre, se inicio en el negocio con la venta de material dental junto con su hermana durante 4 años, con las ganancias que obtuvo decidió abrir un Internet negocio que hasta ahora desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Mujeres  del Milenium”, lo invirtió en la compra de  material dental.
Con este crédito de 250 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de sus equipos de cómputo.
Sandra tiene el gran sueño de viajar por todo el Perú y de comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Sandra Zulianita Z. R. is 27 years old and is president of her Banco Comunal (communal bank). She lives in El Porvenir district, in Trujillo, La Libertad. She studied to be an executive secretariat. She worked as an executive secretariat for six years, before she decided to abandon it since her salary didn't meet her expectations and she was interested in opening her own business. At that time, she became pregnant and had a child that depended entirely on her. Sandra has an internet cafe company with her father. He started with selling dental material with his daughter for four years. With the earnings they obtained, they decided to open an internet cafe business from their home, which they currently run now. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Banco Comunal "Mujeres de Milenium" (Communal Bank, "Women of the Millenium"), she invested in the purchase of dental material. With this current loan of 250 soles that she will return in 4 months, she will invest in the maintenance of the computer equipment. Sandra has a grand dream of traveling all over Peru and buying a house.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the maintenance of computer equipment

loans.name: Faalagilagi

texts.en:
Faalagilagi M., 39, is married with three children. She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers two days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Faalagilagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Part of the loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase pesticides, chemicals, weed eater, cement, timber and iron roofing

loans.name: Cielos Abiertos Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario Cielos Abiertos esta integrado por 4 personas, las cuales se conocen desde hace años y han trabajado juntos tambien por muchos años. estas son las actividades que ellos realizan:
la Sra. Martires G. tiene 42 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar, con el cual tienen 5 hijos los cuales les ayudan economicamente para el sosten del hogar, ellos ya estan grandes, la sra Martires se dedica  a la venta de productos de la canasta basica como ser: arroz, azucar, cafe, pan, sardinas, leche, mantequilla, manteca, aceites, ella tiene su pulperia hace 6 años, su mayor sueño es montar un mercado.
El Sr. Santos Luis O. tiene 58 años de edad, esta casado y tuvo 10 hijos de los cuales todos ya se casaron y tienen su propia familia. el se dedica a la venta de materiales para hacer ladrillos y tejas, se dedica a esta tipo de negocio hace 4 años, para vender su producto se desplaza a las ladrilleras para vender el producto como ser tierra, agua que el acarrea en su carro y lo traslada a distintas empresas que fabrican este tipo de producto. cabe mensionar que este señor es reconocido en esta zona por ser muy humilde, cariñoso y trabajador.
La Sra. Magdalena O. tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales una esta estudiando en la escuela, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y comidas como ser: enchiladas, tacos, pastelitos, yuca, carne asada, pollo frito y refrescos de botella. los fines de semana ella lleva sus productos hacia el campo de la comunidad donde siempre se realizan encuentros deportivos y los vende a los jugadores, hijos y esposas. su mayor sueño es poder apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera en la universidad.
la Sra. Eric R. tiene 30 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar con el cual tiene 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser: platanos fritos con frijoles, pan con frijoles y mantequilla, enchiladas, tacos, refrescos naturales, guineo verde frito con repollo.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias y sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group “Cielos Abiertos” (Open Skies) is made up of four people. They have known each other for many years and have worked together for much of that time. These are the activities that they participate in:

Ms. Martires G. is 42 years old. She lives in a common law marriage. She and her husband have five children who help them financially to maintain their home. Their children are now adults. Martires sells food staples such as rice, sugar, coffee, bread, sardines, milk, butter, lard, and oil. She has had a small store for six years. Her biggest dream is to open a market.

Mr. Santos Luis O. is 58 years old. He is married and has 10 children all of whom are married and have their own families. He sells materials to make bricks and tiles. He has been in this business for four years. To sell his product he goes to the brick and tile makers to sell materials like earth and water. He carries these materials in his car and drives to different companies that manufacture this type of product. This gentleman is recognized in this area for being humble, caring, and hardworking.

Ms. Magdalena O. is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, both of whom are studying in school. She sells candies and food such as enchiladas, tacos, pastries, yuca (a root similar to a potato), carne asada (grilled beef), fried chicken and bottled soft drinks. On the weekend, she brings her products to the field in her community where people always play sports and sells them to the players, children, and wives. Her biggest dream is to be able to support her children so that they can study at a university.

Ms. Eric R. is 30 years old. She lives in a common law marriage and has three children who are studying in school. She sells food such as fried plantains with beans, bread and beans and butter, enchiladas, tacos, natural sodas, and fried green bananas with cabbage.

All of these people need this loan to move forward with their families and their businesses.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, sugar, coffee, chicken, butter, soda, eggs, juice, lard, oil, beef and pork, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, peppers, bananas

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr:
A. Bernadette est née dans les année 1967 dans le Département du Mono au Sud du Bénin. Bernadette est mariée et mère de quatre enfants: Carine âgée de 20 ans n'est plus à sa charge, roméo âgé de 15 ans est en troisième année du lycée, Romulux âgé de 10 ans est en première année du lycée et Marlène âgée de 4 ans n'est pas encore scolarisé. Bernadette vend des bidons d'huile d'arachide et des galettes de blé mises en bouteille. C'est sur commande que Bernadette frit ces galettes de blé, conditionnées dans des bouteilles d'un litre de capacité et qu'elle livre. Bernadette a eu déjà deux crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé. Bernadette enregistre de plus en plus de commande d'huile et de galettes et pour y faire fasse, elle a besoin de plus de moyens financiers. C'est pour cette raison que Bernadette sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé.


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Bernadette was born in 1967 in Mono County in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of four children: Carine, age 20, who she no longer supports; Roméo, age 15, in his third year of high school; Romulux, age 10, in his first year of high school; and Marlène, age 4, not yet in school. Bernadette sells drums of peanut oil and galettes made of wheat flour and bottled. By special order, she fries these galettes, packages them in one-liter bottles, and delivers them. She has had two Alidé loans before and has repaid them. She is noticing more and more orders for oil and for galettes. And to address this, she needs more funding. For these reasons, she’s requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drums of peanut oil, sacks of flour and sugar

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Those pictured are Zainab K., Abie S., Mabinty K. and Mummy T.. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan, which will help them to increase the sizes and qualities of their businesses. As a result they will make better profits and improve their standards of living. 

Zainab (right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-eight years old and was born in Yoni, a small town in northern Sierra Leone. She is married with five children, two of whom are in primary school and three who are in secondary school. Zainab sells dried fish, rice and gari (food made out of cassava), and she has been in this business for more than ten years. She will invest her loan into her fish and gari business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Irshad Shoqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is married to S. A. and has lived in the city of Kasur, Pakistan (famous for its sweetmeats) for the past 15 years. She prepares wooden items, such as trays, which people buy to decorate their homes. Irshad baji learned this art from her mother and has worked in this business for five years. Her husband works in the clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from different cities (Multan and Lahore) and sells to his native city, Kasur. Irshad baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s business.

Irshad baji is the leader of a group of four other women from her locality. Zubaida baji, Humaira baji, Fozia baji and Shabana baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en:
Aygun P. is a 20-year-old single woman. She started her own business a year ago because her parents retired. To earn extra income for her family, Aygun sells confectionery items such as candies, cookies, and pastries at the local market.

Aygun dreams of building her own store one day. Today she requests 1200 USD to expand the range of goods that she sells at the market. Aygun will use the extra income from expanding her product selection to improve her family's living situation and for savings for that future store.

loans.use: purchase more goods to expand her range of goods

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod sells different kinds of construction materials, including wallpaper, in one of the local markets. He has been in this trade for three years. Farhod is married with two children. He lives in Tursunzade.

Farhod has passed many milestones on his road to success. He has learned to adapt with each wave of change in the market world. Today he is a stable and confident entrepreneur with many bright ideas and plans for the future. One of his current plans is to increase his turnover capital with the help of a loan of $3000 US. Farhod is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma M. G. reside en la capital del país en el municipio de Soyapango. Irma tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres niños Henry de 11 años, Ingrid de 10 años y Brayan de 9 años de edad los tres niños se encuentran estudiando el nivel básico en la escuela. Irma ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos por medio de las ganancias que le genera su negocio, una tienda muy surtida de productos de consumo la cual tiene ubicada en el mercado de la colina donde ella vive el deseo de Irma es seguir surtiendo su negocio para contar con la capacidad de vender productos al por mayor ya que le generaría mayores ingresos es por eso que solicita este crédito para comprar mercadería para su negocio y contar con grandes cantidades en los productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
Irma M. Garcia resides in the capital of the country in the municipality of Soyapango. Irma is 33 years old. She is a single mother of three children: 11-year-old Henry, 10-year-old Ingrid, and 9-year-old Brayan. The three children are studying in elementary school. Irma has been able to move forward with her children by way of the earnings that her business generates for her. She has a small store stocked with consumer products which is located in the market on the hill where she lives. Irma’s desire is to continue to stock her business so that she can count on the ability to sell wholesale products as they generate more income. She solicits this loan in order to buy merchandise for her business and count on having great quantities of the products that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Miriam Carmita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Campesinas de Ruizho esta ubicado en el sector de Ruizho, perteneciente a la comunidad de San Bartola  de Sigsig, se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Cuenca, su terreno es en su mayor parte accidentado.
Las principales producciones de la región son: maíz, fréjol, cebada, trigo, habas, arveja, patatas. En la parte baja se produce caña de azúcar y variedad de árboles frutales.
La parroquia se encuentra atravesada de norte a sur con yacimientos mineros de plata y hierro, existiendo también en la región sur criaderos de cal.
La principal industria es la agricultura, si bien muchos se dedican a la manufactura del tejido de sombreros de paja toquilla.
Este banco Comunal esta conformado por personas muy colaboradoras, organizadas y puntuales, el desarrollo de sus labores en el campo es la base fundamental para el compañerismo ya que cuando alguien necesita ayuda realizan mingas comunales, así también cuando hay festejos asisten todos.

Sra. Miriam Carmita Peñalosa C. es oriunda de Ruizho, tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre con Jorge Suqui (Albañil), dice que para ella no es necesario casarse, porque cuando ella quiere se separa y punto y no tiene problemas con nadie, tiene 2 hijos fruto de su relación, son de 8 y 6 años, estudian en la escuela Ruizho de la comunidad, su relación es de 8 años y es muy feliz, Miriam se dedica a muchas labores como son el cuidado de sus hijos, la crianza de animales,  en el campo y la panadería.
En los últimos tiempos se ha dedicado más a la panadería, esta profesión aprendió con gestiones del gobierno con las comunidades, la institución que promovió esta profesión fue el SECAP (Centro de capacitación profesional), ya lleva dos años haciendo pan dice que hace según los pedidos que tenga, por lo general son 100- 200 diarios, ella entrega a 0.08 centavos de dólar para que los de la tienda vendan a 0.10 o hasta 0.12 centavos al público. 
El crédito que solicitó fue de 330 dólares los cuales va a invertir comprando vacas lecheras para complementar vendiendo el pan con leche, la meta que tiene en el futuro es poder hacerse una panadera grande y poder extenderse hacia las comunidades aledañas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Campesinas de Ruizho” is located in the area of Ruizho, which is part of the San Bartola de Sigsig community, located one hour outside of the city of Cuenca. The majority of the area consists of rugged terrain. The main crops grown in this region are maize, beans, barley, wheat, beans, peas, and potatoes. In the lower parts, you can find sugar cane and a variety of fruit trees. Mineral deposits of silver and iron crisscross the parish from north to south, and limestone formations also exist in the region. The main industry is agriculture, although many residents engage in making woven straw hats and shawls.

“Campesinas de Ruizho” is comprised of individuals who are highly collaborative, organized and punctual. The development of their rural businesses is the common bond that brings them together. Whenever anyone needs help with a particular project, they work together as a group (in community events known as “mingas”), and celebrate together afterwards.

Sra. Miriam Carmita Peñalosa C. is a native of Ruizho. She is 24 years old and lives in a common law relationship with Jorge Suqui (who is a mason). She says she doesn’t want to get married in order to avoid problems in case she decides to separate at any point. Two children (ages 8 and 6) have resulted from her relationship. They attend the community school in Ruizho. Miriam and Jorge have been together 8 years and are very happy. She dedicates most of her time to taking care of her children, raising animals, working on her farm, and operating a bakery.

Lately, she has spent more time working in her bakery. She learned the profession through a government arrangement with local communities. The institution that administers this program is called SECAP (Center for Vocational Training). In this two year program, students learn to make bread according to customer orders, usually producing 100-200 loaves each day. The bread is sold to stores for $0.08 USD each, which is then marked up to $0.10-0.12 USD when sold to the public.

Miriam is requesting $330 to buy dairy cows so that she can supplement her income by selling milk. Her goal for the future is to become a great baker and expand her business into the surrounding communities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cows to supplement her income from selling bread

loans.name: Eriberta

texts.es:
La socia Eriberta, pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de la Agonía de Taray”, situado en el distrito de Taray, a 1 hora de la misma ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, y alterna sus actividades del hogar y  la agricultura, con la compra y venta de artesanía, en los mercados feriales de Pisac y de Taray, los días de feria a los turistas que se dirigen al valle sagrado de los inkas. La socia requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de artesanía y para comprar otras artesanías y así alternar sus productos.

La socia se muestra muy agradecida y ratifica su compromiso de cumplir con sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

loans.use: Capital para comprar insumos  para la elaboración de artesanía.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Msangara borrower group in Kiboriloni, kilimanjaro. She is 40 year old woman, She is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 12 and 8 years old.

Joyce has owned a food business selling fruits(orange)and tomatoes for 5 years.She works 12 hours a day and earns monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania.

This is Joyce`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more oranges, tomatoes.

With the additional profit she gains from the use  this loan, Joyce  hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and tomatoes

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
Here are Isatu C., Christian B. and Sarah K.. These are small scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of Le 500,000.00 for each to enable them add more goods into their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profit. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuit. 

Isatu C. (left) is the leader of this group. She is forty years of age, born in Magburaka town, northern Sierra Leone. She is currently residing in Makeni, together with her husband and three children. Her children are attending secondary schools. Isatu has been a businesswoman for over fifteen years now. She sells gara lapper (locally dyed clothes, sometimes with fabricated designs), a local drink called Davinta, cold water and Ginger Beer. She also sells torch lights. Isatu will invest this loan into her business; she will use the loan particularly to buy Brillians (the white cottons used for dyeing the gara lappers).

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary P. sells clothes, children’s dresses, and feeding bottles at Elmina near Ankanful.  Mary has received a senior high school education.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a security personnel.  Mary has been selling clothes since 2005. She supports her husband in the paying of bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more cloths for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene C. is a 29-year-old single mother of three children: Lynus (6yrs), Sandra (4yrs) and Faith (1yr). She lives in Kapchebar Village.

Irene learned about KADET through a World Vision meeting she attended in Tambach. She has not borrowed a loan from any other MFI apart from KADET Ltd.

Irene owns a posho mill (turning corn to maize flour) and sells cereals like maize and beans. She has previously borrowed a loan of Kshs 50,000 from KADET Ltd and paid it back well. Irene plans to use this new loan to expand her business by purchasing farm inputs to plant beans and vegetables for sale. She also intends to venture into the dairy business by buying a dairy cow. Irene sells her goods to schools and individuals.

If this loan boosts her business, Irene intends to buy a piece of land to construct a house.

Irene describes herself as talkative and joyful. She dreams of building a campsite on her farm in the future.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Irene wants the loan to purchase farm inputs and a dairy cow

loans.name: So

texts.en:
So R. is asking for a loan of $1000 US for a motorbike with a compartment attached for one of her sons to operate as a tuk-tuk driver. She is 55 years old and married. She lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband (in the photo) and children. To make a living, she raises crops and rice, earning approximately $1.25 US per day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman. He fishes at the lakes in his village with Cambodian traditional fishing traps. He earns $1.50 US per day to help cover the family expenses. 
Mrs. R. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her first loan from Kiva’s partner, CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a compartment attached

loans.name: Anonymous
