loans.use: To purchase shop items in bulk for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell gas and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa arrendada.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica al comercio, anteriormente elaboraba y vendía prendas tejidas a mano, pero ahora (desde hace un año) ha empezado a vender artículos según la temporada y la demanda de las personas. Por ejemplo; cuando es época escolar vende cuadernos, lapiceros y colores y en época navideña vende juguetes.
Su modalidad de venta es al crédito, sus clientes separan el articulo y cada día pagan un porcentaje del precio total, cuando terminan de cancelar les da el articulo, esto le ha permitido obtener mayores ganancias y la facilidad de pago para sus clientes.

Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es muy responsable en sus pagos, por lo que fue considerada para renovar su crédito en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más artículos para la época navideña como juguetes y adornos.
texts.en:
Marlene is 35 years old and lives with her huband and their three children in a furnished house. She has been in business for three years; initially she used to produce and sell hand-made clothes, but since last year she has started a seasonal business. For instance, during the school year she sells notebooks, pencils and color pens, while during the Christmas season she sells toys. She sells on credit: her customers choose the item and pay rates until they have fully paid the price and then they receive the item. This way she is making more revenue and can offer an easier way to pay to her customers. This is her third loan with MFP and she has always fully repaid. For this reason she was considered for a new loan in her commune bank. This loan is helping her to buy supplies for the Christmas season, such as toys and decorations.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stocks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a LAPO client. The Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is 52 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband moulds construction blocks to support the family. She sells cooked foods and drinks by hawking her cooked foods within her community in Benin City, Edo state. 

Victoria loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to receive a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 1, 2, 3 Group

texts.en:
Yaniris is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Solidarias 123 (Women in Solidarity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, a rural area where the economy is based around agriculture, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure, which is under construction, with her husband and her three children.

Yaniris is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and having grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a papelería (similar to a mini-office supply store) by purchasing a photocopier. She will use the profits from the business to invest to complete her home, as well as feed her children and pay for their school supplies. Her long-term goal is to finish her studies in the university, where she is majoring in business administration, and to have a prosperous business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Apoowegi Lanek Polline Group

texts.en: Polline L. is a hard-working business woman who is 37 years old and the group President of Apoowegi. She is married and blessed with five children, of whom four are in school, and she is looking after three dependents who are in school too. She is running a business selling bananas and it has been eight years so far. She will be using the loan to purchase and transport bananas from Paidha and Mbarara to Layibi and Gulu for sale. The loan will improve her business stock. She is a hard-working and motivated businesswoman whose future hopes are to educate her children, build a house and drive herself.

loans.use: To purchase and transport bananas from Paidha and Mbarara to Layibi and Gulu for sale.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi S. lives in Sanepa. She has four members including herself in her family. Her husband is a taxi driver. They have one son and one daughter. Both her children are studying in primary school.
Laxmi  opened her butcher shop 1 year ago. She sells chicken and buff meat in her shop. She opened the butcher shop to improve the living standard of her family. Her husband also helps her in her work. Laxmi is requesting a loan of NPR15000 to buy a freezer to store meat.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to store meat

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar is a 38-year-old married lady. She lives in a city called Vehari, Pakistan with her family.  Her family consists of eight persons including her five daughters and one son. Her eldest daughter has completed her education up to 10th standard. Then, she decided to start a clothes-sewing business with Shamim. The other kids are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Shamim's husband's name is K. H. and he has a timber-selling business. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. She has successfully completed two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). From her first loan she increased her sewing business by buying her sewing machine. She took out her second loan for her husband’s timber-selling business. Now she is requesting a loan again to enhance his business by buying timber in bulk.

Shamim is also the group leader for three other women from her locality. Zubaida Khanum baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (biscuits, bread, butter) for her bakery. Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy wood to sell. Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

loans.use: To enhance timber-selling business

loans.name: Nematjon

texts.ru: Носиров Нематжон проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Образование средне- специальное "Электрик". По специональности работает уже 25 лет. Кроме того занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Имеет небольшой коровник. Он откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 9 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Nematjon N. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. He has a secondary-specialized education as an electrician. Namatjon has been working in his field for 25 years. Besides this work, he is also involved in animal husbandry and agriculture. He has a small cowshed. He fattens and sells livestock. Nematjon has been in this business for over 9 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya is 61 years old and lives with her daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her daughter live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

During the day, Marusya operates a raw materials such as animal skin, cashmere trading business with her daughter, Battsetseg, who is 34 years old. They have been operating their business since 2005 and have gained valuable experience. Marusya started her business with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (approximately 725 USD) and, with a lot of hard work and determination, has increased her working capital to more than 3,000,000 tugrugs (approximately 2170 USD).

Marusya has been planning to expand her business in the future. Since she started her business, her family's standard of living has improved. With her earnings, she has purchased a car for her family and is providing money towards family expenses.

Marusya is an industrious person who has good communication skills. She says, “I have been planning to grow my business with my daughter and to increase the number of my livestock.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine M. was born in 1976. She lives in Koti Village, in the Tavush area, with her family, which consists of her husband and four children. Since 1994, Marine has been engaged in breeding swine and poultry, husbandry, and growing tobacco plants. She says that farming is very labor-intensive, but not very profitable. Marine’s husband helps her in farming and they keep their family with the income they earn by farming. Marine intends to begin bee-keeping as well. She is requesting a loan of 600,000 Armenian dramas (AMD) to enable her to buy some beehives, which will help her increase her family's income.     

Marine is third-cycle borrower from Nor Horizon, and she has never been delinquent on her repayments.

loans.use: To buy beehives

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida P. is from the city of Lawa-an Dawo. She is 51 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. Zenaida owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Zenaida has been involved in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Zenaida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Zenaida is requesting a new loan, her 4th, of 14,000 PHP, which will be used for additional  capital for hog raising. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Esther B.

texts.en:
Pictured above is Esther B. K. on the left and loan officer Mary Conteh on the right. Esther is a teacher at the MCA Primary school in Alkalia village, which is about 25 miles away from Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. Esther has applied for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders.  

Esther and many other teachers apply for loans from SMT. With the help of these loans, they can buy or do something big that their mere salaries could not buy or do. Esther wants this loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to pay college fees for her child. 

Forty-two-year-old Esther was born in a place call Yiffin, near Kabala town. She is married to a laboratory technician and the couple has one son who is currently at university.

loans.use: Pay college fees for her son

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also take care of a young brother. She lives in and rents and a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and food.

Betty sells African attire and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. She sells door–to-door and so doesn’t have a permanent business premises. She has been in this business for four-and-a-half years, working six days a week.

Betty joined MCDT because of the low interest rate charged. She wants to use this loan to buy more rolls of African fabric (bitenge). Formerly she was buying this from Arua but shifted to the Democratic Republic of Congo. She uses public transport to and from buying her goods. 

Betty’s business challenges include transportation, defaulters and the rainy season which hinders her movements. She is aspiring to selling wholesale only and also wants to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African fabric

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam is a citizen of a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and Punjabi foods.  She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years. She has given birth to five children. Two of them are working and the others don’t do anything. She wants to give her children better educational facilities but due to their scanty financial resources, she hasn't been able to achieve her wish.  

Maryam is a very caring lady. She takes care of her house and family and cooks healthy food for them. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade but he hasn’t got his own rickshaw, and that’s why he can't earn as much as the family requires. 

Therefore Maryam has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy a rickshaw and increase his household income.

loans.use: Purchase a new rickshaw

loans.name: Han

texts.en:
Mr. Han M. is 40 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Choeun Phan (both are in the photo), is 40 years old. They have been married since 1990 and have five daughters. Two of them are garment factory workers, one attends school, and other two are still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Han and his wife are farmers; they grow rice, cucumbers, and green beans on their farmland in the village. He is asking for his first loan in the amount of $600 to purchase a water pump machine and pipe to spray his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump machine and pipe to spray his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Don’T Worry Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are the members of the “Don’t Worry” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Kadiatu S. who is pictured on the left. Kadiatu was born in Makeni and is age forty-two. She is married with six children. His husband is a businessman and her children are attending schools: three in secondary school and three in primary school.

For four years now, Kadiatu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed clothes). With this loan, she will buy more materials for making gara lappers like white cotton cloth, inks, caustic soda, powder, etc., so that she can produce many gara lappers to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy materials like caustic soda, powder, ink, white cotton cloth, etc. for making gara lappers

loans.name: Aom

texts.en:
Aom O., 59, is married and lives with five of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $1.00 U.S. dollar each day. They are supported by four of their children -- three work in the garment factory and one is a professional silk weaver. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Aom O. included. 

In light of these economic difficulties, Aom O. is asking for a loan of $400 United States dollars to purchase fertilizer and silk. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and silk.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda N., a happy mother of four children, is 42 years old and married. For 10 years she has been selling foodstuffs in her grocery store. Mavluda’s wish is to increase her business by offering a greater variety of foodstuffs to her customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are all the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity and with the immense love Mavluda feels as a mother and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of $3000 USD in order to increase the range of her goods.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in order to increase her range of goods for sale

loans.name: Shasta Daisy Group

texts.en:
Myrna C. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Myrna is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shasta Daisy.

Myrna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Myrna has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Myrna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hudoykul

texts.ru: Фармонов Худойкул проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын, учится в экономическом университете Таджикистана. Сам Худойкул, имеет высшее образование, экономист. Занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Hudoykul F. lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 44 years old, married and has 5 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  His son attends an economics university in Tajikistan.  Hudoykul has a higher education, as an economist.  He is involved in agriculture.  He leases a plot of land, where he grows vegetables.  He has been involved in this business for 6 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Marylene

texts.en:
Marylene C. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 35 years old. Marylene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marylene owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marylene has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marylene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marylene is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merly Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Guerra De Los Sexos  se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

La señora Merly tiene ya tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son relativamente bajos en comparación con las otras instituciones de crédito y además por las facilidades para otorgar los créditos. Tiene 51 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad,  el menor estudia en el colegio. Su marido es chofer de un taxi.
 
Aprendió corte y confección, tiene práctica ya que en su casa su mama se dedicaba a esto, por lo cual puso un pequeño taller en su casa donde cose ropa a las personas que necesitan de sus servicios, solo cose ropa de niñas y de mujer.  También vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas) trabaja en ambas cosas  a la vez ya que  le vende a sus  clientes que llegan por sus servicios, trabaja desde las 8 hasta las 19h00 todos los días.

Este crédito es para comprar telas y materiales de costura y para pagar el pedido de los productos de Yanbal de este mes. sus sueños son seguir teniendo trabajo y gozar de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "La Guerra de Los Sexos" meets every fortnight in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a well-known commercial area with its traditional fiestas of San Pedro and San Pablo and it contains a rich historical culture in the mountains.

Merly has been in the communal bank for three years and likes it because the stakes are relatively low compared with other credit institutions, and also for the ease of providing loans.  She is 51 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are adults, and the youngest is in school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She learned tailoring and has a practice at home because her mother was devoted to this.  She put a small workshop at home where she sews clothes for people who need her services.  She sews clothes for girls and women.  She also sells Yanbal products (cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She works in both activities at the same time as she sells to customers who come for sewing services.  She works from 8:00 AM until 7:00 PM every day.

This loan is to buy fabric and sewing materials and to pay for this month's orders of Yanbal products.  Her dreams are to continue having a job and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, buttons, thread, zippers, and beauty products.

loans.name: Ntungamo Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
N. Juliet is 30 years old and the leader of the Ntungamo Kwetungura group.  She is a business woman involved in the sale of bogoya (yellow bananas) from Ntungamo Park Yard for over 12 years and her customers are mostly travelers and residents in and around the park. In a week, she is able to make 80,000 UGX as profits.  

She needs a loan to be able to buy more bogoya for resale.  She usually buys in bunches and she says that it was a friend who introduced her to this business.  Juliet is a social, honest and determined woman who is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 to 14 years old and her dream is to educate her children, buy a plot of land and to be able to diversify her business in the future.

loans.use: Buy more bogoya ( yellow bananas ) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 150 cones of wool

loans.name: Santo Leonardo

texts.es:
Santo de 39 años, vive con sus tres hijos de 16, 15, 7 años  en una zona urbana llamada Suburbio de Guayaquil.  El siempre ha sido un hombre trabajador y para tener su propio negocio y como no tenía experiencia arreglando bicicletas tuvo que comenzar observando cómo arreglaban bicicletas en un taller. 

Con esfuerzo el también pudo tener su propio taller de reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicletas. En la actualidad vende los repuestos desde $ 1.80 y las llantas a $ 3.25. También hace reparaciones de bicicleta a distintos clientes que viven por la zona. Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo repuestos para bicicletas. 

En el futuro quiere ampliar el taller de bicicletas y ampliar la comprar y venta de repuestos para bicicletas.
texts.en:
Santo, 39, lives with his three children, ages 16, 15, and 7, in an urban neighborhood called Suburbio de Guayaquil.  He has always been a hard worker.  In order to have his own business and to not have experience fixing bicycles, he had to have started by observing how to fix bicycles in a shop.

With effort, he was also able to have his own repair shop and sell bicycle parts.  He currently sells the parts from $1.80 and tires for $3.25 .  He also does bicycle repairs for different customers that live in the area.  To continue his business, he wants to buy bicycle parts with the loan,

In the future, he wants to expand the bicycle shop and expand his purchase and sales of bicycle parts.

loans.use: To purchase spare bicycle parts.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María G. D. A. D. 58 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija, junto a quienes resiD. en San Juan Opico, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee su propio negocio en el cual elabora tortillas, esto lo hace D. lunes a domingo, ya que posee muchos clientes a los cuales es necesario atenderlos lo mejor posible. El negocio esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación en donD. venD. con la mayoría D. sus vecinos y personas D. los alrededores. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. materia prima para elaborar las tortillas. Este negocio es muy importante para María ya que le permite crecer como persona, debido a que pueD. contar con su propio trabajo y D. esta misma forma ayudar a su familia a contar con una mejor estabilidad económica y así mismo a contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar.
texts.en:
María G. D. A. is 58 years old.  She lives with her husband and a daughter in San Juan Opico, in La Libertad department.

María owns her own business where she makes tortillas.  She works from Monday to Sunday since she has a lot of customers who she must serve as well as she can.  Her business is located in her home and she sells to most of her neighbors and people who live round about.  

María is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of raw materials for making tortillas.  This business is very important for María since it allows her to grow as a person as she has her own work.  It also allows her to help her family enjoy better financial stability and proviD. her household with everything it needs.

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en: Lanie J. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in her community. She also makes and sells viand foods like fried fish, chicken and pancit bihon [fried rice noodles]. She is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Macapari, Damulog, Bukidnon. Lanie has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Lanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Lanie is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, instant noodles and detergents. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, instant noodles and detergents

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Ricardo Antonio C. P., es empleado de una empresa de acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Ayudante Fontanero, desde hace 4 años y siete meses.

Es casado de 27 años de edad, con 2 personas a su cargo una de ellas es menor de edad. Vive en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Managua, comunidad de Sábana Grande.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle este primer crédito ya que lo utilizará para hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Ricardo Antonio C. P. is employed by a water and sewage company where he has worked as an assistant plumber for four years and seven months.

He is 27 years old, married, and has two people under his care, one of whom is a minor. Ricardo lives in the city of Managua, municipality of Managua, in the community of Sábana Grande.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL since he will be receiving his first loan which will be used to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: Pay for home improvements

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona se dedica a la crianza de ganado Lechero y solicita un crédito para la compra de un par de vacas lecheras para mejorar sus volúmenes de leche y por ende sus ingresos.

Petrona vive con su esposo y un hijo en  casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi, Capital de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz. Su esposo trabaja en interior mina. 

Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Petrona's business is raising dairy cows and she is requesting a loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to improve her milk volumes and, consequently, her profits.

Petrona lives with her husband and child in her own home which is located in the town of Achacachi, capital of Omasuyos province, in La Paz department.  Her husband works down a mine.

This is Petrona's first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a pair of dairy cows to increase her milk sales volume

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del Banco comunal “El Tiempo es oro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella tiene un taller de artesanía, en el cual se dedica a tejer con los dedos de la mano.
Ana se dedica a este oficio desde hace 8 años. Ella tiene muchos clientes, ya que vende sus tejidos en diferentes ferias artesanales y además realiza desfiles de moda de sus tejidos.
Con éste préstamo pretende comprar el permiso de estadía en la feria artesanal, además de pagar un guardia de seguridad, pasajes y lanas.
El sueño de Ana es poder exportar su artesanía, sin embargo todavía no puede expandir su negocio, ya que quiere realizar una ampliación en su casa, para agrandar también su taller.
Ana vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas de 18, 16 y 11 años de edad.
Las motivaciones de Ana de continuar en el negocio de la artesanía, es poder brindarle a su familia una vida más confortable. Junto a esto, quiere invertir más en su negocio, para generar más ganancias y así comprarse una camioneta para trasladar sus productos.
Ana  está muy agradecida del préstamo de Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que con éste podrá invertir y generar más utilidades. También aprende de las capacitaciones realizadas por Fondo esperanza, ha sabido administrar su dinero, invertir en su negocio y tener un buen trato hacia sus clientes. Además disfruta mucho de las reuniones que tiene junto a su grupo, ya que son muy amenas. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Ana forms part of the communal bank "El Tiempo es oro" ["Time is gold"] in the city of Concepción. She has a crafts workshop, in which she weaves with her hands.
Ana has been doing this activity for 8 years. She has many customers, since she sells her fabrics in different craft fairs, and she has has fashion shows with her woven products.
With this loan, she intends to buy admittance to the craft fair, as well as pay a security guard, and buy tickets and wool. 
Ana's dream is to be able to export her handiwork. However, she still can't expand her business, since she wants to get an extension on her house, to enlarge her workshop as well.
Ana lives with her husband and her three daughters who are 18, 16, and 11 years old.
Ana's motivation to continue in her craft business, is to be able to provide a more comfortable life for her family. Along with this, she wants to invest more in her business, in order to generate more earning and in this way buy a truck to transport her products.
Ana is very grateful for the loan from Fondo Esperanza [Hope Fund]. It has been a great support for her business, since with this she can invest and generate more profits. Also, learning from the training done by Fondo esperanza, she has learned how to manage her money, invest in her business and have a good relationship with her customers. Besides enjoying the meetings that she has with this group, they also are very pleasant.
Concepción is located on the mouth of the Bíobío River, one of the biggest in the country, to the south of Chile, in the region of Bíobío. It has had an important part in our history, being the venue of important battles and a prominent settlement, especially during the War of Arauco, for being in the fronteer with the mapuche territory. Currently, the city has an important economic and demographic development, becoming considered one of the most relevant urban, demographic, administrative, financial, and commercial nuclei in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: Admittance to the craft fair, as well as pay a security guard, tickets and wool

loans.name: Edgar Daniel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; el tiene 47 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de telecomunicaciones como venta de  celulares entre otros, el socio tiene su negocio en su propia casa el lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio el saca a su familia adelante, el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de accesorios para su negocio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Edgar is a member of the Communal Bank “El Amancer” (The Dawn) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 47 years old, married, and has three children. Edgar divides his time between his daily activities and his telecommunications business where he sells mobile phones and other items. His business is located in his home and he enjoys managing it. Edgar is happy that this business has enabled his family to get ahead. He is a cheerful and responsible person.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase accessories for his business. Edgar is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories for his business.

loans.name: Sorpheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorpheap S. (pictured above) is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Chanthy Chum, is 38 years old. They live in a village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1997 and have one son who is in grade five.

Sorpheap is a tailor who specializes in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. She is applying for her first loan of $500 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Teresia Wambui

texts.en:
Teresia has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years.  She is a 40 year-old, single mother of two children.

She was introduced to KADET, LTD., by one of our field staff, and this will be her second loan.  She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Teresia hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Julia es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frescos, leña, frijoles, tortillas etc. Ella inicio con la venta de tortilla y luego con las ganancias y los préstamos fue invirtiendo en otros productos.
Ella con el crédito comprara leña, frijoles, sal, ajo, maíz, frutas etc.
texts.en: Mrs. Ana Julia is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who sells frozen fruit treats, firewood, beans, tortillas, etc.  She started out selling tortillas and then used profits and loans to gradually invest in other products.  She will use the loan to buy firewood, beans, salt, garlic, corn, fruit, etc.

loans.use: to buy firewood, beans, salt, garlic, corn, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Amalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 42 años D. edad, es casada y vive con sus hijos.  Su casa está ubicada en el distrito  D. Chepén del departamento D. La Libertad. La condición D. vida en su localidad es tranquila y muy armónica.

Amalia se dedica a la confección D. ropa  todo tipo D. prendas D. vestir, en su mismo domicilio donD.  a ubicado dos maquinas D. coser en la cuales ella trabaja diariamente. Adicionalmente ella se dedica a  elaborar collares aretes sortijas, pulseras, etc. Ambas actividades le ayuda para solventar sus gastos diarios.

Amalia esta solicitando un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa D. 2500  nuevos soles para que ella pueda comprar  material para la confección D. sus prendas D. vestir y la elaboración D. sus productos.
Amalia es una persona muy optimista, que desea salir adelante y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Amalia is 42 years old, married, and she lives with her children. Her house is located in the district of Chepen in the department of La Libertad. Life in her community is very tranquil and harmonious.

Amalia makes all types of articles of clothing in her own home. She has two sewing machines and she works with them every day. She also makes necklaces, earrings, rings, bracelets, etc. These activities help her to cover her daily expenses.

Amalia requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2500 nuevos soles to purchase materials to make her articles of clothing and her crafts.

Amalia is a very optimistic person who wants to move forward to be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a twenty nine year old married man with three children.  He lives in his own semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcycle rider and a farmer who has been in these businesses for six years with minimal challenges, such as motorcycle breakdowns. He dreams of educating his children and of owning five motorcycles for his transport business. Joseph needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Angelie has been in this business for three years. Angelie earns more income from movie tapes & DVDs rentals.

Angelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a 40-year-old business lady who has been running a green grocery shop since 1994. Prior to this, she was selling only potatoes. 

She is married and blessed with four children age 29, 25, 21 and 19. 

In the next five years, she hopes to become a well established business lady in her local community and to open up other business outlets.
 
She has requested 30,000 KES to buy bananas, oranges, avocados and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges, avocados and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: Doña Eduarda desde hace 3 años realiza la actividad de compra y venta de cerdos, la cual se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos para la manutencion y el bienestar economico de su familia, dicha actividad la realiza en conjunto con su esposo, necesita de este financiamiento porque no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para sastifacer la demanda de sus clientes, esto le permitira incrementar el volumen de compra y asi poder mejorar su nivel de ganancia, en su comunidad la consideran como una mujer trabajadora y responsable con muchos deseos de superacion
texts.en:
Ms. Eduarda has been buying and selling pigs for three years. It has become her principal source of income for supporting and providing for the economic well-being of her family. She does this work together with her husband.

She needs this loan because she does not have the economic resources needed to satisfy her customers' demands. This loan will allow her to increase her purchase volume and thereby improve her earnings.

In her community, Eduarda is considered to be a hard-working and responsible woman with a great desire to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy and sell more pigs

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en: Everlyn is 29 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has five children between the ages of 3 and 12, all of whom attend school. For the past four years, Everlyn has been selling dried goods (rice, oil, soap, etc.) in her community where she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. Everlyn plans to send her children to a quality school in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business

loans.name: Gregoria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Gregoria del Socorro es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, es una señora luchadora que cuenta con su familia y la que siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece abarrotería, refrescos, comida la cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación con muchos años de experiencia, cuenta con la ayuda de dos de sus hijas quienes también se encargan del negocio.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y construir su propia vivienda, adquirir sus bienes del hogar. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es adquirir una computadora portátil para sus nietos con el fin de que agilicen sus trabajos escolares, por tal razón decidió solicitar su quinto crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad
texts.en:
Gregoria del Socorro is from the town of El Sauce.  She is a very determined woman who relies on her family, and has always been a merchant. Currently she has her own business, consisting of a small general store located in her home, where she sells groceries, soft drinks, and food.  She has many years of experience and has the help of two of her daughters, who also help run the business. 

Since she started her business, it is has been known for satisfying the needs of its customers. Thanks to her own efforts, she has been able to help her family get ahead in life, build her own house, and furnish it. 

One of things that she needs is to buy a laptop computer for her grandchildren, so that they can do their schoolwork more quickly.  For this reason, she decided to apply for her fifth loan from Ceprodel, with the aim of fulfilling this need.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer for her grandchilden's education.

loans.name: Ruvimbo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41 year old Rebecca (raising her hand) from Masvingo. She is married with five children, four attending school. Rebecca runs a tailoring business producing clothes. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenge faced is low capital. 

Rebecca has requested a loan of $300 to buy cloth and sewing accessories. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. In the future Rebecca plans to operate a retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and spare parts

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a very hardworking, single man. He is 30 years old. A KADET customer introduced him to KADET. His primary business is quarrying at the busy Ngurunga quarry sites in Kitengela, where most of his customers are.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase another quarry site so that he can meet the demand of his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land and build rental houses. He has dreams to buy a truck to transport the cut stones.

loans.use: to purchase a quarry site

loans.name: Manessa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade e um ainda frequenta a escola. Fez 5ª classe e naõ continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois sobrinhos que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é comerciante ha mais de 5 anos e tem um rendimendo de cerca de 8.500.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar cerveja E refrescos para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para ampliar a sua actividade comercial e construir uma casa,irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born in Maputo city, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique, the borrower is single and the mother of three children. Two are adults, and one still attends school. She completed Grade 5 and did not continue due to lack of funds. She lives in her own home with her family and supports two nephews who live with her.

She has never left her homeland. She has run a small business for more than five years and earns about 8,500 MT (Mozambican Meticals) per month. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account.

She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her first loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 12,000 MT. With the loan she will buy beer and soft drinks to increase the amount of goods in her small shop.

In the future she will try to grow her business and build a house. She will ask for more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
This is Nestor, age 45, who is a resident of Tanza, Cavite, in the Philippines. He is married to Rufina, a housewife and mother to their three children. Nestor, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nestor operates a market stall. He sells meat and vegetable products in the community market. He buys quantities of meat, fish and vegetables, and sells them per kilo. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help him continue to operate his business, Nestor is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. He will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of meat and vegetables to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Nestor hopes to be able to expand soon and buy a motorcycle for his business. He hopes to support his children's schooling up to the college level. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of meat and vegetables needed in his business.

loans.name: Lurcille

texts.en:
Lurcille is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Lurcille has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for nine years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.

Lurcille has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Lurcille hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Mayra Mercedes

texts.es:
Mayra, vive en el Coyolar un vecindario ubicado en la ciudad de León, tiene 47 años de edad, madre de 5 hijos todos  ellos independientes. Ella nos dice que toda su vida ha sido comerciante, comenzó vendiendo en las calles frescos, ropa  luego vendió productos de limpieza  y posteriormente con los ahorros obtenidos de sus negocios anteriores y el apoyo de su esposo  logro poner si kiosko donde  vende gaseosas, jugos, agua, café, dulces snacks lleva 11 años con este negocio y del cual se siente muy  orgullosa pues es gracias a el que ha salido poco a poco adelante. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como gaseosas, jugos, agua embotellada, dulces, snacks, productos que se mueven y de los cuales necesita para surtir su kiosko. Pues en lo futuro quiere poner otro kiosko en la terminal de buses de la ciudad de León. Su meta próxima es comprar un exhibidor para gaseosas.
texts.en:
Mayra lives in Coyolar, a neighborhood located in the city of León. She is 47 years old and the mother of 5 children, all grown and independent. She tells us she has been a merchant all her life. She started selling drinks and clothes. Later she sold cleaning products and later, with her savings from her previous businesses and her husband' support she was able to open a sales kiosk. She sells soft drinks, water, coffee, candies and snacks. She has been in this business for 11 years She is very proud of this, because thanks to it she has been able to get ahead little by little.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, juices, bottled water, candies, snacks, products that move and that she needs for her kiosk.  In the future, she wants to open a kiosk in the bus terminal of the city of León. Her next goal is to buy a soft drink for soft drinks.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, juices, bottled water, candies, snacks, products that move and ones she need for her kiosk.

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 30 years old and married with one child who is three years old. She owns a business selling various goods such as cosmetics and handicrafts. Monique has been in the business for three years. Her hours are 7 am to 6 pm, and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Monique has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products to sell. With any profits from the loan, Monique will save for her future, and she hopes to buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and handicrafts to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 46-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He started from brick laying  and managed to get enough income to start a pub, which he has now operated for six years.  In his business, he has faced the following hardships: price fluctuation, inflation, and customers not paying on time.  His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home.  John needs the loan to buy beers and spirits to sell this Christmas Season.

loans.use: to buy beers and spirits to sell this Christmas season

loans.name: 1131480038 Group

texts.en:
Alice is 42, married, and has four children aged 20, 17, 15 and 12. Three of her children are still of school-going age. Alice lives in Mvuma and her husband is employed by a local forestry company. She operates a business from a flea market in Mvuma where she sells clothing and formal shoes for both men and women. The clothing she sells includes men’s suits, women's suits, t-shirts, dresses, jeans, and blankets. She also receives rent of $25 every month from her tenant, which helps her supplement her income. 
Alice used the loan she was granted to purchase suits for both men and women. The main challenge she faces in her business is that of high competition, high import duties at the border post, and high transport costs because she buys her products from South Africa. Alice is looking forward to operating her own shop in the next five years. She will then be in a position to pay school fees for her children and buy a residential stand.

loans.use: to buy suits for both men and women.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es: Narda, de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, está separada, vive en compañía de su madre y sus hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad que son su motivación para seguir trabajando, habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre. El negocio que tiene Narda es la venta de hielo y los reparte entre los negocios de sus vecinos que se dedican a la venta de bebidas heladas, haciendo entregas a domicilio o puesto de venta. Asimismo se dedica a la venta de raspadillas (hielo con esencia de frutas) en el frontis de la casa de sus padres. Para estos negocios cuenta con una congeladora que le regaló su hermano quien a su vez le dio la iniciativa de iniciarse en ese negocio realizándola ella sola desde hace 3 años. Le agrada su negocio pues le permite estar en casa y tener libertad de tiempo para atender a su madre que está mal de salud, así como el ingreso económico con el cual se ayuda para los gastos de su hogar y de sus hijos a los que quiere mucho. Ahora viendo la buena acogida que tiene su negocio desea seguir avanzando y ampliarlo. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gaseosas a precio por mayor para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Narda is a 48 year old, hard-working and earnest woman.  She is separated and lives with her mother and children ages 15 and 12, who are her motivation to keep working.  They all live comfortably in her mother's house.  Narda has a business selling ice.   She distributes it among her neighbor's businesses who sell beverages, making deliveries to homes and sales stands.  She also sells raspadillas (ice with fruit flavoring) in front of her parents house.  For these businesses she has a freezer that was given to her by her brother who proposed that she start this business.  She has been doing it for 3 years now.  She likes this business as it allows her to be home and have the free time to care for her mother who is in poor health.  The income also helps with the household expenses as well as the expenses of her children, whom she loves very much.  Now, realizing how well-received her business is, she wants to continue to advance and expand it.  

This will be her first loan with MFP.  She feels grateful for the line of credit so she can advance her business.  She is committed to making her payments on time.  With the 800 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] requested she will buy soft drinks at wholesale prices to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase beverages to expand her business.

loans.name: Christ Yancy

texts.en:
Christ Yancy needs to work hard to earn profit for his wife and child. At 19, he already has one infant child. He knows that he is still young to engage in the hardship of farming, but he has the responsibility to provide for the needs of his loving family. 

To make a living, he is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to improve his farming business. Through them, he will be able to gain abundant crops to sell and earn enough funds to support his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used to improve his farming business.

loans.name: Barrio Pincha - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
La señora CRESENCIANA MARIA de 36 años de edad madre soltera con 02 hijo   menor de edad  en etapa escolar. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Barrio Pincha - Chupaca”.

Se dedica a la Crianza y venta de animales menores como cuy, pollos, gallinas, etc. El préstamo solicito para la compra de alimentos balanceados y otros para sus animales, Desea en el futuro  comprarse su propia casa. 
Ella está ubicada la segunda persona lado derecha viste de polo color blanco y chompa color rosada.
texts.en:
Cresenciana Maria is 36 years old and she is a single mother of 2 children of school age. She is a member of the “Barrio Pincha - Chupaca” Community Bank. 
She engages in breeding and selling small animals such as “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), hens, and chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy animal feed, as she engages in breeding and fattening her animals to sell them every week-end in the commercial fair of her community.
In the future she wants to buy her own house. In the picture she is the second person on the right hand side, dressed in a white polo shirt and a pink sweater.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 24 years old and married with children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda in a semi-permanent house. He has been in the transport sector for two years. His dream is buying a new motorcycle since he now rides for someone else who takes 70% of his daily earnings. He also has challenges of high fuel costs, and his family dream is to build a permanent house. Patrick needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Edilita

texts.en:
Edilita is 48 years old and has seven children. Edilita is married and has one child in school.

Edilita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Edilita requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Edilita has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edilita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Janerose

texts.en: Janerose is Married with Eight children. All are in school. The husband is a retired labour officer. She started her grains and flour Business in 1999 to support her family’s needs. With the help of her first loan of $90 from PEMFI she was able to stock her business and support all her Children in Primary School. With the second loan of $150 she plans to boost her stock further to improve her income and service to her local community. She also plans  to start an animal feed Business to broaden her income base. She hopes to get a bigger loan in future to support her grain selling business. She has a big vision of her future.

loans.use: To Buy More Stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I intent to expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
MARIA IS 32 YEARS OLD, MARRIED, TWO CHILDREN. HER HUSBAND WORKS IN A MUSICAL GROUP, PARTICIPATING IN EVENTS WHERE THEY ARE HIRED. SHE HAS IN HER HOME A GROCERY STORE WHICH SUPPLIES THE NEIGHBORS OF HER COMMUNITY.

MARIA BELONGS TO THE SOLIDARITY GROUP "FLOR DE LIZ 4," AND HER FELLOW GROUP MEMBERS ARE:

NORMA ROJAS HERNANDEZ (SELLING SEWING NOTIONS)

LIBERIANA M. HERNANDEZ (SELLING FRUIT)

THE THREE HOPE WITH THIS LOAN TO GROW THEIR BUSINESSES, MOVE INTO A LOCATION (WHICH THEY DON'T HAVE NOW), AND DIVIDE THE AMOUNT INTO EQUAL PARTS.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

MARIA TIENE 32 AÑOS , CASADA, DOS HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN UN GRUPO MUSICAL Y PARTICIPA EN EVENTOS DONDE CONTRATAN SUS SERVICIOS . ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN LA CUAL SE ABASTECEN L OS VECINOS DE SU COMUNIDAD . MARIA PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO FLOR DE LIZ 4 Y SUS COMPAÑERAS DE GRUPO SON :

NORMA ROJAS HERNANDEZ ( VENTA DE MERCERIA )

LIBERIANA M. HERNANDEZ ( VENTA DE FRUTAS )

LAS TRES ESPERAN CON EL PRESTAMO CRECER EN SUS NEGOCIOS , INSTALANDO UN LOCAL DE VENTA ( LAS QUE NO LO TIENEN ) Y DIVIDIR EL MONTO DEL PRESTAMO EN PARTES IGUALES .

loans.use: GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Janelia

texts.en:
Janelia A. is a single mother of four living in Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti. She supports her four young children through her local community food business. Although Janelia only has the equivalent of an elementary school education, she has proven to be very resourceful in meeting the needs of her customers by providing a mobile delivery service. Since she lacks a physical storefront, Janelia is often seen walking the streets of her community, faithfully delivering her customers' orders to their homes. She will use this first loan to expand the inventory of her store with foods such as rice and nuts.

Note: Janelia is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his or her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his or her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand her inventory with rice and nuts.

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela is a living example of a hardworking and diligent woman. After her husband’s death 15 years ago, she had to work a lot in order to take care of her three sons. Currently, she considers herself satisfied with her commitment, since her sons are working in other parts of the country and can earn their own living. She’s now living with her three grandsons.

People in Guanuma are facing a serious water scarcity. If it doesn’t rain, they have to walk about 8 km to reach the public tap to collect water daily. Michaela thinks she can have a positive impact in her community and has decided to do something. She plans to buy a second-hand motorcycle and some five-gallon bottles. She also wants to buy a pack saddle to put behind the motorcycle to carry the bottles.

As Michaela is an elderly woman, she’ll let her 19-year-old grandson tend to the business. Daily, the boy will go all around the streets to sell water to people in the community. To start this business, Michaela is asking for a US$ 225 loan which will be repaid in a period of 6 months.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle so as to distribute water in the community.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.pt:
Miguel Tomás M. was born on September 13th, 1967 in the province of Inhambe. He was raised by his grandparents and studied until the 5th grade. He is 40 years old, married and father of 6 children. When he was 12 years old he started working in a furniture factory as a carpenter. His company got into financial trouble so Miguel left and started working as a carpenter. He got married when he was 18 years old. Today, he has 6 employees. One has 6 children and the other supports 13 people. He has a small shop in his home where he sells furniture. He buys the lumber in cities nearby. The best time for business is in the end of the year. His monthly income always varies.

All his products bring in income, however he has been experiencing difficulty because of the rise of the price of lumber. His profit margin has been of 6.000mt to 10.000mt. With the income he pays his employees, reinvests in the business, and tries to save. In the suture he plans on building a bakery for when he is no longer strong enough to work as a carpenter. He already ahs a lot where he plans to build the bakery. He is very pleased with the credit program. He wants to increase his inventory and income.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Ferroviário- Maputo cidade Cliente:Miguel M. Actividade: Fabrico e venda de Mobília Valor de Empréstimo:20.000,00mt ( 800usd) Aplicação: Compra de Madeira Início: 18-09-07 Fim: 10-01-09

Miguel Tomás M. , nasceu aos 13 de Setembro de 1967 na província de Inhambane, tem 40 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e tem 6 filhos estudou até 5ªclasse. Passou uma parte da sua infância com os avôs em Inhambane aos 5 anos parte á Maputo onde passou a viver com sua Mãe e Padrasto. Aos 12 anos começou a trabalhar numa fábrica de mobília onde aprendeu a carpintaria e juntava dinheiro com o qual ia comprando ferramentas de trabalho, algum tempo depois a Empresa começou a ter problemas financeiros facto que lhe fez deixar a Empresa e começar a trabalhar a conta própria na área da carpintaria não tendo formação formal e , faz este trabalho a 18 anos ,em 1989 junta se com a sua esposa . Tem 6 empregados dois quais um tem um filho e outro tem 6, vive com 13 pessoas na sua responsabilidade. Possui uma oficina junto de sua casa e uma loja de venda de mobília a meio kilómetro de casa. Os seus estabelecimentos abrem as 7 horas e não precisa de nenhum transporte para se deslocar por ser perto de casa. Tem comprado a madeira nas serrações localizadas nos arredores da cidade e aluga uma viatura para o seu transporte, e o período bom para o seu negócio é no fim do ano . Não tem tido receita mensal fixa tendo em conta que as vezes chega a não ter nenhuma receita mensal devido ao tipo de negócio.

Todos os produtos que faz dão lucro e tem registo das vendas e as dificuldades tem sido a financeira devido á subida galopante do preço da Madeira e por ser um negócio que as vezes leva muito tempo para vender. A margem de lucro tem sido de 6,000 a 10,0000.00mt e com os rendimentos tem feito o reinvestimento , pagamento do salário de trabalhadores e uma parte deposita. Futuramente pretende instalar uma padaria para quando não ter mais força para trabalhar com a madeira sendo um trabalho pesado passará a se dedicar no negócio de pão e já possui um terreno para o efeito a 30km da cidade de Maputo. Está satisfeito com o empréstimo embora acha pouco o valor que lhe foi concedido mas ajudou em parte uma vez que aumentou o volume da matéria prima pretende crescer mais nesta actividade.

loans.use: To buy raw material ( wood for furniture)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs, and umbrellas

loans.name: Lufula B(Iii) Group

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old and a widow with three children. She has a retail shop. Eva and Jane want to use the loan to purchase more goods for their retail shops. Suzan sells fruits and vegetables. Irene wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for her children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her retail shop

loans.name: Agibola

texts.en: Ajibola A. is 38 years old, married and has 4 children; she lives in mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells diesel and oil. She has been in this business since 1997. She requests a loan in the amount of $450 to buy more diesel & oil for sale.

loans.use: To buy more Diesel & Oil for sale

loans.name: Easther

texts.en:
Easther is 27 years old and is a single woman. Easther owns a small salon, which she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Manfred

texts.es:
From early childhood, MANFRED demonstrated abilities and attitudes conducive to dancing the typical dances of his community and belonged to a company of dancers every year. After many years, he decided to organize his own company called "America Dances" and served as a teacher and director. The company is welcomed by the youth of the city and the various colleges that request their services. In addition to utilizing his talent, this optimistic and hardworking young man makes the costumes for his artistic ballets; work that so far provides significant income and opportunities to improve his quality of life, but come with certain limitations due to the large capital investment required for this business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

MANFRED, desde muy niño desarrolló habilidades y actitudes favorables para bailar las danzas típicas de su comunidad y año a año perteneció a un elenco de baile y después de muchos años decidió organizar su propio elenco y desempeñarse como maestro y director llamado “América Danzas”, el cual tiene mucha acogida por los jóvenes de la ciudad y los diversos colegios que solicitan sus servicios.Este joven optimista y trabajador además de explotar su talento, confecciona los trajes para la presentación de su ballet artístico; trabajo que hasta el momento le da grandes ingresos económicos y posibilidades de mejorar su calidad de vida. Pero sin duda con ciertas limitaciones debido al gran capital de inversión que requiere para este negocio.

loans.use: To improve the dance instruction space and acquire a greater quantity of fabrics.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris N. is a twenty-nine-year-old single parent of one child. She has owned and operated a beauty salon for the past eight years. Doris is a very skilled and talented hair dresser who adds beauty and value to the hair of her many customers. That is her secret.

Doris believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators, among other products. This will help her to avoid shortages and poor service. Doris is a member of the community group called Nkwabin Ladies Trust Group. Nkwabin is the name of the local community. In this group, members use social collateral to guarantee the loans for one another. They use positive peer pressure to encourage each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, pomade, shampoo and activators

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 47 year old mother with two children. She is also taking care of a sister’s child. Selling frozen foods and grocery products has been her business for ten years. Initially, she sold only frozen foods, like fish, beef, chicken, and mutton, but has now added eggs, eggplants, tinned tomatoes, and charcoal to increase her income. Florence wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods and a deep freezer to enable her to stock more frozen foods.

She is a member of the group called “Nyame ne ye Hwefo” meaning God is our Caretaker. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen foods and a deep freezer.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S., 25, collects recyclable items in Kampong Cham and typically makes US$3 each day. She lives with her husband, Ngan Seth, and they have four young children. Her husband operates a motortaxi service and makes US$5 each day. Her husband has a good business, but his old motorbike is creating a lot of unnecessary expenses and is hindering his ability to earn more income. Eng S. has asked for a loan of US$800 to replace her husband’s motorbike and to make an investment in her husband’s business. She sees this loan as a great opportunity for her family to increase its income and improve its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
The serious and sometimes melancholy expression on Ana’s face is caused by the death of her daughter, which she still has not gotten over. She lives with her retired husband and one of her six children, the only one who is unmarried. Ana has a shop on Villaizán Ave. in the Independencia district in Huaraz. Ana, who is a member of the communal bank “Las Candelarias II”, is 59 years old has her own business and a shop in Lima which she rents out to generate income. She is just completing construction of a small stand besiD. her shop to open another business selling a bean salad maD. from lupin seeds, (“tarwi” “chochos” “altramuces”)

With this loan of 500 Soles which will be awarded by the Manuela Ramos Movement, to be repaid in four installments, she will purchase two sacks of rice, a sack of sugar and other supplies that she is running out of.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

El rostro serio D. Ana y a veces melancólico lo atribuye a la muerte D. su hija, la cual aún no ha podido superar, vive junto a su esposo jubilado y su único hijo soltero, D. los seis que tiene, ella tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en la Av. Villaizán en el distrito D. independencia D. Huaraz. Ana, que forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II”,D. 59 años ha logrado tener su propio negocio y una tienda en Lima la cual alquila y le genera ingresos líquidos, ahora esta acabando D. construir un local independiente, al lado D. su tienda ,para poder abrir otro negocio, un Cebichocho (venta D. chocho o tarwi a manera D. ensalada ). Con el préstamo D. 500 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, implementará su negocio comprando por mayor dos sacos D. arroz ,un saco D. azúcar y otros productos que ya se le acabo.

loans.use: Purchase various supplies

loans.name: Lizbeth Aimet

texts.es:
La señora Lizbeth Aimet, tiene 29 años, está casada, estudió Dental Técnico y corte y confección, tiene 03 hijos, se encuentran estudiando, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.
Para ayudarse económicamente, empezó trabajando en un taller de costura, como no le daba el tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos, decidió trabajar en su casa porque tiene libertad de escoger horario de trabajo además tiene 01 máquina de coser y 01 remalladora, la socia tiene 05 años en este negocio, elabora buzos deportivos, ropa sobre medida, arreglos de basta, cierres.
Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su sobrina la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “MUJERES AL ÉXITO” ella decidió pertenecer a este Banco porque necesitaba un préstamo para ampliar el pequeño taller y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró tela polar para hacer buzos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses, tiene pensado invertir en la compra de cintas para buzos, cierres, hilos de colores. 
En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de secretaria, cuya función es llenar el libro de actas, pasar lista a las socias.
La empresaria sueña con ampliar el taller para tener mercería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
