Miss Lizbeth Aimet is 29 years old, she is married, she studied Dental Technician and dressmaking. She has 3 children who are in school. She lives in the District of Trujillo, Province of Trujillo in the Department La Libertad.

In order to help herself economically, she started working at seamstress workshop, since she didn't have time to look after her children, she decided to work from home because she would have the freedom of choosing her own work schedule. She has a sewing machine and a overlook machine. She makes track suits, made to measure clothes, hems and zippers. The partner has had this business for 5 years.

She has been working with the Movement Manuela Ramos for one year. Her niece recommended her to the MUJERES AL EXITO Communal Bank. She decided to belong to this Bank because she needed a loan to expand the small workshop. With the first loan of $115 she bought polar cloth to make the track suits.

With this loan of $ 675 that she will repay over a period of 4 months, she plans to buy ribbons for the track suits, zippers and threads of different colors. She is the secretary at the Communal Bank. Her role is to do the minutes book, and take roll call of the partners. The businesswoman dreams are extending the workshop to have a notions store and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zippers, threads, ribbons, and other materials.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca Teye P. is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of two children. At the moment, one of her children attends school.  She is a member of a group named Action Faith Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee and assist one another in repaying their loans. Her picture was taken during their group meeting. 

She sells baby clothes, pampers, powder, napkins, detergent, feeding bottles and other items through hawking. She balances the items on her head and walks miles to her customers. She needs a loan to enable her to inject more capital into her business. The loan will pay for more supplies and materials to increase her stock.  The profits will be used to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, pampers, baby oil, detergent and plastic materials.

loans.name: Luzmila Yovanni

texts.es:
La señora Luzmila  tiene 34 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Empresarias  al Éxito II  y vive en la calle Gamarra 793 del Puerto de Salaverry provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La libertad Perú.
Estudió su secundaria completa, pero ya no pudo continuar estudiando debido a que quedo huérfana de madre  y su papá no se dedicó a ella.
Se casó a los 20 años con Aldo Mecola y tienen 6 hijos, 3 varones y 3 mujeres, muy bien educados y con grandes habilidades.
Yovanni prepara postres por las mañanas como son; mazamorra, arroz con leche, flan y los vende por la tarde de manera ambulatoria, por todo el puerto.  Los días de fiesta y los domingos hace anticuchos para venderlos también de manera ambulatoria.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles  devuelto en 4 cuotas compró utensilios para los postres, como vasitos y cucharitas descartables, también fuentes.
Con este crédito de 300 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas comprará utensilios y materiales como azúcar, arroz, flan.
Yovanni sueña con ver a sus hijos profesionales y  construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luzmila is 34 years old and belongs to the Successful Businesswomen II Community Bank. She lives at Gamarra Street 793 of the Salaverry Port in the Trujillo province of the La Libertad department in Peru. Yovanni finished secondary school but couldn't continue her studies because her mother died and her father didn't care for her. When she was 20 years old she married Aldo Mecola and now they have six children, three boys and three girls. All of the children are well educated and very talented. Yovanni spends her mornings preparing deserts, such as mazamorra, rice with milk, and flan. She sells the deserts in the afternoon, traveling throughout the port. On holidays and Sundays Yovanni makes and sells kebabs. With her first loan of 300 soles she bought utensils, such as disposable cups and spoons, as well as serving dishes. Yovanni repaid the loan in four installments. With this loan of 300 soles, Yovanni will buy utensils and sugar, rice, and flan. She'll repay the loan in four installments. Yovanni dreams of seeing her children become professionals and building her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies wholesale

loans.name: Rat

texts.en:
Mrs. Rat C., of Lvengreusey Commune, Siem Reap Province, is a 37-year-old rice farmer and the mother of two children, both students. Her husband, Mr. Bing Ngorn, 32, has been a fisherman since 2005, earning approximately $6 per day.

Mrs. Rat is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy rice seed and fertilizers and to pay for the plowing of her farmland.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Shahnaz Shoqat Maish Group

texts.en:
I am Shahnaz and I am a citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan. I have been living in this city for the past 20 years. I am an uneducated lady; I couldn’t get education because we were hand-to-mouth. My husband's name is S. M.. My husband has a very good nature and he is a very kind human being. He is a wholeseller. He collects the stock from the wholesale market and sells on different shops on wholesale. He has been in this profession for the past 10 years. I have six children: three sons and three daughters. None of my children go to school. My elder son is a daily wage labor. My daughter helps me in household work and in the making of embroidered clothes as well. I and my daughters make embroidered cloth and sell it in cloth markets to earn a good profit. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy rice to expand my husband’s wholesale business.

I am a leader of a group with a few more women of my locality. Shakeela Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Anwari baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to resell. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy material (beads,colored thread and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy rice wholesale for resale.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Leticia T. R. es casada, tiene un hijo, ellos tienen 29 años de vivir en su hogar. Su esposo trabaja como transfer y la señora Leticia trabaja como secretaria en un consultorio médico en el cual lleva 12 años laborando. 
La señora Leticia está solicitando un préstamo para ampliar la planta baja de su casa con madera, para que de esta manera ella y su familia tengan en un hogar más amplio y en buenas condiciones para vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Leticia T. R. is married and has one child. They have lived in their home for 29 years. Her husband works in transportation and Leticia works as a secretary in a medical clinic, where she has worked for 12 years. Leticia is requesting a loan in order to expand the ground floor of her house with wood. In this manner, she and her family will have a larger home in good condition so they may live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of the wooden ground floor.

loans.name: Sotheavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheavy S. is a group leader of five members who all live in the Kampong Boeng village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is doing well, she wishes to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Sotheavy S. is 26 years old and is a mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Teth, is a motorbiK. repairer. 

One member in this group loans is end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to maK. payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients maK. their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for her breeding pig business.

loans.name: Benki Group

texts.en:
Kajembe has been a potato seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.
  
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more potatoes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Kajembe is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Annah, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sajida Sajjad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Sajida baji is a 27-year-old married lady and a citizen of a city named Kot Radha Kishan for the last 8 years. Her husband's name is S. H., and he is a mason by profession. He constructs buildings under the guidance of a building constructor and earns half of the family's income.

Sajida baji is a very hardworking woman. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to milk their buffalo. After that, she sells the buffalo milk to the milk shops. She does this work to meet the financial expenses of her household. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a micro finance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband.

She is the group leader of four other women from her area. Nasreen baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy bricks to sell. Gulistan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy masonry tools

loans.name: Fatimon

texts.en:
Fatimon sells baby products like cream, flasks, powder and clothes. She hawks her goods from one street to another within her community in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 36-years old and married with three children. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more baby products to sell.
Fatimon says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby products to sell

loans.name: Shade

texts.en: Shade is 32 years old and married with four children. Shade sells clothes. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra del Socorro M. A. tiene la edad de 42 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Sandra tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan. La actividad económica de Sandra es la venta de discos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Sandra inicio por que observo que muchos clientes buscaban la manera de conseguir su película favorita, y fue así como le agrado la idea de facilitarles a sus clientes estos productos. Los propósitos de Sandra son de mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que sus clientes se encuentren satisfechos con sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital compra para la inversión de su negocio para la compra de discos, compra de DVD portátiles para mostrar sus películas. El deseo de Sandra es darle mejoras a su vivienda ya que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sandra del Socorro M. A. is a single, 42-year-old, single mother of 6 children, all of whom are employed. Her business is the sale of DVDs, a business she's been dedicated to for over 6 years. She began her work having observed than many customers would look to the way of obtaining their favorite films and this gave her the idea of providing them. Her aims now are to provide the best quality of products so that her customers will be completely satisfied. These funds will be used to invest in inventory for her store as well as in the purchase of portable DVD players to show her films. Sandra also hopes to improve her dwelling as she has always struggled to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Ravshankul

texts.en: T. Ravshankul is 25 years old and is married. Together with his wife they have two children. Ravshankul is a farmer who owns a plot of land in their village on which he grows different kinds of crops like wheat, potatoes, onions and other vegetables. He has been in this business since 2004. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labour and to expand the business, Ravshankul would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose F. sells smoked fish and fresh foods at Kpeme, in Hohoe. She has been in this business since 2000. Rose is married and has three children. Her husband is a pastor. She received junior high school education. She is responsible for all the financial needs of the children. Her loan will be used to buy assorted vegetables to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria Del Carmen S. H.  reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Maria tiene  52 años de edad, es una mujer soltera y vive solamente con su madre la Sra. Dalia de 87 años de edad quien sigue trabajando como comerciante. Maria posee un puesto en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla donde vende variedad de artesanías salvadoreñas, unas son hechas por ella misma y otras la compra, el crédito que solita Maria es para surtir su negocio ya que desea adquirir nueva mercadería en productos artesanales que le ayudaran a aumentar sus ventas en una zona muy transitada como lo es el mercado en el que se encuentra su local.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen S. Hernandez resides in the La Libertad department. Maria is 52 years old, is single, and lives alone with her mother, Dalia who is 87 years old and keeps working as a merchant. Maria has a stand in the Santa Tecla municipal market where she sells a variety of Salvadoran artisans, some which she makes herself and others she buys. The loan which Maria is asking for is to support her business now that she wants to acquire new merchandise in artisan products which will help her increase her sales in a transitory zone like the market in which her spot is located.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing her buiness

loans.name: Isidro Eradio

texts.es:
El señor Isidro P. ha unido sus esfuerzos para atender su negocio de ferretería en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde ofrece todo tipo de productos ferreteros los cuales son ofrecidos todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana.

La razón por la que ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de los productos de ferretería ya que le es importante adquirirlos a lo inmediato por parte de sus proveedores para así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isidro P. has centered all his efforts on tending to his hardware business in the city of Chinandega's central market, where he offers all kinds of hardware products every day starting at the early morning hours. The reason he is requesting this loan is so he can purchase his hardware supplies, since it's important he gets them immediately from his suppliers so he can satisfy his customers' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hardware supplies

loans.name: Maria Eloisa

texts.es:
La señora María Eloisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 41 años, es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

María Eloisa, lleva 05 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, anteriormente trabajaba en Educación y quedándose sin trabajo, decidió por ella misma implementar su propio taller de costura y teniendo la habilidad  para la costura no dudo en hacerlo. Poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus confecciones, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les  atiende  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza.  

 Uno de sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller de confección, con nuevas maquinas, cambiando lo antiguo por lo nuevo y construir su propia casa, de esta manera brindar seguridad y comodidad a sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,800.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora María Eloisa belongs to the communal bank "Honestidad y Trabajo" ("Honesty and Work"), in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres provence, department of San Martín. She is single, 41 years old, and the mother of 2 children, who still depend on her. María Eloisa has dedicated the past 5 years to making and tailoring dresses. Before that, she worked in education. After losing her job, she made her mind up to start her own dressmaking workshop, and, since she already had the skills to make nice dresses, she did not hesitate to begin working on this goal. Bit by bit she has earned money and saved her income, working from within her own home, which is a pleasant working environment for her. She tells us that her dressmaking is going very well, and that she now receives orders ahead of time from customers who want her to make dresses for them. She treats all of her customers with her characteristic friendliness and charisma. Her dream, a goal which she continues striving to achieve, is to open her own proper dressmaking workshop, complete with new machines, switching out the old ones for new ones. She also hopes to complete building her own home, and by doing so provide security and comfort to her children. With this loan of 2,800 Soles, she will purchase meters of fabric of different types and colors, as well as instruments she uses in her dressmaking, such as scissors, large spools of thread in a variety of colors, sewing needles for hand and machine use, pins, and buttons. Today, she is a very satisfied woman, and she continues working hard to make a reality of the dreams she has not yet achieved. She gives her thanks to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to get her business started, and also to the many women who wish to grow and succeed as business owners.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros, agujas, etc.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en: Nver S. is 39. He lives in Sevan with his family, which consists of his wife and 2 sons. Nver was a policeman for about 17 years. Because of his living conditions he opened a butcher’s shop 7 years ago. Every month he earns approximately 120,000 Armenian dram (about $318 US)  from his business. He needs a 700,000 AMD loan to buy a new refrigerator and a modern meat grinder. One of Nver’s sons was entered in an institute for education this year and the expected income of Nver’s business will be used for his son’s education.

loans.use: For a refrigerator and meat grinder

loans.name: Ramiro Arnulfo

texts.es: El señor Ramiro S. de 43 años de edad, reside en Unidad de Propósito en la capital de Managua, casado, con un hijo de 4 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como cajera para aportar a los gastos del hogar ya que todo esta caro , y solo trabajando los dos pueden ahorrar y poder hacer las mejoras a su casa. Don Ramiro tiene un caro el cual lo trabaja como taxi y recorre día a día en la ciudad de Managua para poder subir cliente. Es un trabajo cansado y a veces esta malo el día por que los clientes no abordan la unidad de taxi por el nivel de desempleo en nuestro país, otro de los problemas es cuando se le daña el vehiculo y no trabaja ya que es su fuente de trabajo. Con este crédito dará mantenimiento a su carro como comprar repuestos nuevos y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su meta es poder comprar un carro nuevo lo cual espera que le den el financiamiento. Da las gracias a  la institución por el préstamo el cual lograra las mejoras para su carro y bienestar familiar.

loans.use: Comprar repuesto para dar mantenimiento a su carro

loans.name: Soro Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Soro Yiriwa (5 femmes mariées  et  1 célibataire) ont  en moyenne 38ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à Sanoubougou  I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république  du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire après avoir correctement remboursés tous prêts précédents.
 Elles font la vente de chenilles de karité, d’atièkè, de poisson, de condiments, des savons, des  tissus et  des produits de beauté. 
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  2 sacs de 100kg de chenilles de karité, 2 sacs d’atièkè, 5 kg de poissons frais, 5 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 2 cartons de savons(BF), 2 rouleaux de tissus pour homme et 6 emballages de produits de beauté. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et les villages avoisinants et vendent au marché de Sanoubougou I, dans les autres quartiers de la ville de Sikasso et à domicile. Elles vendent au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
  Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.250 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.
texts.en:
The six members of Soro Yiriwa Group (five married women and one single woman), on average, are 38 years old and have three children. Most of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, a neighborhood of the city of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the demand of their customers. This is their fifth group loan and they have repaid all their previous loans on schedule.

Their businesses consist in selling karité (shea nuts), atièkè (a dish made of seasoned manioc sold with fish), fish, condiments, soap, cloths and beauty products. They will use their new loan to buy 2 sacks of 100 kg karité, 2 sacks of atièkè, 5 kg fresh fish, 5 boxes of food condiments, 2 boxes of BF soap, 2 rolls of cloth for men and 6 packages of beauty products. They buy their products in the city of Sikasso and the nearby villages, and they sell them at the market in Sanoubougou I, in the other neighborhoods of Sikasso and at home. They sell for cash and often on credit to a clientele made up of men and women.

They expect to make an average profit of 23,250 CFA francs (US$52) each per month. They will save or spend part of their profit to provide for their families and reinvest part of it in their businesses. They expect to have more capital at their disposal to better meet the demand of their customers and to be able to set up a sales outlet.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Rosula Rosario

texts.es: Rosula Rosario es una persona perseverante y creativa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años y es madre de cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la confección de carteras de telas y bisutería, su pequeño taller funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Integra el Banco Comunal  “Las Perlas de Manantay” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en telas, ahora necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado para comprar telas, cintas, hilos, piedras para la confección de carteras. La meta de Rosula es tener un taller de costura bien implementado  y así ofrecer trabajo a otras mujeres.
texts.en:
Rosula Rosario is a creative and tenacious person who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 37 years old and is the mother of 4 minor children. She is engaged in the business of making fabric handbags and jewelry; her small workshop is in her house. She has the support of her husband, who buys and sells wood. She has been a member of the communal bank “Las Perlas de Manantay” for a year. The first loan that she obtained was for 300 soles, which she invested in fabrics. Now she needs a loan of 1200 soles that will be used to buy fabrics, ribbon, thread, and beads to use in making the handbags. Rosula's goal is to have a well-equipped sewing shop where she can offer work to other women.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric, ribbon, thread and beads for the production of handbags

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen S., 55, is married and has one child. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and child. To make a living, she grows rice and also buys recycling materials. She earns approximately US $3 per day. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband is involved completely in the recycling business, earning an income of US $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. S. and her family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport recyclable materials.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco  soltero de 28  años de edad, se dedica a realizar trabajos sobre vidrios desde hace más de 10 años, aprendió dicho rubro de su hermano con quien trabajaba hasta hoy día. 

Francisco alquila un pequeño local en donde realiza todo tipo de trabajos tales como: colocación de vidrios templados para ventanas, carameleras, espejos con moldura y otros. 

El señor Francisco comenta que para empezar a trabajar por cuenta propia accedió a un crédito y así pudo comprar  los elementos necesarios de trabajo como amolador, taladro, cortador de hierro y otros. Actualmente ya cuenta con muchos clientes y necesita dicho capital para la compra en gran cantidad de las variedades de vidrio con el fin de realizar los trabajos a tiempo y  no fallar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco, 28, is single and has worked as a glazier for over 10 years. He learned this skill from his brother with whom he still works to this day. Francisco rents a small shop where he does all sorts of jobs such as: installing tempered window glass, building glass shelving, framing mirrors, etc. Francisco tells us that, in order to be able to begin work, he sought credit on his own and was able to buy the necessary basic elements for work such as: grinder, drill, metal saw, etc. Currently, he has many customers and needs capital to buy a large variety of glass so that he can fill his work orders on time thus pleasing his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (glass).

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is fifty-six years old. He is married and his wife has given birth to five children who are currently in school. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, etc. He is also a bicycle repairer. He wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of rice, canned foods and drinks, milk etc. to expand his business. He believes that with increased income, he would be more capable of financing his children’s education to provide them with life opportunities better than what he had.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Sruy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sruy S. is 61 years old and lives in Kor village in Takeo Province. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a silk weaver, one of whom works for a microfinance institution, and the others of whom are studying at the local public school.
Mrs. Sruy S. is a grocer and her husband, Mr. Srieng Orom (shown on the left of the picture), is a famer who owns a 1.5-hectare field for cultivating rice. With this rice-growing business, they face a problem because their field is infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Sruy S. has decided to request a second loan to buy fertilizer. The rest of the loan will be used to buy pesticide, rice seeds, and fuel.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seeds and fuel

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: El sr, Alex A. López es mecánico trabaja en la alcaldía municipal tiene 4 años de laborar para dicha institución el crédito lo solicita para remodelación de su casa ya que necesita compara una arena, cemento, piedrín y hierro para terminar de construirla el ha sentido muy bien el impacto de los crédito que ha tenido con ceprodel ya que han venido a mejorar su vida familiar solo así el pudo construir su vivienda, ha tenido tres créditos con ceprodel, es casado tiene una familia de 5 el cual es tres niñitos su esposa y el. Espera que siempre tenga la oportunidad de que le brinden créditos para poder seguir haciendo mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Alex A. López is a mechanic and he has been working in the city hall for 4 years. He is asking for a loan to remodel his house since he now needs to buy sand, cement, gravel, and iron to finish building it. The loans that he has received from Ceprodel have made a big impact on his life. He sees the improvement in the standard of living of his family. This is the only way he has been able to build his home: with the three loans he has received from Ceprodel. Alex has a family of five: three small children, his wife, and himself. He is hoping to always have the opportunity to receive these loans so that he can continue making improvements on their home.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials such as sand, and cement blocks

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: . Madame Fatou S. est une yoffoise de 65 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne. Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis juin 2000.Elle est veuve et mère de 9 enfants. Elle a déjà rembourse deux prêts antérieurs. C’est une spécialiste en tresses  pour femme. Elle évolue depuis 2004 dans le commerce d’objets d’art, de tam-tam, de boubous, d’arachide et d’oseille en destination de la France. Elle a opte pour cette activité dans l’intention de gagner sa vie et de participer dans la gestion de son avenir ainsi que celui de ses enfants. L’aspect qui  intéresse le plus c'est le caractère    lucratif de son activité  a travers les bénéfices réalises qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses propres besoins.  A la suite du décès de son mari elle avait interrompu ses activités Actuellement son intention est de redémarrer son commerce. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour l’achat de marchandises dans la mesure ou elle programme un voyage. Son objectif est de toujours améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou S. is a 65 year old woman from Yoff, who lives in the neighborhood of Layenne. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC credit union since June 2000. She is a widow and the mother of 9 children. She has repaid her previous 2 loans. She has specialized in braiding women's hair. Since 2004 she has been in business selling artwork, small drums ("tam-tams"), long dresses ("boubous"), palm oil and hibiscus, which she intends to sell in France. She chose this business in order to earn a living and in order to manage her future, and the future of her children. The aspect of the business which interests her the most is that its lucrative nature enables her to realize enough profits to satisfy her needs. Following the death of her husband, she stopped her business for a while. Currently, it is her goal to start her business up again. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to purchase enough merchandise, or to plan the trip to sell her goods. Her goal is always to improve the conditions of her family's life.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her funds.

loans.name: Anesita

texts.en: Anesita O., 33, owns a sari-sari (convenience) store. She sells various types of goods in her store to provide for the daily needs around her neighborhood. She started this business in 2005. Now she’s a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is requesting a loan of 8,000PHP, enough to provide additional capital to fill her store with groceries. Anesita works hard to provide for her family's daily needs and this loan will help her do that.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her convenience store

loans.name: Ermatova Pati Group

texts.ru:
Пати 57 лет. Она замужем и мать 7 детей, из них, только младшие сын и дочь проживают с ней. Остальные дети взрослые и проживают отдельно от родителей. Ее супруг крестьянин, а также занимается животноводством. Сама же ППати занимается розничной торговлей товаров народного потребления в собственном магазине. Кредит будет использован для закупа товаров для магазина. 

Лайли 52 года, замужем. У нее 7 детей: 3 сына и 4  дочери. Она совместно с младшими детьми занимается сельским хозяйством. В основном они выращивают подсолнух. Этим бизнесом они занимаются уже 19 лет. Кредит будет использован для вспахивания земли и закупа 2 МРС. 

Шайыргул 33 года. Ее супруг работает строителем в селе. У нее по два сына и дочери. Все кроме кроме младшей дочери, ходят в школу. Клиент занимается выращиванием кукурузы и подсолнуха.  Кредит будет использован для закупа семян подсолнуха. 

Куттубеку 21 год. Он самый младший участник группы. Проживает вместе с матерью и братом. Он вместе с остальными членами семьи занимаются животноводством и растениеводством. Кредит будет использован для посева риса и подсолнуха.   


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Paty is 57 years old. She is married and is a mother of seven children. Only the youngest son and daughter live with her. The rest of the children are grown up and live separately. Her husband is a farmer and does animal husbandry. Paty does retail sales of every day goods in her own store. The loan will be used to buy merchandise for the store. Layli is 52 years old, she is married. She has seven children: three sons and four daughters. She does farming together with her younger children. They grow mainly sunflowers and have been doing this business for nineteen years now. The loan will be used to aerate the land and to buy two small cattle. Shayirgul is 33 years old. Her husband works as a construction worker in the village. She has two sons and two daughters. Everyone besides the youngest daughter go to school. The client grows corn and sunflowers. The loan will be used to buy sunflower seeds. Kuttubek is 21 years old. He is the youngest member of this group. He lives with his mother and brother. He does animal husbandry and agriculture together with other family members. The loan will be used to sow rice and sunflowers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store, seeds, cattle

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea S., is 37 years old and his wife, Mrs. Korn Eng, is 29 years old. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter.

Sophea has been a driver for ten years, driving for a garment factory. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eleven years. He wants to buy motorcycle for commuting because he does not have transportation. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan $1,000 to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Anicia

texts.en:
Anicia L., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Emmanuel, a water distributor, they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She manages her own variety store.

Anicia has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times through CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, Anicia would like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business, with which she will buy groceries needed to replenish stocks so she can continue the operations of her variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also prays that they will be able to find jobs after they graduate this year.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries needed to replenish stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks, juice and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie P. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Margie owns and operates a fishing business, primarily buying and selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Margie is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Mamacha Rosario - Huancarani Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mamacha Rosario está formado por mujeres y hombres luchadores, alegres y carismáticos que buscan día a día la manera D. salir adelante con sus familias, viven en el distrito D. Huancarani D. la provincia D. Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Huancarani está ubicado a más D. 3600 metros sobre el nivel mar. Huancarani es zona rural como muchas en el Perú donD. la pobreza es extrema y la falta D. oportunidad son  los principales problemas  que atraviesa la población para salir adelante y para el colmo las autoridades muy poco hacen  por apoyarlos y por esos motivos la mayoría D. los pobladores empezaron a formar sus propios negocios. Entre sus actividades sobresale la agricultura, ganadería y la elaboración D. artesanía que realizan las personas mayores o mujeres pues el resto D. la población diariamente salen a comunidades donD. realizan diferentes actividades económicas como: transportistas D. carros, compra y venta D. madera, elaboración D. artesanías, empleados en actividades D. comercio, servicios y principalmente como trabajadores D. la construcción.

El señor Claudio, tiene 41 años, vive en la ciudad D. Huancarani, es casado tiene  6 hijos y su principal actividad económica es la carpintería y su esposa Virginia se dedica a la elaboración D. artesanía. Claudio requiere el préstamo para comprar más madera.  

(Los socios Efraín, Juan Carlos y Nazario aparecen en la parte inferior D. la fotografía pues pidieron permiso para retirase D. la reunión).
texts.en:
The Mamacha Rosario community bank is maD. up of hard-working, charismatic, happy men and women struggling everyday to succeed along with their families. They live in the Huancarani district of the province of Paucartambo in the Cusco department. Huancarani is more than 3600 meters (11,800 ft) above sea level. Huancarani is a rural area like many in Peru where extreme poverty and the lack of opportunities are the greatest obstacles that the residents face in succeeding, and if that weren't enough the authorities do little to support them. For that reason the majority of the residents started their own businesses. Chief among these are farming, raising cattle, and making crafts---done chiefly by the elderly or women since the rest of the population heads to other communities where activities incluD.: driving, lumber traD., craft making, business and service employment, but mainly construction work. Claudio is 41, lives in Huancarani, is married with 6 children and makes a living as a carpenter, while his wife, Virginia who makes crafts. Claudio needs the loan to buy more wood. (Partners Efraín, Juan Carlos and Nazario appear in the lower part of the photograph as they asked for permission to be excused from the meeting).

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more wood

loans.name: John Irungu

texts.en:
John has been in the retail business for four years selling basic household goods such as maize flour, sugar, biscuits, etc.  He is 29 years old, married to Hannah Wanjiku and they have one child.

John was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy sugar and maize flour in bulk, which he will later sell in small quantities for a profit. In the future, John hopes to build up his business to the wholesale level.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Deun's Group

texts.en:
Six people in Krapeu Troum village, Kandal province have formed a loan group and selected 67-year-old Mrs. Deun N. as the leader. Each member will use their loan in varied ways to support their family. 

Mrs. Deun N. is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Now she has a problem because her field has infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Deun N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina M. is from the village of Brgy. Dadap, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Angelina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Angelina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kontye

texts.en:
Kontoye has been practicing mixed farming in the town of Naivasha for 21 years. She is 50 years old, married to Kiranto Ole Loltuala and they have three children.  

Kontoye was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more sheep and goats, which she will sell later at a profit during the peak season. Kontoye also hopes to open a grocery shop where she will sell vegetables from her farm.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats to rear and then sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong K., 58, is a widowed farmer who lives with three of her children in Takeo province. She typically makes US$1 each day and one of her daughter works selling fruit and grocery products, earning US$4 of profit a day.

Hong K. is asking for a loan of US$500 to invest in her daughter’s business.

loans.use: To invest in her daughter's fruit and grocery business

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
N. Olivia lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). Olivia has a business of a retail kiosk. She has been in this business for five years and she works six days out of every week. 

Olivia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baking powder for making chapatti, samosas, and cakes, bans of bread, packed sugar and soap. She also generates additional income through her rentals.

The main business challenge for Olivia is transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are educating her children up to university and improving her standard of living. 

She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest rate. Olivia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: purchasing flour, cakes, bans of bread, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Mrs. Nou Chom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people who live in Thlok village in Takeo province make up this village bank group loan. Mrs. N. C., who was born in 1959, is the village bank president who was selected by the other members. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

She and her husband, Mr. Chies Chorn, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support their famiL.. Besides farming, they have a lot of free time. So, to improve this condition, Mrs. N. C. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. 

She is a mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a bread shop, while another one is employed at a petroleum station and the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola M. is 20 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband is employed as a driver.  Viola is currently in the business of selling cassava beans at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Miryam Rosa

texts.es: Miriam Carmona cuenta que en sus años D. juventud, cuando estudiaba en un colegio D. monjas le sembraron el amor por la costura; su madre tenia condicionado la continuidad D. su estudio con el hecho  D. no enamorarse tan temprano, pero como se enamoró su mamá cumplió lo prometido y por eso no siguió estudiando; fue así como se dedicó a elaborar moldes y a perfeccionar la costura, en una vieja máquina D. pedal y luego su madre le regaló una maquina mas moderna, donD. adicionó nuevos diseños; asì fuè que cuando se casó se dedicó a este oficio con el que ha logrado  apoyar la gestión D. su hogar y su disciplina y buen comportamiento le han ayudado a aumentar sus clientes. Su infraestructura cuenta con dos máquinas, estantes, maniquí y vitrinas, pero necesita mejorar los tiempos D. sus proceso y su acabado, por eso con su credikiva comprará  una maquina rescubridora telas especiales y adornos en gran volumen; porque en el fin D. año va a vestir elegantemente a sus clientes para despedir el 2010: Miriam es una confeccionista reconocida en su sector y   ella dice llamarse a si misma “La aguja D. oro D. Siape”, haciendo una comparación con una D. las diseñadoras famosas  en Colombia : Amalin D. Hazbun. En diciembre aspira con esta inversiòn aumentar un 30% y entre Enero y Febrero las festividades D. càrnaval le ayudaràn a aumentar aun mas sus ventas, asì es que tiene firme su sueño D. fortalecer su negocio para que este oficio se perpetué entre sus descendientes.
texts.en:
Miriam Carmona says that in her youth she attended a  parochial school and there, the nuns instilled in her a love of sewing.  Her mother insisted that she continue her studies and not fall in love too early, as she did, and not finish her studies.  This is how she decided to make patterns and perfect her sewing with an old, pedal sewing machine.  Then her mother gave her a more modern machine as a gift and she added new designs.  So when she married she decided to support her household with her profession.  Her discipline and friendly disposition helped her to increase her clientele.  

She now has two machines, racks, mannequins and showcases, but she needs to improve her turn around time.  For this reason, with her Kiva loan, she will buy a serger sewing machine and special fabrics and trims in large volume.  At the end of the year, she is going to dress her customers elegantly to say goodbye to 2010.  Miriam is a recognized seamstress in her area and she calls herself "The Golden Needle of Siape" making a comparison with the famous Columbian designer, Amalin D. Hazbun.  

In December she aims to increase her business 30% and, in January and February, Carnival will help her to increase her sales even more.  This way she will strengthen her business so that she can fulfill her dream of handing down her profession to her descendants.

loans.use: To purchase a serger sewing machine, special fabrics and trims in large volume

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: VICTORIA TIENE 28 AÑOS, VIVE CON SU ESPOSO, QUIEN ES PILOTO  DE CAMIONETAS TIENEN TRES HIJOS DOS DE ELLOS YA ESTUDIAN. VICTORIA COMENZO SU NEGOCIO EN EL DOS MIL OCHO CUANDO RECIBIO SU PRIMER CREDITO GRUPAL  SU SUEÑO ERA TENER UNA VENTA DE ROPA TIPICA Y POR EL PUNTO DONDE VIVE QUE ES MUY CONCURRIDO LO LOGRO AHORA TIENE SU NEGOCIO PERO VE LA POSIBILIDAD DE SEGUIR CRECIENDO, AHORA QUIERE VENDER PRODUCTOS DE USOS DMESTICOS COMO CALZADO  SANDALIAS Y TENER MAS VARIEDAD EN ROPA PARA DAMA Y TAMBIEN PARA NIÑOS  LOS FINES DE SEMANA TAMBIEN VENDE TAMALES EN LO QUE ATIENDE SU NEGOCIO LOGRA EL RETORNO DE SUS CLIENTES POR SU ATENCION Y AMABILIDAD, ESTA AGRADECIDA PORQUE AHORA AYUDA A SU ESPOSO A SOLVENTAR LOS GASTOS DE SU HOGAR, SU SUEÑO ES SEGUIR CRECIENDO COMO PERSONA Y  COMERCIANTE , TAMBIEN  SEGUIR APOYANDO A SUS HIJOS EN LA EDUCACION.
texts.en:
Victoria is 28 years old.  She lives with her husband who is a truck driver.  They have three children, two of whom are still studying.  Victoria started her business in 2008 when she received her first group loan.  Her dream was to have a business selling traditional clothing.  The place where she lives is very busy with people and so she managed it.  She now has her business but she also sees possibilities to keep growing.  She would like to sell household products, footwear and sandals and have more variety in her ladies' and children's clothing.

At weekends she also sells tamales.  She has repeat customers because she serves them well and with kindness.  She is grateful because now she can help her husband to cover their household expenses.  Her dream is to continue growing as a person and saleswoman.  She would also like to continue supporting her children in their education.

loans.use: To buy household products

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El Señor Emilio F. se inicio con nuestra Institución en el año 2009, está casado con la Señora Vicenta Montania con quien tiene 3 hijos, están domiciliados Ciudad Nueva de Cuidad del Este, posee casa propia.
La pareja se dedica  a la compra al por mayor de mercaderías de primera necesidad como ser harina, azúcar, frutas, verduras etc., y lo distribuye en toda la zona, donde posee una clientela formada, lo realiza con uno de sus hijos mayores, en dos motos de carga que obtuvieron con la ayuda de uno de los créditos que le otorgamos, siempre demostrando moralidad de pago, como lo demuestra su antecedentes.
Son personas honestas y trabajadoras y con un espíritu de emprendedurismo, en esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su distribución.
texts.en:
Sr. Emilio F. started with Fundación Paraguaya in 2009. He is married to Sra. Vicenta Montania and they have three children. They live in Ciudad Nueva in Ciudad del Este, where they own a home.

Emilio buys basic necessities in bulk such as flour, sugar, fruit, vegetables, and other products and distributes them throughout the area. He has an established customer base and conducts his work with the help of one of his grown children. They have two motorcycles that were obtained using one of the loans Emilio obtained. He has always been honest with his payments, as demonstrated through his previous loans.

Emilio is a truthful and hardworking person who possesses the spirit of entrepreneurship. He has taken this opportunity to request a loan for buying merchandise for distribution.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk for distribution

loans.name: Mrs. Thanh Puy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who are made up a village bank loan have selected Mrs. Thanh P. to be village bank president. They will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes in which it can improve their family living in Samraong village, TaK. province. 

To earn a daily income, Mrs. Thanh P. sells chickens to  clients who come to buy. She buys young chicks, raises them and then she slaughters and prepares them for sale  at her house. She is also a pig breeder. To increase her income, Mrs. Thanh P. is seeking a loan to buy more chickens to resell. She is a widow and has five children, three of whom are employed in the garment factories, and two are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to resell

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil  soltera y tiene  02 hijos.  Tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta.

Hace 04 meses trabaja con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos, su  primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá  comprando más ropas de segunda mano,  vende solo los días sábados.

Su visión en el negocio es poner una tienda de venta de ollas y utensilios en general.
	
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en: Elena is a member of "Las Kantutas" community bank in the district and province of Puno, Peru. She is 38 years old, single and has two children. She has an incomplete higher education. For the past four months she has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Her initial loan was for 500 soles, which she invested into her business. Elena makes a living selling clothing. She is requesting a new loan of 500 soles to purchase more second-hand clothing, which she sells only on Saturdays. Her vision for the future is to have a store selling pots, pans and general cooking utensils. What she likes about her community bank is the simplicity of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase second-hand clothing

loans.name: David Karanja

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last two years.  He is 25 years old, married to Grace Wairimu and they have one child. Carrots and potatoes do well in this region and this produce always has a ready market.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan to buy carrot seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, David hopes to practice mixed farming, thereby diversifying his sources of income.

loans.use: To buy carrot seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 70 years old, is from the town of Trinidad. She has seven children. 

To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Francisca also sells herbal products at her store. 

Francisca joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She is hopeful that this loan will help further improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos  en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito D. la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo D. frutas.

Se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino, los cuales cría en un lugar cercano a su casa.  Élla los engorda con alimento balanceado y cuando ya están en un estado D. desarrollo adecuado, los venD. a sus vecinos D. la zona y a los comerciantes que llegan al lugar. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.  Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando principalmente limón.  El limón lo cosecha y es vendido a sus vecinos, quienes compran por ser productos D. buena calidad.

María siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente él desea comprar más alimento balanceado para su ganado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their four children in the TambogranD. district in the Piura province in the region with the same name.  It is noted for its inhabitants that primarily grow fruit.

She raises sheep in a place close to her house.  She fattens them with balanced feed.  When they have reached an adequate level of development, she sells them to her neighbors in the area and to the merchants who come to her place.  This business activity allows her to help her family with the daily expenses.

She also devotes herself to farming.  She primarily grows lemons.  She harvests the lemons, and then sells them to her neighbors.  They buy her products because of the good quality.

María always works hard to be able to get her family ahead.  She currently wishes to buy more balanced feed for her livestock.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternative.  That will help her achieve her objective.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Yennifer

texts.es:
Yennifer, de 18 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, al lado de ellos y de su hermana menor, juntos buscan progresar cada día. 

Yennifer tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor, pues quiere aumentar la cantidad de platillos que ofrece, de esta manera espera seguir adelante. 

Desde muy pequeña esta trabajadora joven ayudaba a su madre en su restaurante, así aprendió a preparar muy bien diversos platillos. En la actualidad trabaja como socia de su madre en su restaurante, ella cocina y ofrece almuerzos durante el día, con  el apoyo de su mamá, y ya por las noches su madre ofrece caldo de gallina (sopa típica peruana) y ella la apoya; esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias. Trabajan de lunes a sábado durante parte de la mañanas y noches, así transcurren los días de esta joven, que a pesar de su corta edad ya tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de estudiar para ser abogada, pues ese es su sueño a largo plazo y sabe que lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Yennifer is 18 years old.  She lives with her parents and younger sister.  Together they all try to make progress each day. 

Yennifer plans to use this loan to purchase ingredients wholesale, because she wants to increase the number of meals she offers, and in this way get ahead.  

Since she was very young, this hardworking young woman has helped her mother in her restaurant.  She learned how to make many meals very well.  She now works as her mother's partner in the restaurant.  She cooks and offers lunches during the day, with her mother's help.  At night, her mother offers chicken soup (a typical Peruvian soup), and Yennifer helps.  She is very satisfied because she has regular earnings.  They work from Monday to Saturday for part of the morning and at night.  That is how this young woman spends her days, and despite her young age, she has many plans for the future such as studying to become a lawyer.  This is her long term goal and she knows she will achieve it with hard work and dedication. 

This is Yennifer's first loan with MFP.  She promises to make her payments on time, as she does not want to leave a bad impression on the people who have made it possible for her to continue working to get ahead.

loans.use: For ingredients to increase the number of meals she offers

loans.name: Mirar Al Futuro Dichato Group

texts.es:
Noelia forma parte del Banco comunal “Mirar al futuro Dichato” conformado por 18 emprendedoras, que se desempeñan en los rubros de artesanía, repostería y cocina, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Tomé.
Noelia, quien en la foto aparece en el recuadro superior, se dedica a la repostería, específicamente producción y venta de tortas, berlines y pan integral de molde.
Su oficio lo realiza en su casa desde hace 5 años, por lo que sus clientes frecuentes son sus vecinos, quienes realizan pedidos de sus productos a domicilio. Sin embargo también vende sus alimentos de repostería puerta a puerta, para ser reconocida en el rubro.
Noelia compra todos los ingredientes de repostería en un supermercado mayorista, ya que es más económico.
Ella trabaja sola en este negocio, pero recibe ayuda de sus hijas de 18 y 10 años de edad, quienes limpian los utensilios de cocina utilizados. 
Con este préstamo comprará insumos e ingredientes para su negocio, específicamente un cilindro de gas licuado, harina, linaza, azúcar, crema pastelera, manteca, entre otros.

El sueño de Noelia es tener un local en su misma casa, donde pueda exhibir  lo que prepara, además de ser reconocida por su repostería. De esta manera obtener ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son debido a que le gusta la repostería, además recibe ingresos que posibilitan costear los gastos de su hogar y prontos estudios universitarios de su hija mayor.
Ella está muy agradecida de Fondo Esperanza le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones, debido a la comunicación, amistad, lealtad y confianza generada en el grupo con las otras emprendedoras, es por esto que además es presidenta del Banco comunal. En cuanto al financiamiento que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ha sido un gran aporte para su negocio, ya que con este ha podido invertir más y aumentar sus ingresos.
Tomé es una comuna del sur de Chile, ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Su economía local se sustentaba de manera importante en la actividad textil que se origina a fines del siglo XIX, con fábricas que producen paños de lana de oveja, Textiles Bellavista Oveja Tomé, cerrada en 2007, trayendo consigo altas tasas de desempleo que han sido cubiertas por nuevas actividades económica.
texts.en:
Noelia is a member of the Communal Bank “Mirar al Futuro Dichato” (Look to the Future – Dichato), which consists of 18 entrepreneurs who work in activities such as making crafts, baking, and cooking. They live in the city of Tomé.

Noelia, who appears in the top corner photo, works as a baker. Specifically she makes cakes, cream puffs, and whole grain bread. She started this business in her home five years ago. Her regular customers are her neighbors who come to her house to place orders. However, she also sells baked goods door-to-door so that she can generate publicity for her business. Noelia buys all of her baking ingredients from the wholesale supermarket since the prices are cheaper. She works alone in her business, but she also gets help from her daughters (ages 18 and 10) who clean the used cooking utensils. With this loan, Noelia will buy supplies and ingredients for her business, specifically a cylinder of natural gas, flour, flaxseed, sugar, pastry cream, butter, and other products.

Noelia dreams of having a shop in her home where she can display the goods that she prepares so that she can be recognized for her baking. In this manner, she hopes to generate income to help her obtain a better quality of life. Her motivation to continue her business stems from her love of desserts. She also likes having income to cover the household expenses and the university studies of her oldest daughter. Noelia is extremely grateful to Fondo Esperanza. She enjoys attending the meetings because of the communication, friendship, loyalty, and trust that she has developed with the other entrepreneurs in her group. This explains why the other members selected her to be the president of the Communal Bank. The funding she has received from Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to her business since she is able to invest more and increase her earnings.

Tomé is a community in southern Chile, located near the city of Concepción in Bíobío region. The local economy is sustained primarily by the textile industry, which has its origins in the late nineteenth century. These factories produced wool cloth. The Bellavista Oveja Factory in Tomé shut down in 2007, creating high unemployment which has since been eased by new business activities.

loans.use: To purchase baking supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora. María V. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive por la vía a Misicata en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva a propios y extraños, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. María cuenta con 28 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 9, 7, 5 años de edad y un bebe de 9 meses, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en su propio taller de costura, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña María se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de ropa, en sus ventas trabaja una vez a la semana y los demás de días le ayuda a su esposo en la confección de chompas de mujer, realizan esta labor hace 2 años.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que oftiene en el banco comunal, fue invitada por una amiga que forma parte del mismo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa interior para la venta. Su meta es vender ropa al por mayor.
texts.en:
Señora María V. is a member of the communal bank El Arenal.  She lives along the road to Misicata in the city of Cuenca.  This city is known for its beautiful architecture and was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  The diverse cuisine captivates locals and visitors alike and the people here preserve their culture and traditions.  

Señora María is 28 years old, married and has 4 children ages 9,7,5 and a baby that is 9 months old.  Her oldest children attend a small school in the city.  Her husband works in his own tailor shop.  They don't own their own house so they rent.  

Doña María sells all types of clothing.  She works one day a week and the other days she helps her husband make women's sweaters, which has been doing for 2  years.  
 
She was invited by a friend to join the communal bank and this is her second loan with them.  She will use the loan to buy undergarments to sell.  Her goal is to sell clothing wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Orgil

texts.en:
Orgil, 33, is married and lives with her husband and her parents in Dornod province, Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned since 2002. Her husband works as an assistant for a supermarket and earns 108,000 MNT monthly. 

Orgil began her own business by selling foodstuffs in 1999. She rents a stall at a local food market and her current working capital exceeds 1,600,000 MNT. She wants to expand her business and increase her revenue. She is planning to operate an additional stall that sells consumer goods. She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase foodstuffs and consumer goods from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and consumer goods.

loans.name: Sop Sa Aladji Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SA ALADJI est créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois DAGATH qui l'abrite (26 août 2009) . Le groupe est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du village. Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage et d'affinité. 

Madame MAREME N. D. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 04 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés soit par des parents ou des proches.

Elle est vendeuse de petit déjeuné. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra renforcer son activité de vente de petit déjeuné en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement en lait, café, sucre, pain, etc. 

Son objectif est de faire croitre ses bénéfices afin de mieux participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The lending group SOP SA ALADJI was created at the same time as the Village Bank DAGATH was established (26 August 2009). The group comprises 15 women who are from the same village, united through family and neighborhood ties.

Mrs Mareme N. D. (standing up on the far right of the photo) is the leader of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the most of 6 children. She is also taking care of four other children, responsibility for them was given to her by their parents or close family members.

She has been selling breakfast foods for more than five years. 

She is hoping to use this loan to improve her business of selling breakfast by purchasing larger quantities of milk, coffee, sugar, bread, etc. Her goal is to increase her profits in order to better take care of her family.

loans.use: Purchase provisions for the sale of breakfast

loans.name: Felix  Pedro

texts.es:
Don Félix , tiene 60 años de edad , es originario de la comunidad La Rica, localizada en el departamento de Jinotega , es padre de 7 hijos , el se dedica a la siembra de café ,lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad. El inicio a la edad de 18 años  sembró sus propios cultivos, en un terreno que su papa le dejo , con el tiempo el vendió esas tierras para comprar mas terrenos para cultivar ,sembró café y con las ganancias obtenidas compro mas terreno , sembró granos básicos y es así que a lo largo de estos años ha venido sobreviviendo el y su familia a pesar de que el solo logro estudiar hasta primer grado de primaria por sus condiciones de pobreza en la que sus padres vivian , no pudo seguir estudiando mas pero si aprendió bien el oficio de agricultor.
Solicito el préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café, para pago de mano obra directa, compra de insumos. Con esta inversión espera sacar una cosecha de calidad, que le permita vender toda su producción futura a buen precio, pues le gustaría venderlo el directamente sin usar intermediario, también ayudar a sus hijos y comprar unos muebles para su casa. En lo futuro le gustaría aumentar su plantación de café. Su próxima meta es sembrar el maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
Felix, age 60, is from the community of La Rica, located in the Jinotega department. He has seven children and makes his living growing coffee. Felix has been in this business for over 40 years; he started when, at the age of 18, he first sowed his own crops on a plot that his father had left him. 

With time, Felix sold that land in order to purchase additional plots for cultivation. He sowed coffee and with the profits from the harvest acquired additional land where he sowed staple grains. This is how, through the years, Felix and has family survived even though he only finished first year of primary school -- he was not able to study because of the poverty in which his parents lived, but he did learn well the craft of being a good farmer.

Felix is seeking a loan in order to do the necessary maintenance work on his coffee farm, to pay labor costs, and to purchase supplies. With the help of this investment, he expects to able to collect a high-quality harvest which will allow him to sell the entire crop at good prices; he would also like to sell the crop to a direct buyer so that he does not have to use an intermediary. In addition, he wants to help his children to buy a couple of pieces of furniture. In the future, Felix wants to increase the size of his coffee fields. His next goal is to sow corn and beans.

loans.use: to maintain a coffee farm, to pay labor costs, to purchase supplies

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four adult children. To make a living, Genara owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community.
