Genara has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Genara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genara is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods,snack foods, and beverages. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods, and beverages

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene  29 años de edad, es casada. Vive en casa propia,  La cual está ubicada en el anexo La Piedra un Caserío del distrito de Mochumi.  Ella  vive en la parte Rural de este distrito.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de priM. necesidad y abarrotes, ella se dedica a este negocio hace un año. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida. Adicionalmente se dedica a la comercialización de animales. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Maribel está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio  de esta manera Maribel satisfacerá su demanda ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Maribel,  con mucho esmero y trabajo desea poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ella cuneta con buenas referencias, pues las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Maribel tiene  29 años de edad, es casada. Vive en casa propia,  La cual está ubicada en el anexo La Piedra un Caserío del distrito de Mochumi.  Ella  vive en la parte Rural de este distrito.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de priM. necesidad y abarrotes, ella se dedica a este negocio hace un año. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida. Adicionalmente se dedica a la comercialización de animales. Con estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Maribel está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio  de esta manera Maribel satisfacerá su demanda ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Maribel,  con mucho esmero y trabajo desea poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ella cuneta con buenas referencias, pues las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderia para su negocio.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia works hard to support her family. Crescencia is married and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Crescencia requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like biscuits and groceries, in her sari-sari store.

Crescencia has been in this business for 31 years.

In the future, Crescencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits and groceries, in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Doryfe

texts.en:
Doryfe is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Doryfe is raising pigs to sell. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Doryfe is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Doryfe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Don Miguel, de 65 años, habita en Chacaraseca una comunidad ubicada en León, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos de 22,19 y 28 años respectivamente. El se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de ganado.
En 1984 el comenzó  trabajar por  cuenta propia a través de un prestamos las tierras en las que comenzó a trabajar le fueron donadas por el gobierno, fueron comienzo muy duros para el no contaba con las herramientas necesario comenzó sembrando 10 manzanas de algodón, el tenia solo una vaquita. Actualmente tiene 10 vacas, tiene tierras que compro con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificios, siembra hortalizas, como la yuca, sin dejar atrás el negocio de crianza de ganado.  
Solicito el préstamo para sembrar 4 manzanas de yuca , con la inversión espera sacar rentabilidad y calidad en su cosecha ,pues desea dejarles una buena herencia a sus hijos y sacar adelante su hija que esta estudiando enfermería que desea apoyarla hasta donde mas le pueda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 65 years old and lives in Chacaraseca, a community which is located in León.  He is married and has three children aged 22, 19 and 28.  He farms and raises livestock.

In 1984, Miguel started working for himself.  Through a loan, he started to work the land that was given to him by the government.  At first it was very hard because he didn't have the tools he needed.  He started growing 10 'manzanas' (one manzana = 1.68 acres) of cotton.  He only had one calf.  He currently has ten cows and land which he bought through a lot of hard work and sacrifice.  He sows vegetables such as cassava, without neglecting his livestock business.

Miguel requested this loan so that he could sow 4 'manzanas' (approx 6.7 acres) with cassava.  With this investment, he hopes to make a profit and obtain a good quality harvest.  He would like to be able to leave his children a good inheritance.  He would also like to get his daughter ahead in life.  She is studying to become a nurse and he would like support her as far as he can.

loans.use: to sow 4 'manzanas' (approx 6.7 acres) with cassava

loans.name: Anastasie Berthe

texts.fr: Mariée, Anastasie est mère de 4 enfants, tous scolarisés. Ils vivent dans leur propre maison. Son époux, électricien bâtiment exerçant à son propre compte, prend en charge les dépenses du foyer mais Anastasie y participe aussi de façon non négligeable. La relation commercialise de la farine de blé (en sacs), du sucre en poudre et de l'huile alimentaire en bidons et ce; depuis 11 ans à son domicile sis à Calavi-Djadjo. Elle a associé à son activité principale la distribution des tissus de marques HITAGET, PHOENIX, BINTA et autres. Sa clientèle est constituée de la population de sa zone et de ses environs. Anastasie s'approvisionne à Tokpa, le marché international du Bénin et à Missèbo, un marché de la capitale économique du Bénin. Après quelques ventes, Anastasie constate qu'elle n'est plus en mesure de satisfaire d'autres clients, raison pour laquelle elle s'est rapprochée de FINADEV pour le renouvellement afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement. Les bénéfices qu’engendrera le présent micro crédit lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et familiaux. Elle est à son 1er crédit à FINADEV.
texts.en:
A married woman, Anastasie is the mother of four children who are all in school. They live in their own house. Her husband is a freelance building electrician and is responsible for household expenses, but Anastasie also helps out to a significant degree. 

Our client sells wheat flour (in sacks), powdered sugar, and vegetable oil in containers. She has been doing so for eleven years out of her home located in Calavi-Djadjo. Along with her main business, she has included the distribution of cloth having the brand names of HITAGET, PHOENIX, BINTA, and other. Her customer base is composed of the people in her district and nearby. She gets her supplies from Tokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Missèbo, a market in the economic capital of Benin. 

After a few sales, Anastasie noticed she is no longer satisfying other customers. This is why she inquired with FINADEV to reinvigorate her business in order to increase her ability to resupply her inventory. 

The profits that this micro-loan will produce will enable her to support herself and her family. She is on her first FINADEV loan.

loans.use: to buy five 25-liter containers of oil, five sacks of wheat flour, and two sacks of sugar

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan to purchase more items to sell like soy sauce, vinegar, juices, snack foods and bread.

She has been running her store for two years and earns additional income from raising livestock.

She wants to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase juices, snack foods, bread and spices

loans.name: Tashinga 1 Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42-year-old Clara from Masvingo. She is married with six children, all attending school. She also cares for three dependents. Clara runs a retail cross-border business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for eight years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of adequate working capital to sustain the business. Clara has requested a loan of $300 to buy more clothes to meet market demand. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy her family home. In the future, Clara plans to own a shop to operate from and a car for easy transport of goods.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing buisness

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
This borrower is 33 years old, married and has five children.

He has owned a grocery store since 1995, selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for $3,000 loan in order to renovate and fix his market’s ceiling, walls and floors, and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his market’s ceiling, walls and floors, and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 23 years old, married, has one dependent child, and lives in the town of Esquilan Chico in a small house. Her main business activity is producing raw milk. Currently she has three head of dairy cattle. She sells the milk to a factory that makes dairy products. 

The loan is to buy a cooling tank. This purchase is being made for a group of people who do not have their own cooling talk to collect all their milk. There is another tank but it is located very far away. The purchase of this new tank will benefit everyone. 

Among her dreams is, in the near future, to have a small farm with many dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank for raw milk with other farmers.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 54 years old and married with three school aged children. He is a farmer. He plants corn in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper and his partner in caring for their family. Emmanuel’s wife plants and harvests various vegetables that serve them as an alternative source of income for the family.

To further cover their family's needs, especially his children's needs in school, Emmanuel decided to start up another source of income that he believes will be a great help for his family to improve their living situation. Now, Emmanuel runs a hog raising business. Due to a financial shortage, he cannot buy the full amount of feed needed for the maintenance of his hogs. This will affect their growing and weight.

Emmanuel is requesting a loan of P22,000 to buy stocks of feed for the maintenance of his hogs. The loan will be a big help for him because he is able to buy sacks of feed in the market. It will minimize his fare expense of going to the market.

loans.use: to buy stocks of feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Mountaha

texts.en: Mountaha is a 47-year-old married woman. She works in selling gifts and gadgets in her small shop located in Tripoli. Mountaha opened this business to help her husband in raising their two children and to provide them with the necessary education to make their own future. Mountaha is a hardworking woman with an excellent reputation. She works hard to keep her shop updated with all levels of toys and gifts that suit all customers’ needs. To stay like this, Mountaha is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital with new gift collections, especially for the coming Christmas season. She will also increase the school supplements capital through the requested materials. Mountaha is planning to open a bigger shop in the future with special decorations attractive to everyone passing by.

loans.use: to buy new gift collections for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es: La Sra. Salome nacida en Chuquisaca de 52 años de edad, tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, en Villa San Carlos a 25 km de Limoncito donde tienen su parcela en la cual viven y trabajan, se dedican a la siembra de  maíz, yuca, y sandia, es el primer crédito que esta sacando con la institución  por lo cual se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que la institución le brindo ya que con el crédito comprara semillas para la siembra de maíz y también lo utilizara en lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra y despues sus productos lo comercializa en el mercado de zona directamente del productor al consumidor y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Salome, 52, was born in Chuquisaca.  She has three adult children.  She and her husband are farmers in Villa San Carlos 25 kilometers from Limoncito where they have their parcel where they live and work.  They grow corn, cassava and watermelon.  

This is the first loan she’s taken out with the institution and she’s grateful for the support the institution is giving her because she’ll use the loan to buy seeds to plant corn and also for everything implied in getting the soil ready for planting.  She will then sell her products in the local market directly from producer to consumer thus improving her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds to plant and to clear the fields.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop where she sells fish like milk fish, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Amelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 41-year-old married man, father of two beautiful children. Yasser is a hardworking man who expands his business through introducing his customers to new products. He started as a grocery store in 1996, then he started adding new products to his shop such as gifts and selling espresso coffee. Doing this helped a lot in improving his social and financial situation. Yasser's shop is next to a hospital which is an important spot for any business to improve, and because of this important zone he is working in, he started making and selling sandwiches, which has attracted most of the hospital's visitors and staff.

Yasser is requesting  a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with new products with special offers.
This is his first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower and he hopes to be as good a borrower as he is a good business man.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with new products with special offers

loans.name: Dashkin

texts.en:
Dashkin lives in the village of Tsurtavi with his wife, Elza. He is 34 years old. The family has rented 1 hectare of land for potato growing. Harvested potatoes are sold, but the main source of the income for the family is selling greengrocery products. Dashkin owns a car, which is used for his business. He purchases fruit and vegetables in the village at wholesale prices and takes the produce to nearby towns for sale. Total average income of the family is 700 Laris per month. 

Dashkin requested credit for increasing his stock in trade. He will use 3000 Laris for purchasing fruit and vegetables in the village and sell the produce in nearby towns along with his own potatoes. He will use received income for covering his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Horonkantigui Group

texts.fr:
Les huit membres du groupe HORONKANTIGUI sont  toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à KAFELA  un des villages environnants  de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur seizième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passés ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbon de bois à travers Madame NAWA se tenant au milieu en position debout. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 100  sacs de charbon de bois.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins.
Les sacs de charbon sont revendus aux  marchés de SIKASSO et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000FCFA utilisée  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille 
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The eight members of the Horonkantigui group are all married and an average of 35 years old with 4 children.  They live mostly in plural families in Kafela, one of the neighboring villages to Sikasso.
They are on their sixteenth collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in the goal of satisfying the needs of their customers.  Their past loans have been fully paid back.
This group of women works selling wood coal, with Nawa (standing at the center of the photo) as the group’s focal point.
She plans to use the loan to purchase 100 bags of wood coal.
She gets her supplies from neighboring villages.
The bags of coal are resold for cash at the Sikasso markets and from her home to a customer base consisting of both men and women.
She plans on making an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, to be used for the family’s daily expenses.
Her goal is to increase her sales to ultimately better satisfy her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase wood coal

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
El Sr. Federico tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su abuelo debido a que sus padres se separaron y su madre esta en la Argentina.
Federico es un joven muy sacrificado pues tiene que trabajar para ayudar a su abuelo con los gastos del hogar y además tiene que pagar sus estudios. Actualmente trabaja en una empresa de telefonía celular como vendedor, y esta cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Administración en donde asiste a clases de lunes a viernes a la noche después de su trabajo.
Nos comenta que su sueño es poder convertirse en una persona importante, que sea útil no solo a si mismo, sino también a su familia y a la sociedad.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de libros y pagar derechos de examen, y de esa forma poder aliviaran la carga de sus estudios. Agradece por esta gran oportunidad que se le da.
texts.en:
Mr. Federico is 22, single and lives with his grandfather because his parents are divorced and his mother is in Argentina.  Federico is a self-sacrificed young man who must work to help his grandfather with household expenses.  He also must pay for his education.  

Currently he is working for a cell phone company as a salesman and he is in his third year of business administration studies.  He attends class after work Monday through Friday.

He tells us his dream is to become someone important, not only for himself but also for his family and society.  He is requesting the loan to buy books and pay exam fees, which will ease the burden of studying.  He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy books and pay exam fees.

loans.name: Unurbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Unurbayar, 33, is requesting a loan to cover the cost of new furniture for his home. He lives with his wife and his three children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as an auto-engineer in a private company and has been doing his job for five years. His salary usually is not enough to provide his family's necessities.
 
Unurbayar decided to renovate his home furniture, which was purchased in early 1980, because all of it has been damaged and gotten old. Therefore, he wants to renovate some of it. He said it will be important to improve his living conditions step by step.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new furniture

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 65 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group of four farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. 

Gladys has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Gladys also decided to purchase two solar lights as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Gladys' Group will be able to receive a total of seven solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 1.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind heart of lending her funds several times in the past which really helped sustain and grow her store. She is now more inspired her to be more diligent in growing her business and is forever grateful for your help. 

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 51000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like canned goods coffee and rice noodles, soda and toiletries. As Christmas is fast approaching she plans to add toys and blouses to sell a her store. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income which sustained her family's basic needs and in sending her children to school. 

She prays for God to prosper her business. And prays that KIVA and CCT will continue to be a blessing to people like her. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell and add toys and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Madam Emily L. prepares nutritious khebabs made from soy beans for sale. The nutritional value of soy bean creates a high demand for her khebab by both young and old. She wishes to produce more on a larger scale for all to have their fair share. Lack of capital is her limitation. She is hopeful that Kiva will grant  her a loan of $700.00 to help her operate as she wishes. She is very good in loan management and simple record keeping.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en:
Mirza is a 42-year-old man who lives in Salyan region, and is married with two children.
Eight years ago he began his business with a loan of $400 which he used to buy parfumery. Now he is requesting a loan of $900 to buy bigiotterias, gold rings, gold watches, gold bracelets. These items will increase his stock and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy bigiotterias, gold rings, gold watches, gold bracelets

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge has been farming since he was a young boy, but now he specializes in the cultivation of rice. He has 5 years of experience, and he has been able to support himself by learning how to take care and manage his crops in the short growing season.

Jorge would like to use this loan to purchase more farming implements such as herbicides, fertilizers and other necessities in order to appropriately manage his crops and in the end make a profit.

Jorge is 21 years old and he is a hard worker. He is single with no children. He lives in a cozy home made out of wood and cement. Jorge aspires to have more farming equipment and more farming implements so that he can work his land much more productively since due to lack of funds has not been able to do so!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura, que desde muy joven se dedico a esta actividad, especialmente al cultivo de arroz, teniendo ya 5 anos de experiencia. Donde ha logrado mantenerse, ganando cada vez más experiencia y manejo en este cultivo de ciclo corto.

Jorge quiere el préstamo para lo que es compra de insumos agrícolas como compra de semilla, fertilizantes, abonos y otras actividades en lo que relaciona con la producción de arroz y de esa manera llegar a fortalecer sus ingresos.

Jorge en la actualidad tiene 21 anos de edad, hombre trabajador, en la que no tiene compromiso y en consecuencia no a podido todavía tener hijos. Su hogar es de características mixto, acogedora. La aspiración de Jorge es llegar a tener mas maquinaria e implementos de trabajo para que de esa manera, con su esfuerzo tener sus tierras mucha más tecnificadas, ya que por falta de apoyo no a podido lograrlo .

loans.use: Rice cultivation & agricultural supplies

loans.name: Noradin

texts.en:
Noradin G. is a divorced mother of two and a business owner in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti. Operating her business out of her home, Noradin sells a variety of different types of clothes, such as shirts, pants, and undergarments. The 29-year-old Noradin will use this first loan to expand her inventory of clothing to better meet the needs of her community.

Note: Noradin is one of five microentrepreneurs in his Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for his/her respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying his/her share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: Expand her inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Business Description

Miss Isabel has owned a pharmacy for two years. She started this business thanks to a credit she got from a financial institution. Nowadays, her sales have grown considerably since she is located at a very commercial sector. Four months ago, the business had grown to the point that it was necessary to open a second pharmacy. Isabel's mother helps her at the pharmacy. Her biggest clients are the neighborhood's doctor's offices

Loan Use

Isabel wants to use this credit to purchase more merchandise and a display cabinet. She will use the display cabinet to better display her products and increase sales because she has new plans for her future.

Personal Information

Isabel is 20 years old and she is single. Her home is built out of cement and her goal is to extend her business. Currently, she is helping one of her brothers who has autism. Isabel always does her best to satisfy her clients. She wants to have a larger income so that she can share it with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señorita Isabel tiene una farmacia desde hace 2 años, ella empezó su negocio gracias a un crédito de una institución financiera del sector, hoy en día sus ventas han crecido notablemente ya que esta ubicada en un sector muy comercial a tal punto que ha abierto otro local hace cuatro meses atrás, en el negocio le ayuda su mama y sus mayores clientes son los consultorios médicos de estos sectores.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere usar su crédito para comprar mas mercadería y también una vitrina para de esta manera poder exhibir sus productos mejor y así tener mas ventas ya que tiene nuevos planes para su futuro.

Información Personal

Tiene 20 años y es soltera, su vivienda es de cemento y su meta es ampliar su negocio ya que en la actualidad ella ayuda a uno de sus hermanos que tiene un problema de autismo y siempre se esmera para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y poder tener mas ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise and invest on a  display cabinet

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Amna B. is 42, married and have two daughters. She lives in Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. Her elder daughter studies in grade six and the younger one studies in grade five.  Her husband is a tailor and he creates men's clothes. He plans to improve his business and requests a loan of US$350. He will buy raw materials for his business in a suitable quantity.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for creating men wear

loans.name: Hoe

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Hoe is a widow with four children--two sons and two daughters. Two of her children have been married and live in a different house and other two children live under her custody and do fishing in the Mekong River. Her family lives along National Road number Six about thirty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Currently, she is in the business of selling secondhand cloth in the market at her village. She started her selling in 1992. Hoe and her children have never attended school. 

She is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $350.  She will use this loan to purchase a boat and a boat motor for her children to do fishing.

loans.use: Buying a boat and a boat motor for fishing

loans.name: Nabweru South B-2079(Ii) Group

texts.en: This group has been together for three months. Rose is a 40-year-old widow with six children and four dependents. She sells snacks in a school canteen. With the extra business profits, Rose wants to pay school fees for the children, buy food, clothes and cater for their health needs. Joyce and Annet both sell used clothes and want to use the loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Christine and Gertrude sell soft drinks. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add inventory, thus expand the business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Mrs. Delfina T. V. is a member of the “Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay” microfinance institution. She has a small grocery store located at the Yungay fairgrounds.

With the loan of S/500.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in four months, she will purchase one sack of rice and 2 sacks of sugar.

Delfina is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her husband, who is a gardener, and her daughter. Both Delfina and her husband help out with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Delfina pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, el negocio está ubicado en el campo ferial del distrito y provincia de Yungay.

Con el préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará un saco de arroz y 2 sacos de azúcar.

Delfina tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de una hija y su esposo es jardinero. Ambos se apoyan con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de arroz y azúcar

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is married with three children, ages 13, 3, and 1. Rahma is a clothing vendor and started her business in 2007. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. and earns a monthly profit of about $80.

Rahma is applying for a loan of $175 to buy more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
From a very young age Deysi has had the innate ability to sell any manner of products, but with a special preference for the sale of articles of clothing. This inspiration has influenced her actual career path. She has two children and thanks to her ability to sell all types of clothing, she has obtained excellent financial returns for the benefit of her family. She would like to establish a sales room in an appropriate, new location so that the general population can visit her and purchase her products at this location.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson Kiva volunteer.

Desde muy joven Deysi, ha tenido una habilidad innata para vender todo tipo de artículos sin embargo una predilección especial por las pendas de vestir, a su inspiración y decisión atiende su desarrollo laboral actual. Tiene dos hijos y gracias a su habilidad para ofertar toda clase de prendas obtiene excelentes sumas de dinero para beneficio de su familia; desea implementar su espacio de ventas y convertirlo en un punto apropiado y novedoso para que la población en general la visite y adquiera sus prendas desde este espacio.

loans.use: Establishment and remodeling of work area

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna is a 27 year old married woman with an 8 year old son who is in elementary school. She is supported by her husband who is a driver. She is a selfless young woman who takes care of her elderly parents. Sadly, years back her father had a horrible accident working for the MTI where he lost both legs and is confined to a wheelchair.

In spite of her difficult situation, she is studying computing in order to improve her state in life. She is a very responsible and balanced person, working in a rural area of her country.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna es una joven de 27 años, con 1 hijo de 8 años estudiando la primaria, casada, y recibe el apoyo de su esposo que es conductor, es una joven sacrificada, ya que desde hace un tiempo se ha responsabilizado de sus padres que son ancianos, pero lo mas triste es que su papá hace varios años era trabajador de MTI y sufrio un brutal accidente donde perdio ambas piernas y se mantiene en una silla de ruedas, a pesar de su dura situacion estudio computacion, es una persona con deseos de superacion, responsable, centrada, trabaja en la zona rural con multigrados.

loans.use: Improve the infrastructure of her home

loans.name: Chamreun

texts.en: Mrs. Chamreun T. is a villager in Trapaing Skun village in Kampong Speu province. She is currently has a plantation which she cultivates twice a year. Mrs. Chamreun T.’s living conditions are poor; therefore, she wants to start a grocery store. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery products in order to start a new business. Her husband, Mr. Nget Sem, is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Chamreun T. has three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other one is working as a construction worker. Her husband is also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy grocery products in order to start her new business

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng N., 37, has been working her farm land for over twenty years and she typically makes $1 each day. Her husband, Chea Mach, operates a motortaxi service and his income isn’t steady, but he typically makes $4 each day. They live in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and have four children. Three of them still live at home and two of them are employed and helping to support the family.

Heng N. has asked for a loan of $500 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband’s motorbike that will turn his motorbike into a tuk-tuk. Tuk tuks can hold more passengers and are very popular among the tourists in the area. The family hopes that the tuk-tuk can generate more income and they can use the money to improve their standard of living.

Heng N. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Chea Mach, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase trailer to turn motorbike into a tuk-tuk

loans.name: Julia Karina

texts.es:
Julia is 36, has four children that go to school and are her inspiration to keep going, she lives with her husband Amancio, who is a cargo handler and supports her a lot. She sells food (chicken soup) only during the morning, has done it for 9 months. Julia sells outside of her house, in a small “ramada” (open space with palm roof) built by her children.

What she likes the most about her job is that so many people enjoy her good cooking and the most difficult thing for her is not having a suitable location to provide better services to her clients. Julia works to help her husband with the family expenses and, of course, with the education of their children. She wants to build a terrace in which to sell her chicken soup more comfortably, and in the future have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Julia, de 36 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos que estudian y son su mayor inspiración para seguir adelante, vive junto a su esposo Amancio, que es estibador y la apoya mucho. Se dedica al venta de comida (caldo de gallina) sólo por las mañanas, desde hace 9 meses. Julia vende en las afueras de su vivienda, en una pequeña “ramada” (espacio abierto con techo de paja) construida por uno de sus hijos.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degustan de su buena sazón y lo más difícil para ella es no contar con un local apropiado para dar una buena acogida a sus clientes. Julia trabaja para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, y desde luego, para la educación de sus hijos. Ella quiere mandar a construir un kiosco adecuado para vender cómodamente su caldo de gallina, posteriormente tener su pequeño restaurante.

loans.use: Build a terrace to sell chicken soup.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El  Sr. Juan tiene 44 años de edad, es casado, y habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación. Su esposa trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos, quien se levanta en horas de la mañana para poder hacer sus labores en su hogar,  atender a su esposo e hijos ya que estudian dos por la mañana en la primaria y los otros dos cursan la secundaria por la tarde, y después ella sale para su trabajo. El negocio de don Juan, es la reparación de radios, TV, equipos, entre otros, también brinda servicio de acarreo, y así se ayuda con otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar, lleva dieciocho años en el negocio, desea tener mas publicidad para captar mas clientes, el trabajaba en soldadura metalúrgica y estudio un curso de electrónica así fue que tuvo la idea de tener su propio negocio el cual ha sido una fuente de ingreso para subsistir con su familia. La solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura va a terminar de construir su porche, hará el enverjado, para tener un poco mas de seguridad ante la delincuencia.
texts.en:
Juan, 44, is married and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. His wife works as a maid; she gets up very early to do her own housework, take care of her husband's and their four children's needs, and then she goes off to work. Two of the children go to elementary school in the morning, and the other two attend middle school in the afternoon. Juan's business is a TV, radio, stereo repair shop. He also has a delivery service on the side to increase his family income. Juan used to work in welding, and after taking an electronics course, he got the idea of starting the repair business eighteen years ago, and it has become the main source of income for his family. He would like to reach more customers for his business, but the purpose for this loan is to finish building a gated porch to stay a little safer from theft and vandalism.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish home's gated porch

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is 36-year-old mother with one child who is currently in school.  Because beef is a popular source of protein in almost all Ghanaian homes, Rose obtains meat from Tema Harbour in the Greater Accra region of Ghana and sells it to customers in her area.  Rose wants to increase her profit by buying beef in bulk and selling it to customers in larger quantities.  There, she has joined the Hyebenehi Trust Group, which arranges for loans by having members guarantee loans for one another.  Rose is now requesting a loan of $450, which will allow her to purchase larger quantities of beef and also help pay for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of beef.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy C. is a villager in Trapaing Soam village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Mrs. Sophy C. is requesting a loan to buy pig foods and seven piglets so she can expand her business and increase her income. Her husband, Mr. Om Vasna, is a farmer. She is 36 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, four other children are attending the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase pig foods and seven piglets to expand her business

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla P., 41, and her husband, Mr. Ly Nao, 37, who live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family house, one son sells cassette tapes, another son is a worker and the other two children attend the local school.

Mrs. Phalla and her husband have been selling Phak Lov (a famous Cambodian meal cooked with pork) since 2006. They buy the pork and other ingredients from the Koky market to cook at their home, and then sell in the village. Mrs. Phalla is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike and cart for carrying their food to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and cart for carrying food to sell.

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Mrs. Kung M., is a villager in Angk Village in Kandal Province, and is requesting a loan to buy silk scarves for her business as it is doing well. Her husband, Mr. Samrith Ly, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Kung M. is 40 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a farmer, while the remaining two attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy silk scarves to resell.

loans.name: Siguidia ( Bonne Cohabitation) Group

texts.fr:
le groupe Siguidia de l’association  Sabali de Kimparana est composé de  6 femmes, l’âge moyen des membres   est de 40 ans. Elles sont toutes mariées et ont au moins chacune 8 enfants. Dans ce groupe, l’activité dominante est la vente  de légumes,  de fruits et d’arachide.
Ce groupe est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) avec l’institution. Les  deux premiers ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles achèteront avec ce nouveau prêt, des fruits et légumes puis de l’arachide. Le groupe se procure  de ces marchandises au marché de  Sikasso (la troisième région administrative du mali) et comme lieu de vente les marchés de Koury, de San et de Kimparana.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice de 70 000f avec ce prêt,  en plus du  remboursement, elles utiliseront le reste de l’argent pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Siguidia of the association Sabali de Kimparana is composed of six women averaging 40 years of age. They are all married and have at least eight children each. In this group the dominant work involves selling vegetables, fruit, and peanuts.

The group members are on their third solidarity loan (group loan) with the institution. The first two loans were correctly repaid. They will use this new loan to buy fruit and vegetables and then peanuts. The group gets its merchandise at the Sikasso marketplace (third administrative region of Mali). And sales are made at the marketplaces of Koury, San, and Kimparana.

They hope to realize a profit of 70,000 francs with this loan. In addition to repaying the loan, they will use the rest of the money for addressing typical family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, vegetables, and peanuts

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeun S., 45, and her husband, Mr. Sothorn Soem, 50, who live in a small village across Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1986 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of their children is a silk weaver and the other children attend school.

Sokhoeun has been a silk weaver for four years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a policeman and works in Phnom Penh. Sokhoeun is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to ride to work, using part of the amount for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband and supplies for weaving

loans.name: Maimounata

texts.fr:
Madame Maimounata D. est une femme mariée de 29 ans et mère de 2 enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille) qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants  à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités commerciales sans succès, elle s’initia à la teinture à Sikasso auprès d’une teinturière de la place il y a maintenant 2 ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (Mariage, baptème, fêtes, etc.) 
Ses ressources propres ne pouvant pas lui permettre de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle sollicita depuis maintenant 7 ans la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son  6ème prêt individuel  après 4 prêts solidaires,  tous correctement remboursés.
Elle compte acheter, 7 pièces de bazins blancs, 5 sachets de soude caustique et 8 boites de teintures de couleurs différentes. Elle s’approvisionne sur place auprès des commercants grossistes en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teinture). Les bazins reçoivent des colories avant d’être revendus au comptant et à crédit. Elle a pour clients potentiels, les revendeuses des bazins teintés, les couturiers et les femmes de son quartier..
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses presonnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, rembourser les intèrêts du prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Ms. Maimounata D. is a married woman, 29 years old, and the mother of two children (a boy and a girl). She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After having done several kinds of work unsuccessfully, she got introduced two years ago to the dyeing of cloth in Sikasso from a local woman in that trade. She enjoys a solid reputation in this work and receives many orders, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, holidays, etc.).

Her working capital being unable to help her meet the needs of her customers, she requested the collaboration of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. She is now on her sixth individual loan after four solidarity loans, all correctly repaid. She plans to buy seven lengths of white damask cloth, five bags of caustic soda, and eight boxes of dyes of different colors. Supplies of the raw materials are gotten locally from wholesale merchants. The damask receive their coloring before being sold, cash or credit accepted. Her potential clients would be retailers of dyed damask, clothiers, and women in her area.

She has the intention of realizing an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover personal expenses, to go towards family expenses by helping her husband, to repay the loan interest, and to bolster her dye business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask, caustic soda, and dyes

loans.name: Juana Guadalupe

texts.es: la Sra. Maritza N. P. tiene 28 años de edad, ella vive en union libre con su compañero de hogar el Sr. Thomas Guevara quien labora en la alcaldia de San Lorenzo, ellos tienen un hijo de 10 años de edad quien esta en la escuela. ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 10 años de vender su producto, ella necesita comprar un fardo de ropa porque el que compro la vez anterior le salio ropa que no vendio mucho y se quedo con mucho producto, es que le dieron el equivocado y no lo pudo devolver, asi que ahora necesita comprar uno nuevo.
texts.en:
Maritza N. P. is 28 years old and lives with her common-law husband Thomas Guevara who works in the mayor's office in San Lorenzo. They have a 10 year-old son that is a student. She has been working for 10 years selling clothing. She needs to buy a bundle of clothing because the one that she previously bought contained a lot of clothing that didn't sell and so she was left with a lot of merchandise; she was sent the wrong bundle type and couldn't return it so that's why she needs to buy a new bundle now.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bundles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Olive

texts.fr:
A. Olive est née le 05/03/1979 à ABOMEY dans le Département du Zou, au Centre du Bénin. Olive  est mariée et mère de deux filles. Olive vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Depuis son enfance, Olive aidait sa maman à vendre des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Après son mariage, Olive a choisi de vendre de cartes de recharge téléphonique ainsi que des cigarettes. Olive veut avoir dans sa cabine téléphonique les cartes de tous les réseaux de téléphonie mobile du Bénin. En effets, Olive veut développer son centre d'appels téléphoniques. C'est la raison pour laquelle Olive s'est adressé à ALIDé pour avoir l'appui financier nécessaire. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Olive was born on March 5, 1979 in ABOMEY, in Zou County in central Benin. She is married and the mother of two girls. She lives with her family in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. When she was young, Olive used to help her mother sell various goods (candy, cookies, canned milk, sardines, and tomatoes, sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc.) After her marriage, she chose to sell cell phone cards, as well as cigarettes. In her phone booth, she wants to have the phone cards of all the mobile phone networks in Benin. She basically wants to develop her center for making phone calls. These are the reasons why she’s inquiring with Alidé for obtaining the necessary financial support.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone card for all the mobile networks in Benin

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Clotilde es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Clotilde tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende frutas por mayor, sus productos los compra en la selva ayacuchana.
Clotilde necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de naranja y mandarina.
Los sueños de Clotilde son construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a member of the Maria Celeste Community Bank. She is married, has 5 children and is 38 years old. Clotilde has a sales post in a market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells fruit at wholesale prices. She needs this loan to purchase oranges and tangerines to sell through her business. Clotilde dreams of building her own home and that her children grow to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de naranja y mandarina. (To purchase oranges and tangerines)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace D. is thirty-one years old. She is married and blessed with three kids. Currently, they are all pursuing education in primary school. Grace lives together with her family in a family house in a town called Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard as a resourceful mother to support her family and help provide for the kids' school fees. She operates a cold store and sells assorted fishes. She procures her stock of fish from big-time fishmongers at the fishing harbor who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Grace, most of her customers are food vendors and individual households in her community.

Grace believes this loan will enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually to help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Mo din mmo ("hard work") Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure assorted fishes in bulk.

loans.name: Noura

texts.en:
Noura is a 47 year old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and their four children. Noura has owned a grocery store since 2003. She also sells fruits and vegetables. Noura requested a loan of 2300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. Noura has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.  
Her previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Noura is favored because she knows how to treat her clients well. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues. Noura decided on running the store because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Noura will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед Нуралиев проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 34 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Чамшед более 8 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает кукурузу и овощи. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Jamshed N. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has five children. Jamshed has been in the agriculture for more than eight years. He mainly grows corn and vegetables. The client is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita R. is from the town of Lawigan, Catarman Camiguin. She is 41 years old. Elsita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Elsita has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,150 PHP a month from these activities.

In October 2008, Elsita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Elsita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elsita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Mary Josephine

texts.en:
MARY JOSEPHINE R. of Punta Cabahug, Brgy. Zone 5, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental is 49 years old, and married with 5 adult children. She has been earning a living making and selling dried fish for the last 10 years, which earns about PHP 7,000.00 per month.

Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 to gain access to much needed capital for her business. She has since then used all of her loans to gradually expand her production capacity so that she could earn more money tp support her family.

Josephine is now on her 20th loan cycle and she wants to again use the PHP 12,000.00 she is borrowing to enable her to buy more fish to dry and sell. She continues to work hard so that she could obtain financial security for herself and her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: INGREDIENTS FOR DRIED FISH PRODUCTION

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas M. is from the village of Mambajao Camiguin. He is twenty-nine years old and single with two school-age children. To make a living, Tomas owns and operates a service-based business, providing "motorela", (common public transportation in the Philippines via tricycle), to local community members. Tomas has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In July of 2009, Tomas joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Tomas is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Sherill Jane

texts.en:
Sherill Jane A. is a resident of Barangay Vista Alegre in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now 27 years old and finished a secondary level of education. Due to financial difficulty, she was not able to pursue her studies in college.

Sherill works hard and helped her parents to earn a living until she married her husband, Darwin A.. They are blessed with a child who is Stephanie Joyce, 8 years old. Being responsible parents, they want their child to be successful someday.

With this in mind, Sherill wants to borrow PHP 20,000 from Kiva lenders as additional business capital. With the amount she wants to obtain, she hopes that her business income will be increased. That way, she will be able to earn more, little by little, for the future welfare of her family, especially for their only child.

Sherill’s husband works as a technician in Barangay Quirino Solano, Nueva Vizcaya, while Sherill is engaged in buying frozen foods that she sells in their rural village at a higher price so she can generate income. She aims to acquire more products to sell but she does not have enough capital. That is why she is asking for financial capital from Kiva. Furthermore, she will also start a hog-raising business with some of the loan she is requesting.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es: Doce mujeres deciden agruparse en una asociación denominada “Siempre Alegres”, se reúne quincenalmente en el centro focal Villa Exaltación. Actualmente su presidenta es Ana García, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa interior,  las demás socias tienen distintos negocios, por ejemplo, Olga vende cotillones, Remedios vende carne de cerdo, Sara confecciona disfraces, Natalia realiza tejidos artesanales, Máxima vende meriendas.  La asociación Siempre Alegres necesita comprar  mercadería para incrementar sus ventas, esto les permitirá obtener mayores ingresos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
Twelve women decided to become a part of an association called “Siempre Alegres” (Always Joyful). The group meets biweekly at the Villa Exaltacion communal banking center. The current president is Ana G.. She works in the sale of undergarments and the other members have different businesses. For example: Olga sells party favors, Remedios sells pork, Sara crafts costumes, Natalia does artisanal weaving, and Maxima sells snacks. The Siempre Alegres association needs to purchase merchandise in order to increase its sales. This will enable them to acquire larger incomes for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MERCADERIA

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is forty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Joyce is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar. She prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Joyce buys her raw materials from nearby towns. She has been in business for over twenty – two years and wants a loan to buy food stuffs and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es una socia colaboradora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de tres hijos, menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se desempeña como docente de educación. Cecilia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Ricardo Palma” desde hace cinco años. El primer crédito que recibió fue para comprar gaseosas para vender.
Ahora ella requiere un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar golosinas al por mayor. La meta de Cecilia es tener un negocio bien surtido de abarrotes en general.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a collaborative and dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 41 years old and the mother of three young children. Cecilia sells candy and beverages and has the support of her husband, who has a teaching position. Cecilia has been part of the “Ricardo Palma” communal bank for the past five years. The first loan that she received was to purchase sodas to sell.

Now Cecilia needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will use to purchase wholesale candy. Cecilia’s goal is to have a well-assorted general grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale candy

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mr. Lim V., age 35, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community. He currently earns an average of $4.50 a day and has been running his service at least five years. Lim V. is the father of two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife, Sok Pheak, raises pigs and sells some groceries from home. 

Lim V. requests a loan of $500 for his wife to purchase more piglets to raise, as well as buying more groceries for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more piglet to raise, as well as buying more groceries for sale

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Salome M.  from Tukuyu. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 18 and 24. Salome has been running a clothes business since 2006. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week Salome currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Salome thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Ella forma parte de la directiva de la Banco Comunal Los Ángeles en la ciudad de Portoviejo este banco está formado por 20 socias, y es  en casa de Ángela  donde se reúnen.

Ángela esta casada tiene una niña de 10 años, el esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Quito viene a casa cada 15 días, ella se dedica  a la compra y venta de productos lácteos como queso y yogur,  este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su padre de quien  aprendió esta actividad;  hace 8 años viene realizando este trabajo que lo complementa con sus estudios que pronto se graduará  de Ing. Comercial, también se desempeña como promotora de productos en eventos.

Ángela se abastece de queso  en el mercado cantonal y el yogurt pide  a las fabricas en Aloag en la provincia de Pichincha, semanalmente adquiere dos quintales de queso  y 400 pomos de yogur que los comercializa  en la feria libre en  un cantón a una hora de  Portoviejo, viaja con su padre  y el hermano todos los domingos muy temprano para ubicarse en un buen lugar de la feria  y hasta las 10H00 terminar con su mercadería porque tienen sus clientes fijos.

Con el préstamo solicitado nuestra socia comprará un pedido grande de  productos lácteos,  ya  que en ésta época es muy escaso el queso por la  poca producción  y no quiere que afecte a sus ventas  pues en algunas ocasiones no han podido  cumplir con el pedido de queso para sus clientes  por  lo que Ángela viajará hasta los productores mayoristas para abastecerse de dicho producto.
texts.en:
Angela is a board member of the communal bank "Los Angeles" in the city of Portoviejo. This bank has 20 members, and they meet in Angela's house. Angela is married and has a 10 year-old daughter. Her husband works in the city of Quito; he comes to the house every 15 days. She has a business buying and selling dairy products such as cheese and yogurt. She started this business with the help of her father, from whom she learned the business. She has been in this business for 8 years, which she carries out along with her studies. Very soon, she will graduate from Ing. Comercial. In addition, she works as a product promoter at events. Angela gets her supplies of cheese in the Cantonel market, and she orders her yogurt from the factories in Aloag in the Pichincha province. Each week she buys two hundred pounds of cheese and 400 bottles of yogurt which she sells in the free market in a town one hour from Portoviejo. She travels with her father and brother every Sunday very early to find a good spot in the market, and by 10am she is finished with her merchandise, because she has regular customers. With the loan she requests she will buy a large order of dairy products, since in this season there is always a shortage of cheese due to low production, and she does not want her sales to be affected. On a few occasions she has not been able to fill her orders of cheese for her customers. For this reason Angela will travel to wholesalers to obtain sufficient supplies of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy dairy products such as cheese and yogurt

loans.name: Juana Yadira

texts.es: La señora Juana Yadira L. O. tiene 41 años de edad y vive en el Barrio de los Laureles Norte, es madre soltera, sus hijos tiene las edades de 18 y 20 años de edad, sus hijos son independientes y sobreviven realizando labores temporales, su mayor logro en la vida sería el poder realizar unas mejoras en el hogar y poderles ofrecer una mejor vivienda para sus hijo pero este logro lo consumara a medida que pueda conseguir mayores ingresos, es por esta razón que ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar ropa nueva y poder fertarla para el periodo navideño pues es de una alta demanda y planea aprovechar la temporada, esto beneficiaria la economía del hogar y brindaría mejores condiciones sociales para la familia L..
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Yadira L. O. is 41 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. She is a single mother of two children, ages 18 and 20, who are independent and support themselves by doing temporary work. The greatest achievement she would like to obtain in life is to make a few home improvements in order to provide better living conditions for her children. She needs to continue generating better earnings to achieve this goal, so she is requesting a loan to buy new clothing to sell for the Christmas season. Since demand is higher during this time of the year, she plans to take advantage of the season. This will benefit her household finances so that she can provide better conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell for the holiday season

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose P. sells local gin at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for 3 years. She is 32 years old and married, with two children who are excelling in school. Her husband is a driver in a private company. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.)  Bose needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more local gin to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina P. is from the village of Lower Mainit, Iligan City. She is thirty-six years old. Edelina is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Edelina owns and operates a specialized retail business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling gold. Edelina has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edelina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Edelina's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Lower Mainit, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 28-year-old married man who has one child. He opened a small photocopier shop in his town in 2009, but he has been involved in this sector for the past 15 years. He sells cartridges, paper, folders and photography films, etc. in addition to offering photocopying services. Ghassan is appreciative of his new business income and is now asking for a loan of $1000 USD to buy an additionA. photocopier machine to satisfy the demand of his customers, especially students.

loans.use: To buy an additional photocopier machine

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Madame Jeannette M. est une femme mariée de 38 ans qui habite a la cite Ndiobene dans la banlieue de Guediawaye. Elle est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2009. Elle est mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 18 ans. Madame M. fais du mareyage et vend du poisson depuis 5 ans. Ne voulant pas rester inactive,  elle  a pris l’exemple des femmes de son quartier qui exercent cette activité et qui en tire profit. Sa préférence se focalise sur la période de froid ou il y’a plus de poissons. C’est la période la plus favorable aux bénéfices. La rentabilité de son activité primaire lui a permis d’ouvrir un local ou elle exerce la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  destine a l’achat de ces produits en vue de renforcer son activité secondaire. Elle s’adonne aussi à la vente de glace. Le prêt l’aide à augmenter son fond de roulement et à supporter certaines charges de ses enfants. Son souhait le plus ardent est d’ouvrir une buvette chez elle qu’elle va exploiter.
-
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeannette M. is a married woman who is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ndiobène in the Guediawaye suburb. She has been a member of U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) since July 2009. She has six children, the ages of whom range from two to 18 years old. Mrs. M. is a fish merchant and has been selling fish for five years. Not wanting to remain inactive, she followed the example of other women in her neighborhood who carry out this activity and make a profit from it. She prefers to focus on the cold season when there are more fish. This is the best season to make money. The profitability of her primary acitivity has allowed her to open a shop where she sells cosmetic products. She is applying for a loan of 100,000 francs to buy these products in order to strengthen her secondary activity. She has also taken to selling ice-cream. The loan will allow her to increase her working capital and cover certain expenses relating to her children. She has a burning desire to open and run a refreshment stall at her house.. -

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Ludah

texts.en:
Ludah S. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 34 years old. Ludah is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ludah owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal beauty products like makeup, beauty soap, cologne, whitening lotion and many more. Ludah has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ludah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ludah is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ludah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norie

texts.en:
Norie is thankful she has a farm to till. It is what her family depends on for food, clothes and their other needs.

At 52, Norie now has five children with her husband Percival. Like other mothers, she only wants the best for her children. She helps her husband till their farm to keep up with her family’s increasing needs. She chose to plant rice crops because it is a basic need among Filipino homes, thus easier to sell.

Norie currently needs inputs for her rice farm. She applied for a loan of Php 14,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use it to acquire seed, fertilizer and other inputs. She would also be able to pay the laborers who helped work on her farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs and to pay laborers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
