Agnes R. is from the town of San Jose, Tarlac. She is 53 years old, married, and has 3 grown children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing jeepney transport in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Agnes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela U. is 25 years old and  single. She runs a medicine store where she sells various kinds of medicines. Angela has been in this business for over two years. Angela says her business is moving fine, and with the profit derived she is able to take care of her needs and to continue the business. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Angela says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 30 years old and has two children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over ten years.
Flordeliza joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Samrith

texts.en: Mrs. P. has been married for years and is blessed with two kids, all of whom are young. She is married to Samphors, 39, who drives a motorbike taxi. Mrs. P. used to be a laborer in a garment factory. Because this work only provided her with a small salary that was not enough to contribute to her family, she started selling goods in front of the taxi park. Mrs. P. sells items like snack food and soft drinks to passengers who wait to take taxis. By doing this, she hopes she will be able to earn much more income to fulfill all of her family's needs. Because she has just started the business, it may not go well due to lack of capital. Therefore, Mrs. P. has decided to pursue a loan from Kiva through HKL’s project. She will use the money to purchase more inventory for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Inabat's Group

texts.en: Inabat S. is the leader of this group. She is 44 and married. Her husband works as an electrician and they have three sons and a daughter. The older son and the daughter are farmers and the other children are students. Inabat owns a piece of land on which she cultivates fruits and vegetables. She also breeds cattle and sells milk. She has been doing this for eighteen years and in this way she makes 5,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fertilizer for her farming activity. In the future Inabat plans to repair her house and save some money to contribute to her son’s wedding. Abdurahman S., 45, is married. He works as a security guard and his wife works as a cleaner at a school. They have two daughters and a son: the older daughter studies at school but the others are not yet old enough. In order to make money Abdurahman also breeds cattle which he has been doing for twenty years. By selling some animals after fattening, he makes him 3,000 soms per month. Now he has applied for the loan because he needs money to purchase a calf to raise. Inoyathon A., 36, is divorced. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 7,000 soms, she started to breed cattle. By selling some cattle after fattening, she makes 3,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future she plans to repair her house. Aitbu S., 45, is divorced. She has raised two sons: the first son went to Russia to work to earn some money and the second works in the factory in Bishkek. Aitbu works as a nurse and receives 2,500 soms per month. She also has a piece of land where she cultivates corn. By selling the harvest, she makes 5,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan she plans to purchase fertilizer for her farming activity. In the future she wants to purchase a plot of land and build a new house for her son. Mahsadhan S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 46, a widow, and she has a son and a daughter. The son went to Russia to work to earn some money and the daughter helps at home with housework. Mahsadhan works as a nurse in the hospital and receives 2,500 soms per month. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 2,000 soms, she began to breed cattle. By selling some cattle after fattening, she makes 3,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase a cow. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 29 year old married lady with two children. She has been running a taxi business for six years. Hannah joined Levites group in Faulu, Kenya in order to access a loan. Through the group, she saves money every week and has used her savings to improve her business and employ one person. Hannah also rears poultry and dairy cows for extra income. She has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy chicks. She hopes to enlarge her farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicks.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, D. 53 años D. edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos, Yanet, Letner y Brechman D. 20,18 y 17 años. Juntos residen en la localidad D. Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donD. tiene su propia casa. Para Antonia, “la clave del éxito D. una persona radica en el trabajo constante y el saber aprovechar las oportunidades”; es por ello que tiene esa tranquilidad mesurada, no se nubla por nada del mundo, ya que ella reconoce que el mundo es cambiante y para ello siempre trata D. estar preparada ante cualquier evento que se le presente. Hoy su producto es reconocido en su localidad, esto es debido a la calidad y al buen servicio que trata a cada uno D. sus clientes, desD. luego que percibe buenas ganancias económicas. Usualmente trabaja con su familia, y juntos hacen un buen equipo D. trabajo, solo que en temporada D. cosecha tienen a cargo D. sus peones para que lo pueda facilitar la extracción D. su producto y venderlo en los centros D. acopio D. su localidad a un precio competitivo. Sus planes a futuro es abrir un negocio D. abarrotes con el propósito aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual segura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma D. pagos, además se siente contenta con su banco comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí.
Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra D. cacao D. otros productores, con la finalidad D. que pueda cumplir la demanda que tiene.
texts.en:
Antonia, 53 years old, is married and has 3 children: Yanet (20), Letner (18) and Brechman (17). They live in the Santa Rosa locality, located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, where Antonia has her own house. For Antonia 'the key to success lies in constant work and the knowledge to take advantage of opportunities'. Because of this outlook Antonia has a measured calmness and nothing throws her, as she recognises that the world is changeable and she tries to be prepared for whatever event presents itself. Antonia's product is well-known in her locality, owing to the quality and good service she provides to each and every customer, and for a long time she has maD. good profits. Usually Antonia works with her family and together they make a good working team - only during harvest time do they have to contract agricultural labourers to extract their product and sell it in the stock centres in her zone at a competitive price. Antonia's future plans are to open a grocery store with the view to increasing her earnings. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to faithfully comply with the repayment timeline. Antonia is happy with her communal bank as everyone supports each other. With this loan Antonia will invest in purchasing cocoa from other producers so she can meet the demand she has.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cocoa to meet demand

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 28 years old, married with two children.  Celestin owns a shop where he sells a variety of goods and he has owned this shop for about two years.  His shop is open from 6 am until 8 pm every day.

Celestin is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once given this loan, Celestin will hopefully increase his sales as well as his profits.  In addition to that, he will start selling foodstuffs as they are highly demanded by a large number of his customers.  Celestin hopes for a better future in his business.

loans.use: A variety of goods to sell in his shop

loans.name: Cristhian Giovanny

texts.es: Cristhian es transportista público, es decir, es un chofer asalariado que cuenta con su propia movilidad. En el plano familiar  tiene dos hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres la cual esta en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Solicita su primer crédito a través de Kiva para la conversión de gasolina a GNV de su herramienta de trabajo, esto le  generará un ahorro del 60% de combustible.
texts.en:
Cristhian works in public transportation. That means that he is a salaried driver who has his own vehicle. In regards to his family, he has two children. They live in his parents’ house, which is in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. He is requesting his first loan with Kiva in order to convert the vehicle he uses for work from gasoline to GNV (natural gas). This will produce a 60% savings on fuel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for conversion from gasoline to natural gas

loans.name: Azizahon's Group

texts.en: Azizahon A., 33, is married and she has the status of being this group’s leader. Her husband earns his livelihood by working as a private builder. The couple is raising two sons: the elder one is a schoolboy and the younger goes to kindergarten. The family has its own business: they earn money by keeping poultry, a business they started after they had moved to their new house. Azizahon hopes to obtain a loan in order to purchase hens for further breeding. In the future, Azizahon wants to build a bath-house, a kitchen, and to install gates. Hilola A., 23, is not married and lives with her parents. She is the treasurer of the group. Her mother works in a school and her father went to Russia in order to earn money. The family has its own business cultivating agricultural products and out of their profits they have managed to install gates. Hilola hopes to obtain a loan in order to purchase cellophane (a thin, transparent sheet made of regenerated cellulose) for her hothouse plants. In the future, she is planning to obtain a dowry, to marry, and to finish building her house. Gairatjon B., 31, is married and has no children. He makes his bread by being a farm member. He and his wife run their own business: keeping poultry and breeding hens. In the course of three years they have managed to increase the number of their poultry. The purpose of this loan is to purchase more hens for breeding. In future Gairatjon is planning to do major house repairs, to build a bath-house and a kitchen, and to install gates. Hakimjon K., 35, is married and is a farmer. He and his wife raise two children, a son and a daughter, both of whom go to school. The family earns money from running their own business: eleven years ago they were excited to receive a cow as a gift and, since then, they have bred cattle. In the course of working hard they have managed to build a stable. The purpose or this loan is to purchase cattle for further fattening and resale. In the future, Hakimjon wants to make major house repairs and build a bath-house. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase more hens

loans.name: Irene Adhiambo

texts.en:
Irene Adhiambo A. is 24 years old, married to Maurice Odhiambo Mudenyo who is a mechanic and is a source of additional income for the family. They have one 3 year old child. Their reside in Turner Baker in Kitale-Kenya. She operates in a hardware store selling auto paints and has been in this business for the past two years, earning a monthly profit of Kshs.15,000.

Irene learnt about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and so she is applying for her first loan of Kshs.20,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to buy 10 boxes of paints to add as stock. She plans to purchase her own store with the anticipated profits.

In the future, Irene wishes to expand her business by bringing in a computer to mix colors and to also have the rental houses. Her deeper desire is to see her children realize their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of paints.

loans.name: Janet Maame Afia

texts.en:
Janet maame Afia E. sells yams at Abura. Janet maame Afia has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Janet maame Afia has been selling yams for a year now.  She also also cooks them to sell. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees for their children and utility bills for the home. Her loan will be used to buy more yams for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children's education.

The picture displays some of the yams she cooks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale.

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 18 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el sector Montegrande del distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la comercialización de alfalfa y otros tipos de forrajes. El empezó a trabajar en el negocio ayudando a su padrastro y con el tiempo ha logrado empezar a trabajar por su cuenta sin dejar de apoyarlo. Jesús comercializa sus productos entre los ganaderos de Chosica del Norte (una zona aledaña al lugar en donde reside), el Mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la región) y otros lugares en donde tiene menos clientela.

Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el mantenimiento de su economía. Jesús desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas alfalfa y forraje de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir más ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Jesús es una persona tranquila y bastante entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. En la imagen aparece cortando el forraje que venderá a sus clientes.
texts.en: Jesús is 18 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Montegrande sector of the Reque district, a zone located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For four years he has sold alfalfa and other types of fodder. He started working in this business helping his step-father, and with time he has been able to work for himself without stopping helping his stepfather. Jesús sells his products among the farmers of Chosica del norte (a zone bordering the area where he lives), in the Moshoqueque Market (a wholesale market in the region) and other areas where he has less customers. With the income that he makes from these activities he covers his personal costs and helps his family with their household costs. Jesús wants to expand his business by acquiring more alfalfa and fodder in order to increase his sales and make more income. For this reason, he has decided to request his first loan, 500 soles, from Edpyme Alternativa. Jesús is a calm person who is very dedicated to his family. Those who know him consider him to be an enterprising person who has a great desire to succeed. In the photo he is cutting fodder to sell to his customers.

loans.use: The purchase of fodder to expand the fodder sales business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 35 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijas. Desde hace 3 años, Martha se dedica a la venta de ropa, ya que desde niña fue su mayor anhelo. Gracias a su buen carácter para la venta, le ha dado ventaja para desenvolverse bien en este trabajo, asimismo tiene que renovar constantemente los modelos o diseños de acuerdo a la moda, para que sus clientes no dejen de comprarle. Este trabajo le es muy rentable, con las ganancias puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que esta al pendiente de la moda, sin embargo debe poner todo su esfuerzo para vender su mercadería, tener que recorrer las calles y llegar hacia sus clientes. Con el tiempo, desea poner un bazar de ropa, donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad sus prendas casuales. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para su negocio, es por ello que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el incremento de más prendas de vestir, para abastecerse de las novedades de la temporada.
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old and a loving mother who lives in her own home, along with her husband and two daughters.  For the past three years, Martha has been selling clothing, which had been her greatest desire since childhood.  Thanks to her knack at sales, she's been able to develop this profession very well and constantly needs to update her inventory to keep up with the latest trends, so that her customers will continue to buy from her.

This job is very profitable and her earnings allow her to help her husband with the household expenses.  What she enjoys most is that she is tuned in to the latest trends, but she never the less has to put all of her efforts into selling her merchandise, having to travel the streets to reach her customers.  Eventually, she wants to open a small clothing store, where she'll be able to sell her casual clothing comfortably. 

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and knows that this support will be very beneficial to her business, so she is committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more clothing items in order to be able to stock the latest items for the season.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
May Joy F. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 31 years old. May Joy is single. To make a living, May Joy owns & operates a  sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergents & junk foods in the local community. May Joy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, May Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. May Joy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like beverages & breads. This loan will be May Joy's 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like beverages & breads

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila M. G. es una mujer conocida por su liderazgo  y sueña  con tener su propia tiendita.
Ella tiene ya varios años de dedicarse  a la venta de ropa y artículos de uso personal  por catalogo, visitando sus clientes a sus casas. En este momento ella está solicitando un préstamo de   ₡598 000 (quinientos noventa y ocho mil colones)  para la compra de mas mercancía para vender.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Camila M. G. is a woman who is known for her leadership and she dreams of owning her own small store.  She has been selling clothes and personal use products through a catalog for several years, visiting her customers in their homes.  She is currently requesting a loan for 598,000 colones so that she can buy more merchandise to sell.  She is a member of the 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete' (Canalete Communal Credit Company) which is one of EDESA's 100 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 27-year-old single man.  He runs a retail shop where he sells vehicle spare parts.  He earns extra income from tailoring.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard in his business.  He dreams of opening other outlets in the future.  He needs 40,000 KES to buy spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for resale

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza M. de 45 años de edad, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Ella es madre muy responsable, quien vive junto a su compañero de vida y así mismo junto a sus dos hijos de: 13 y 8 años de edad. María es una persona muy conocida y quien cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos no solo por ser una persona responsable, sino también por ser alguien muy amable y que atiende de la mejor forma a sus clientes. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos la cual está ubicada en su casa de habitación, negocio gracias al cual puede contar con todo lo necesario en el hogar. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir su tienda y de esta forma ofrecer todos los productos que son necesarios en el hogar, así mismo desea poder. Lo que más desea María es el poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y aprovechar la oportunidad que la vida le ha brindando de poder ganarse la vida de una forma segura.
texts.en:
María Esperanza M. is 45 years old and lives in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department.  She is a very responsible mother who lives together with her life partner and her two children aged 13 and 8.  María is a very well-known person who has very good references from her neighbors not only for being a responsible person but also for being a kind person who always serves her customers well.  She owns a general store which is located in her home.  Through her business, she is able to provide her household with everything they need.

María is requesting a loan so that she will have the money she needs to stock her store and thereby be able to offer her customers everything they need for their households.  What María most desires is to be able to improve her financial stability and take advantage of the opportunity that life has given her to earn a living in a secure manner.

loans.use: To buy basic household products to sell

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Imomali

texts.ru: Бобохонов Имомали проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 42 года. Он женат. Имеет 6 детей. Уже восемь лет как занимается растениеводством. Он в основном арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en: Imomali B. lives in the region of Vahdat. He is 42 years old. He is married and has six children. He has been in agriculture for eight years. He mainly rents out a plot of land where he grows vegetables for reselling. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso Group

texts.en:
Mirlanda is one of many enterprising women who sells goods, like rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, canned products, vegetables and other products. She is a young mother of 3, and they live together with her long term partner. Mirlanda's most difficult challenge is to work hard to own her own home. While she works to reach her dream, she will continue enjoying to work and attending to her family. She is part of the group called Luz y Progreso, which consists of 10 micro-entrepreneurs from the city of Samana, located in the northeast coast.

She is receiving her 6th loan from Esperanza International. Thanks to her prompt repayments, she has been able to strengthen her business and make good investments. Her plans for this new loan are to invest in the purchase of food & musical equipment. The earnings will be reinvested in more goods and savings. Mirlanda is grateful for the support.

loans.use: Purchase food & musical equipment

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Nataly, de 23 años, vive en casa de su madre en compañía de ella y de su pequeño hijo de tres años y sus hermanas menores; juntos buscan progresar cada día. Desde hace tres años, esta empeñosa joven trabaja para una empresa inmobiliaria y se dedica a la atención en un puesto de venta de terrenos ubicada en una zona joven del cono norte de la ciudad. Le va muy bien en esta labor pues es tranquila y puede repartir su tiempo para atender su pequeño puesto de venta de jugos que tiene en un mercado de la zona, y las dos actividades le proporcionan buenas rentas por lo que puede ayudar a su madre en los gastos del hogar. Dice que por el trabajo no puede pasar mucho tiempo con su pequeño, pero sabe que debe trabajar para sacarlo adelante, pues es madre soltera, y como es una mujer emprendedora tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en una pieza de la casa de su madre. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nataly tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de gaseosas e ingredientes que necesita para surtir mejor su jugueria, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias y continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Nataly, age 23, lives in her mother’s house along with her mother, her small son, age 3, and her three younger sisters. Together, they try to make progress each day.

For three years this diligent young woman has worked for a real estate business in a sales office located in a new area in the northern part of the city. She does very well in this job since it is quiet, and she can devote part of her time attending to the small juice stand which she has in the neighborhood’s market. The two jobs give her good income so that she can help her mother with the household expenses. She says that because of her work she isn’t able to spend much time with her little one, but she knows that since her mother is single she should work in order to get ahead. Nataly is an enterprising woman who plans to open a food shop in a part of her mother’s house.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her installments on time because she doesn’t want to make a bad impression on the people who made this loan possible. It will permit her to continue working to make progress. Nataly plans to invest the loan in the purchase of soft drinks and ingredients that she needs to better supply her juice stand. In this way she hopes to improve her earnings and to continue to get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and ingedients for stocking her juice stand.

loans.name: Carina Maricela

texts.es: Carina tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres en la parte rural del distrito Mochumi, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Desde hace 2 anos, cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. También se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral. Cría los animales y cuando alcancen un tamaño y peso ideal, los vende en su bodega a sus vecinos y los negociantes que suelen visitar su región. Realiza esta actividad en un pequeño terreno cerca de su casa. Su negocio cuenta con buena acogida y ya es muy conocida en la zona. Por eso, tiene una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería y suministros escolares para vender durante la temporada escolar que recién ha comenzado en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carina is 20 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in the rural part of the Mochumi District, an active agricultural and commercial area which is located over half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  For two years she has been running a small store out of her home, selling groceries and basic needs products.  She also raises chickens on a small patch of land she has near her home.  She sells them through her store to neighbors and merchants who visit the region.  

Her store is very well-known and popular in the area so she has a well-established, loyal customer base. She would like to expand her business by buying more merchandise and school supplies to be sold during the school season that just started in Peru.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 800 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise and school supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy dried fish to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for eight years now and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Erlinda would like to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nuriya

texts.ru: Nuriya Zamujem i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Nuriya I. 30 let. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi detmi i mujem. Nuriya uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit kuric i indeyek dlya uvelicheniya i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Nuriya I. is married and has one child.  She is 30 years old.  She in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), a refugee from Fuzuli city, who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her child and husband.  Nuriya has been poultry farming for three years.  Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy chickens and turkeys to enlarge and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is 53 years old, widowed and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store and has applied for a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell to her customers. Her store has been in business for six years and she has repaid 16 previous loans from NWTF. She also runs several other businesses, including a restaurant, a lodging house and stands where she sells dried fish and water. Her main goal is to save money to invest in her businesses.

loans.use: To buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manaen

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Manaen le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa. 
El esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento, ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional de su trabajo. 
Don Manaen ya ha tenido créditos con Kiva y FVP los cuales han sido para mejorar su vivienda y los a pagados puntuales. 
 Espera contar con su cooperación en esta crédito y que planea pagar lo con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como guardia de seguridad de una compañía, ya que su esposa la señora Martha le ayudara con los gastos familiares y escolares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como empleado de limpieza de una casa, particular. 
El señor Manaen y su esposa la señora Martha, desea la seguridad y protección de su familia.
texts.en:
Manaen’s house needs a wall around it.  He’s asking for a loan to buy building materials, concrete blocks and cement, since he will do the work himself on his free time from work.

Manaen has had Kiva and FVP loans before which he’s used to do home improvements; he has repaid them all on time.

He hopes to have your cooperation with this loan that he plans to repay with income he earns working as a Security Guard at a firm since his wife, Martha, will help him meet household and school costs with the salary she earns as a Cleaning Lady in a private home.

Manaen and his wife, Martha, want security and protection for their family.

loans.use: to erect a wall around his house.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong, 53, is a married woman with three children: one son and two daughters. Her husband works in transportation. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

For nearly 10 years, Hong has supported her family through the income she earns from her store that occupies the front of her house. Her store sells a small variety of goods. She intends to take a loan to buy a larger variety of different goods to stock her store and better meet her customers' needs. She hopes her expanded business will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of goods to stock her store

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn, a 30-year-old married mother of five, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop selling ready-to-wear clothing such as t-shirts and blouses for the past two years. A new member of HSPFI, she has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. In the future, Arlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as t-shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Angeles has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Angeles requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials and to repair her fishing boat.

Angeles has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Angeles would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials and to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a single woman who lives in her own house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

For the past ten years, Joice has operated a scrap metal sales business, selling to local neighbors. She also earns additional income by selling cereals and owning real estate houses. Joice faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Joice plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase construction materials, such as cement and sand, to renovate her real estate houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to renovate her real estate houses.

loans.name: Gnin

texts.en: Gnin, 71 years old, is a farmer. Her husband helps to plow the villager’s field. Their income is $4 per day. She stays with one daughter who is a garment factory worker with an income of $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, and $30 on other expenses for the family. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy fertilizer for her field. This loan will help her family to be able to buy seed and fertilize to continue doing farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her field

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has been operating a restaurant for the last five years in Limuru town. She is 40 years old and married to John. Together they are blessed with two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This will be her third loan. She intends to use the loan to add stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour. 

In the future, she hopes to venture into agriculture.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, maize and wheat flour.

loans.name: Olgalidia

texts.es:
La señora Olga lidia, vive en una localidad, muy bonita ya que en  ese  lugar  hay una laguna muy grande y es visitada por muchas personas  madre soltera con un  hijo a su responsabilidad once años.


   Ella es ama de casa  se dedica tambien a la costura de ropas y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de ingredientes  para la  elaboración de panes, así tambien nos cometa que compra  mercancía para surtir su tienda desbarrotes.

   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó hace poco ya  que su mama tambien se de dedica a  alo mismo y decidió practicarlo y le va bien.

   Lo quemas desea es que con estas actividades que practica pueda tener sus  propios ahorros para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Olga Lidia lives in a very pretty place where there is a large lagoon that’s visited by many people.  She’s a single mother of an 11-year-old son in her care.

She is a housewife and also a dressmaker and asked for the loan to buy bread making supplies.  She also mentioned that she will buy merchandise to stock her grocery store.

Her inspiration for this type of activity started a short time ago since her mother also does the same thing and she decided to do it too and does well.

What she wants the most is that with these activities that she carries out she’ll be able to have her own savings to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy bread making supplies.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a focused business man aged 27 and married. For the last two years, he has been doing vehicle repairs and selling spare parts. He has retained his business because of his hard work and determination. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Martha  Alicia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha es una persona  responsable  y  muy  trabajadora que actualmente   tiene  una tienda de abarrotes que  le  permite  obtener  ingresos  para   salir  adelante  día   con  día ,  ella esta muy contenta de habernos encontrado ya que le estamos apoyando para la  realización de   su proyecto   el cual consiste  en la  compra  de mercancía para su negocio para   poder  tener   en existencia  la mercancía   que  le  requieren  sus  clientes ,  ve  en el crédito la posibilidad   de   brindar a  su  familia  una excelente  calidad  de   vida  y  seguir  brindando a  sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio  que   los  caracteriza.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha is a responsible and hardworking person who currently has a grocery store, which allows her to generate income to move forward day after day. She is very pleased to have contacted Credituyo for assistance with completing her project. She plans to buy merchandise for her business so that she will have inventory to meet the requirements of her customers.

Martha views this loan as a possibility of providing her family an excellent quality of life and continuing to offer her customers the excellent service for which she is known.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Khuon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khuon is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She was chosen to be the group leader of this solidarity group loan, which consists of three members. All of them live and work as rice farmers in Kompong Chhnang province. Mrs. Khoun’s husband is a fisherman who fishes in local river and ponds and sells his catch to tradesmen who come to collect the fish every day.
 
Mrs. Khoun is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a fishing boat for her husband. She hopes to use her increased profit to educate her children in professional schools. 

Mrs. Krorn, another group member, is also requesting funds to purchase a fishing boat for her husband.

The other group member, Mrs. Sourng, is a single woman. Along with farming, she also raises pigs at home. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets to raise. 

Mrs. Khoun’s group is grateful in advance to Kiva and its lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man and father of two children. He has been the owner of a grocery store for six years. His store is well known in the region because he works hard to keep it filled with all his customers’ requests. 

He is a hard worker. He has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three years with a good standing history and his previous loans helped a lot in expanding and improving his business. 
 
Ali is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to expand his shop with a special brick tent with glass windows to widen the space and to increase the quantity of products he is purchasing. This will help to increase his income. 

Ali hopes to stay ready to reply to most of his customers’ requests. He also hopes he can expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To expand the width of shop and increase the quantity of products he sells

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana de 41 años de edad es madre de familia, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Ana se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que ha colocado en su domicilio desde hace 5 años, su mercadería lo ofrece en su casa a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos de sus hijos.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.
texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Ana is a mother who lives with her two children at her parents' home.  They have basic utilities in their home, which is located in the Guadalupe District of department of La Libertad.  This area is known for its farming, ranching, and craftwork.

Ana sells clothing for a living.  She set this business up in her residence five years ago.  She offers her merchandise to her customers in her home, as well as delivering orders.  She is trying to create more demand from customers so she can earn more to cover her children's expenses.

Noting that her business was doing better every day, she thought it would be necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy more merchandise and to stock her store with innovative products.  Her goal is to keep increasing her clientele to be able to pay back her loan and improve the quality of life of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to supply her clothing shop.

loans.name: Gueswendbala Tib Songdo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline représente le groupe GUESWENDBALA TIB SONGDO. Mariée, elle est mère de 5 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 1an.4 vont à l’école et elle a 2 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du savon liquide  et parfum depuis  4ans et parallèlement des condiments. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de paglayiri en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 5kg de poudre de savon, 2kg de colorant, une douzaine de parfum et un sac d’oignon.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle prend soin de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et s’occuper de l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Pauline represents the group GUESWENDBALA TIB SONGDO. She is a married mother of five. The oldest is 17 years old and the youngest is one. Four of them go to school and and she is responsible for supporting two people.

For the last 4 years, she has been selling liquid soap and perfume, as well as condiments. Pauline gets her supplies at the Paglayiri market in town. She has both male and female customers.

She would like to buy 5kg of powdered soap, 2kg of colorant, a dozen perfumes and a bag of onions.

With her profits she takes care of her children. Pauline would like to grow her business and provide for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy 5kg of soap powder, 2kg of colorant, a dozen perfumes, and a sack of onions

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 34 years old and single. She lives in an airport community. She stopped her education in 12th grade and obtained secondary education from a cosmetology school. For the past five years, she has been operating a salon in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more hair spray, artificial hair, hair polish, shampoo, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hair spray, artificial hair, hair polish, shampoo, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Akipa Shg Group

texts.en:
Margret is the facilitator of the Akipa SHG group. Margret and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. She is a mother to two children. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for her family. 

In the recent 2011 season, she had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Margret and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Margret will build a house and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Akipa SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 33 year-old businesswoman who is married to Isaac, also a businessman.  They are blessed with one child. She has been running a greengrocery business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,500 which she uses to support her family’s needs.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Janet will use the loan to buy more stock of green vegetables and fruit to add to her business. With the anticipated profits from the business, she plans to save to be able to educate her child. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of green vegetables and fruit to add to her business

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ajok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Luận's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Luận is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising livestock for more than 10 years.
Luận lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as floods, drought. 
The main hardship that Luận faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.
In 2013, Luận joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Luận has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04  Thôn 4- Hoằng Thịnh, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Luận hopes to maintain  a successful business, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his carpentry business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Juana is a married woman with three children: two daughters, 19 and 10 years old, and a son who is 17. She started her business as the result of economic pressure, back when the family was unable to pay the household bills. Her husband's salary was not enough to support the 3 children. She began to investigate what work she could do. About 2 years ago, one of her friends recommended that she sell lingerie and girdles on commission. She decided she'd try that business. Little by little she brought in more clients, which increased her income, since her commissions increased as she sold more clothing.

Juana is applying for a loan of $250 to buy merchandise and fill existing client orders. She is offering to repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. She hopes that you will collaborate with her. Together with her family, she thanks you for supporting them, and helping the family move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Juana es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos, dos hijas una de 19 años y la otra de 10 años y el hombre tiene 17 años. Ella se inicio con el negocio por las necesidades económicas por las que estaba pasando y no podían cubrir los gastos del hogar, ya que el sueldo de su esposo era insuficiente y tenían que mantener a tres hijos, por ello, empezó a investigar en que podía trabajar y una de sus amigas le recomendó hace como dos años atrás la venta de ropa interior y fajas reductoras por los cuales pagan comisión, ella entonces decidió probar este negocio. Poco a poco fue teniendo más clientes y por ello sus ingresos mejoraban, ya que mientras más vende mayores comisiones recibe.

Juana esta solicitando un préstamo por US$ 250 para comprar mercancía y poder surtir a sus clientes ya que tiene varios pedidos por atender y ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 3 a 6 meses. Espera que colabores con ella y junto con su familia, te agradecen por el apoyo que les das, para salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, 33, is married with 4 children; her husband works in the fields planting maize. She travels to the city of San Cristobal, two hours away, to buy clothes for children and women to sell from her house to the people in her neighborhood. She belongs to the Lanza 3 group which includes Margarita Cruz Bautista (sales of prepared chicken), Lina Zuniga Vasquez (wholesale bread sales), Bonifacia Molina Coello (who raises pigs). With the loan, all hope to expand their businesses, by buying necessary equipment or supplies to stock their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

ELENA, esta casada, tiene 33 años, 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo en la siembra del maíz, ella viaja a la ciudad de San Cristóbal a 2 horas de su casa a comprar ropa para niños y mujeres y luego las vende en su casa entre las gentes de su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Lanza 3 y las otras integrantes son: MARGARITA CRUZ BAUTISTA (venta de pollo trozado), LINA ZUÑIGA VASQUEZ (compra pan por mayoreo en la ciudad y luego lo revende en su comunidad), BONIFACIA MOLINA COELLO (se dedica a la crianza de puercos). Con el préstamo todas esperan incrementar sus negocios comprando ya sea implementos de elaboración o materias primas para abastecer sus negocios..

loans.use: Clothing sales.

loans.name: Sonia Araceli

texts.es:
Sonia is a hard working enthusiastic woman, married and mother of two children. As her husband’s salary is insufficient to cover the family’s needs, for the past two years Sonia has dedicated herself to cosmetics, shoes and bijouterie sales. Having associated with a neighbor, together they have managed to increase their clientele and offer a good service.

Presently Sonia has requests that she has not been able to meet. In order to buy more merchandise, she is requesting a $250 loan, that she promises to repay in four months. Take part in the development of this business. You can make this family’s life better. Don’t give it a second thought.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo recibe un salario muy bajo, insuficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, por lo que, desde hace dos años, Sonia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, zapatos y joyería. Se asoció con una de sus vecinas y juntas han logrado incrementar sus clientes y ofrecerles un buen servicio.

Actualmente Sonia tiene pedidos que no ha podido surtir, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de mercancía y se compromete a devolver en 4 meses. Forma parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio; tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia; no lo pienses más.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise
